loans.name: Xecaxjojense Group

texts.en:
Doña Santos, Doña Paula and Doña Teresa have joined together to form a solidarity group named Xecaxjojense. The group leader, Doña Santos, would like to use her portion of the loan to purchase traditional blouses for resale. She has been selling traditional blouses for 5 years and would like the opportunity to increase her sales and income. She started out in the business selling clothing as an employee for someone else, but she prefers to work independently and have the opportunity to grow her own business. 

Santos is 40 years old, single, and has 6 children. She went to school long enough to learn how to read and write which has helped her tremendously to run her own business. She would love to, one day, run a large clothing store in her community. 

The other two members of the Xecaxjojense Group are involved in animal raising and plastic goods sales. Both will use their portion of the loan to help grow their respective businesses.

loans.use: to purchase blouses for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en: Ma. Corazon P. is single and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. Ma. Corazon is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more stock to sell.  Ma. Corazon has been in this business for three years. She also earns additional income from room rentals.  In the future, Ma. Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mohamadou

texts.fr:
Né vers 1970 à Djidieni préfecture de Kolokani, Monsieur Mohamadou est marié à une épouse, père de 4 enfants et vit chez lui même dans le quartier Koko de la préfecture de Koutiala. Après l’abandon de l’école coranique qu’il fréquenta jusqu’au niveau secondaire, Il s’intéresse à l’achat vente de colas  et diverses marchandises qu’il a appris  auprès de son  père il y a plus de 20 ans et l’exerce actuellement pour lui même au grand marché  de Koutiala depuis 10 ans.  Il est très sollicité lors  des foires hebdomadaires de Koutiala ville et environnants. 
Pour diversifier son activité, il décida de faire recours à l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux mois.  Il est à son 1er prêt individuel. Monsieur Mohamadou compte acheter 4 paniers de colas avec ce  prêt. Il s’approvisionnait  auprès des commerçants grossistes de Koutiala, mais avec l’augmentation du fonds de commerce, il compte aller à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  il  vend tous les jours ses colas dans le grand marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle composée de femmes et hommes  en espèce. Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt et utiliser  le reste pour payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Born near 1970 in the Djidieni prefecture of Kolokani, Mr. Mohamadou is a married father of four who lives in the Koko neighborhood of the Koutiala prefecture.  After leaving the Koranic school that he attended until the secondary level, he began selling kola nuts and various products, a business that he learned from his father over 20 years ago and has been practicing on his own in the Koutiala market for ten years.  He is in high demand in the weekly markets of Koutiala and the surrounding area.

To diversify his business, he decided to turn to the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso two months ago.  This is his first individual loan.  Mr. Mohamadou plans to buy four baskets of kola nuts with this loan.  He was buying his products from wholesale sellers in Koutiala, but with the increase in business funds, he plans to go to Bamako (the capital of Mali).  He sells his kola nuts every day in the Koutiala market to a customer base made up of women and men who pay in cash.  He hopes to make a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA that he plans to use to pay back the loan, using the rest to pay his children’s school fees and care for his family.

loans.use: to buy baskets of kola nuts.

loans.name: Manuel Asencio

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 37 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la agricultura, ganadería, comercio y turismo.

Manuel desde hace algunos años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su casa, para su mayor seguridad y comodidad, además puede atender a sus clientes a cualquier hora.  Con las ganancias que obtenga por las ventas de sus productos podrá solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Para poder ampliar un poco más su negocio necesita efectivo, por lo mismo ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más productos para su tienda y así tener contentos a sus clientes, con la intención de que se incrementen sus ventas para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 38 and currently lives with his wife and child. He has his own home which has electricity and water, and is located in the district of Chepen in the department of La Libertad. This zone is characterized by agriculture, farming, business and tourism. 

Miguel has worked for several years selling groceries from him home, for better security and comfort and also being able to attend to his clients at whatever hour. With the earnings from his sales he covers the needs of his household. 

The growing demand that Manuel's shop has been experiencing has caused him to consider expanding it by purchasing more products, thus he thought it was a good idea to request from Edpyme Alternativa a loan in the amount of 1,500 soles. 

Manuel is a responsible and enterprising person. He would like to grow as a business owner and be able to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, sugar, and noodles for her grocery store

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
This is Renato, 40, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. He is married to Rosa, a housewife, and is the father of four children. Three of them are studying, while the youngest is still a baby.  At this time, he is working hard to send his children to school.  Renato himself has been a college undergraduate, and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents cam leave to their children.

Renato operates a newspaper stand. In his business, he not only sells newspapers but candies as well, and has pocketbooks(paperback novels) for rent. He buys newspapers from the suppliers and sells them on the sidewalk. To make the newspaper stand a little different from the others, he buys pocketbooks to have them rented or traded. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php267 in sales every day.

To help him continue the operation of his business, he is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to pay for newspaper delivery, new pocketbooks and other products that he can sell in his cart. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Renato dreams of being able to give all his children a good, high quality education through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of products he sells in his business

loans.name: Tenizbek

texts.en:
Tenizbek is a farmer who lives in Kichi-Kemin village. He is 64, married and has three children. He graduated from Automotive College and worked as a mechanic at the local station. In order to find an additional means of subsistence for his family, Tenizbek decided to start his own business in cattle breeding. Using his initial capital of 5,000 soms (KGS), he bought only one calf. His start as an entrepreneur was successful due to strong efforts, and today he has two milk cows, one horse and twenty sheep. Also, for 20 years, Tenizbek has been engaged in his favorite activity – bee farming . At present, he has 40 bee families and earns about 10,000 KGS monthly from selling the products of beekeeping. 

Tenizbek has applied for a loan of 75,000 KGS to buy more milk cows that will allow him to increase his milk sales and increase his number of customers. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 36 years old he is married to Emily  who helps in supporting the family. His child is three years old.

He runs a dairy farming business and he has been in business for three years. Right now his monthly income from the business is KES 30,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 50,000 that he will use to purchase dairy cows for milk production and livestock for sale.

This is his second loan. He successfully paid his previous loan.

He hopes to continue with his dairy farming and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick, 41, is a focused, committed and business-oriented businessman. He is married and blessed with five children who are going to school. For the last 12 years, he has been offering veterinary services to make a living, which he supplements with the earnings he gets from dairy farming. He wants in the next five years to be selling dairy products on a large scale and his dream is to own his own milk processing plant. He is requesting a loan of 45,000 Kenya shillings to buy a computer and a printer so that he can start a bureau. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya since he is now able to manage his business wisely and effectively.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a printer

loans.name: Epina Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Epina tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de alfalfa ya tiene 3 años en el negocio, se dedico a este negocio viendo a su madre que también se dedicaba a lo mismo y tenia buena rentabilidad, el crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de abarrotes ya que desea poner una tienda en su casa (ya cuenta con andamios y vitrinas); su principal sueño de la Sra. Epina es construir su casa y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Mrs. Epina is 33. She is a single mother of 2 children, one of whom is school-aged. She has sold alfalfa for 3 years. She started this business because her mother also sells alfalfa and Epina saw that this was profitable. She will invest this loan in the purchase of groceries, because she wants to open a store in her home (she already has counters and display cases). Epina's main dream is to build a home and provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in order to open a store.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a green grocer business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. George dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, carrots and onions. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, carrots and onions.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.
La  socia Rosa; tiene 42 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia tiene 3 hijos ; ella se dedica al comercio minorista la socia compra ropa y vende, ella tiene su local en un conocido centro comercial en la ciudad del Cusco, la socia tiene su stand de venta de ropa por temporada, ella viaja algunas veces a la ciudad de Lima donde se encuentran las fabricas de ropa y trae ropa al por mayor como jeans, polos, casacas, camisas para varones y damas; la socia también tiene su proveedor que le envía cuando ella así lo requiere, la socia en esta ocasión desea poder invertir el préstamo del crédito en la compra de un grupo de ropa al por mayor que deberá dar la primera parte a concesión para la entrega de su cargamento así lo denominan. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa al por mayor.
 La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the 'Solidaridad-Chachimayo' community bank which is located in Cachimayo district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Rosa is 42 years old, single, and has three children.  She buys clothes and sells them retail.  She has premises in a well-known shopping center in the city of Cusco.  She has a stand where she sells seasonal clothes.  She sometimes travels to the city of Lima where the clothes factories are and buys clothes wholesale such as men's and women's jeans, polo shirts, jackets and shirts.  She also has a supplier who sends her merchandise when she needs it.  On this occasion, Rosa would like to be able to invest her loan in buying some clothes wholesale.  She must pay up front in order for them to send her the shipment.  She is requesting this loan to buy clothes wholesale.

Rosa is grateful for the support that she is being given and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying clothes wholesale

loans.name: Las Inseparables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS INSEPARABLES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Cascada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Jeanete. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Artesanías en mantas, comercio de golosinas, tienda, comercio.

La señora Luz Karina,  indica hace diez meses que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía (tejido de mantas) que viene trabajando hace veinte años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana), que comprara de la Ceja y posteriormente la elaboración de sus productos los venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación, la atención y el seguro que ayuda a todas.

En la fotografia no aparese la señora Francisca,que por cultura no quizo participar en la misma.
texts.en:
The “Las Inseparables” community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada regional office.  The group has six members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Jeanete.  The businesses that the members of the community bank are engaged in are varied and include: handicrafts (blankets), selling candies, running a store and commerce.

Luz Karina tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for ten months.  She joined through an invitation from a loan officer.  She currently has a handicrafts business (knitting blankets) which she has had for twenty years.

Luz Karina will use this loan to increase her capital (buying yarn).  She will buy her yarn in La Ceja and then make her products which she will sell in the markets.  This work allows her to make money with which to support her family in so far as she is able.  She is single and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Luz Karina replied that she likes the training, the service and the insurance that helps everybody.

Francisca is not present in the photo.  She did not want to be photographed for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Began

texts.en:
Began is a widowed woman with four children who are all married. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself. 

She has operated a clothes selling business for the past five years; in addition she owns a tuk tuk. Her potential clients are the community members. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transport. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans so that she can be self reliant.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is 32 years old and lives in Upper Langcagan, Oroquieta City. She is married with 3 children. Mary Grace has a RTW  business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase clothes for her clothing business. Mary Grace has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: Rhodah Kavutha

texts.en: Rhodah is a Kenyan lady, and she is 27 years old with two children. Her business is selling second-hand clothes. She has had the business for four years. She also sells fruit juice and ice lollies. She intends to use her loan of kes 50,000 to expand the business by buying more clothes. She hopes to employ one attendant to help her run the shop. Her future dream is to open a boutique. The challenges she faces is the lack of enough stock. Rhodah describes herself as cheerful.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Eugenio Felipe

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOQ ALLPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Eugenio Felipe; el tiene 42 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, el socio tiene un taller donde realiza trabajos de artesanía como Keros y otros trabajos en arcilla y luego lo reparte a las diferentes tiendas que venden artesanía en la ciudad de Cusco, el socio también trabaja en una empresa pública, por medio de este trabajo y este negocio el socio saca adelante a su hijo, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los trabajos de artesanía como arcilla y pinturas. 

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “MOSOQ ALLPA” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cuzco, in the province and department of Cuzco. 

This member's name is Eugenio Felipe. He is 42 years old, single and has 1 son. He alternates his daily activities with selling artesanal crafts. He has a workshop where he makes vases and other items out of clay. Later he delivers them to different stores in the city of Cuzco. He also has a job in public works. With that job and this business he is getting his son ahead. He wants to expand the business selling artesanal crafts. He is asking for the loan to buy materials to make the artesanal crafts, such as clay and paints.    

He is happy with the loan and committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy materials to make artesanal items, such as clay and paint.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a widow. Her five children are all grown up. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her grandchildren because some of them are orphans.  

Dama has run a vegetable grocery for the past three years; her clients are her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge which is that she doesn't have a legal permit to do business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Enakhon

texts.ru: Энахон вдова, она целеустремленная и добросовестная женщина. Более 11 лет она занимается купле- продажей парфюмерии и разных игрушек. В этой сфере бизнеса она имеет богатый опыт, и знает свое дело. Она дарит всем хорошее настроение. Энахон хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Энахон запрашивает займ в размере 1000$ США для расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Enakhon is a widow. She is a single-minded and conscientious woman. She has been buying and selling perfumes and various toys for more than eleven years. She has a wealth of experience and knows this business. Her good mood is contagious. Enakhon wants to expand her business and make a greater profit. Enakhon is asking for a loan of $1000 U.S. to expand her business. She looks forward to your help and thanks you in advance for your support and kindness.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema, 48, is a married woman with nine children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cafe that serves her neighbors and passersby. Rehema dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the requested loan of KES 15,000 she wants to purchase food stocks, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase food stocks, wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 44-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and two school-aged children. With the cooperation of his wife, he was able to cover their heavy costs of life in addition to his children’s study fees. His wife has been working in a local company since 2003. As for him, he opened his own bakery inn 2004 and already has 15 years of experience in this job. Today, he wants to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to install a new curtain glass for his bakery. He notes that this will improve his place, which will allow him to attract more clients. In the future, he plans to renovate and expand his bakery.

loans.use: to install a new curtain glass for his bakery

loans.name: Arbayna

texts.en:
Arbayna is 27 years old and married with already three children.

She is in agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Arbayna is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Arbayna has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store and farming coconut.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
My name is Thelma D., I prepare and sell food for breakfast, lunch, burritos, tacos, enchiladas, sodas, snacks. I have had my business for about 5 years, and it helps me support my family. My goal is to be able to employ other people to increase my sales. With the profit I earn I can remodel my business to provide better customer service.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Thelma D. me dedico a la produccion y venta de comida como ser desayunos, almuerzos, burritas de carne, tacos, enchiladas, pastas, refrescos naturales, golosinas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, dicha actividad me ayuda a mantener a mi familia y mi meta es poder darle trabajo a otras personas para que mis ventas se aumente, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder acondicionar mejor mi negocio para una mejor atencion a mis clientes.

loans.use: To buy poultry, pork, and other meats, vegetables, spices, tortillas, dishes, glasses, forks, sodas, foil paper, bags, sauces, oil, butter, sugar, rice, bread, eggs, jam.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
K. has been selling cold drinks along Mandela road in Dar es Salaam for three years now. He buys these drinks from wholesalers and resells them in his small retail shop located in a busy area of Mandela road.

K. could not afford a refrigerator, so he depends on ice blocks which he buys from the Coca-Cola Company. K. wants to improve his business by buying a refrigerator to keep the drinks cold. He therefore requests a loan of USD550 to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Maria Luisa, and I am a merchant. I have a a grocery store in my home. I have several years in this business, which generates income for my family. Thanks to this business, I have sent my children to school. At the moment, one of my greatest needs is to change two doors in my house which are in disrepair.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Maria Luisa, soy comerciante, cuento con una pulperia en mi casa de habitación, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia, gracias a este negocio he dado educación a mis hijos, actualmente una de mi mayor necesidad es cambiar dos puertas de mi casa las que se encuentran en mal estado.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, lard, flour, soap, pastas, dairy products, and cookies.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is married and lives in the community of "Los Casabe" with her husband who works at a construction site. She is the mother of 7 children, 3 of girls and 4 boys.

Antonia sells various kinds of meat to her customers. She sells it on the street to houses and other establishments. On Tuesdays and Saturdays she goes out to sell, and on the other days she prepares the food for sale. She has been in this business for over 10 years.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a widow with two children. They live in Mukachevo, western Ukraine. Nina runs a small vending kiosk selling clothing at the local bus station. She works in a sphere of trade where the demand is always very consistent and high. Nina has been in this business for 15 years. She has always been an active and enthusiastic entrepreneur.

Nina presently has about $1,500 in turnover capital. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase her available capital. She believes the profits she will be able to generate will not only help her keep a stable position in the market but will also offer a better livelihood for her children and grandkids. Nina has been a role model of discipline, accuracy and responsibility. Difficult family circumstances and ill-health have not hindered consistent growth in her business. We believe her perseverant work and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Mehti

texts.en: Ten years ago Mehti started this business. This 30-year-old man is single, lives in Khachmaz region, in the Ashagi-Zeyid village. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow to improve his cattle business.

loans.use: Mehti would like to buy one cow.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra Kpédzokou is 48 years old, married and the mother of four children, all of whom are at school. She is the owner of a small shop in Assahoun, located 70km from Kpalimé, that sells printed fabric. She has 15 years’experience in the business and is a fine woman. Since her husband retired five years ago, she has become the head of the household in terms of taking care of all the household expenses and her children’s schooling. She buys her goods in Lomé and sells them in Assahoun.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Abra Kpédzokou est agée de 48 ans mariée et mère de 04 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est propriétaire d'une boutique de vente de tissu imprimé installée à Assahoun localité située à 70 KLM de Kpalimé. Elle a une expérience de 15 ans dans le secteur et est une brave femme . Son mari étant en retraite depuis 5 ans elle est devenue la responsable du foyer en matière du financement des charges du foyer et de la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle achete les marchandises à Lomé et les revend à Assahoun

loans.use: To buy printed fabric in Lomé to sell in Assahoun

loans.name: Adele

texts.en: Adele is 60 years old and has four children. She lives with her family in the town of Aley, where she sells produce in the local market. In the photo, for example, she is peeling chestnuts before selling them to her customers.  Adele uses her entire income to support her family, and has come to us for a loan to buy more agricultural items to sell. This is the second time this hard-working and energetic woman has applied for a loan, and she made very good use of the first one she received from us.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce to sell to her customers

loans.name: Din

texts.en: Mrs. Din S., 35, works with her husband purchasing bananas from the growers and reselling them for a profit. They can make collectively about $8 each day. She has seven children. Some are students and some are enrolled in school. Mrs. Din S. hopes to use this loan to reinvest in her business by purchasing a larger quantity of vegetables to increase her income.

loans.use: to reinvest in her business by purchasing more vegetables to increase her income.

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es:
Nelva is a mother of a young girl and a hard working salesperson. Every day of the year, and on a daily basis, she manages a small warehouse in her beautiful community ever since five years ago. Thanks to her diligence, this small establishment has turned into the most popular and sought after establishment. She wishes to supply it with a greater quantity of items to satisfy her small, but wonderful clientele who day in and day out, and especially in the mornings, continue to visit her.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Nelva, es madre de una pequeña niña y una trabajadora comerciante. A diario y todos los días del año administra su pequeña bodeguita aperturaza hace cinco años en su bella comunidad; gracias a su diligencia este pequeño establecimiento se hecho el más popular y concurrido y desea dotarlo de mayor cantidad de artículos para complacer a su pequeño gran público que día a día y en especial por las mañanas no deja de visitarla.

loans.use: Increase capital to sell greater quantity of high demand items.

loans.name: Salama's Safinia Group

texts.en:
Salama is 41 years old and is married with 6 children, ages 5-29 years old. Salama started her business in 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $33 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Zahra, who has business dealing in small business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutuA. guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Pouli

texts.en: A mother of three children, Pouli lives in the village of Faleasiu and is now receiving her 4th loan from SPBD. So far, she has been able to always successfully make repayments on time. With the help of her 2nd and 3rd loans, Poui improved her Banana and Taro Chip sales business by purchasing new equipment, as well as paid her children’s education fees. The remainder she saved with SPBD. With the support from her husband who is a taxi driver, Pouli has been able to deliver her product around the village. She used her profits for loan repayment, but also covered her family’s home expenses. In addition, Pouli's business was supported by her family members, who farmed their five acres of banana and taro plantations. Pouli is now requesting a loan of US$1,125, which she will use to buy a new stove and repair her other cooking equipment.

loans.use: Purchase of a new stove and repair of cooking equipment

loans.name: Freedom 2030-G Group

texts.en:
Awadia M., the group leader, has a business selling food at a hotel and has applied for this loan in order to buy furniture for the hotel. Awadia is 30 years old, married, and has two children aged 2 and 8. Her husband is a Minister for education, science and technology and her children go to school. Each week, Awadia makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Awadia is joined in her small group by Awadia Sabit, Grace E., Tereza S., and Mary K.. Awadia Sabit makes tea in a restaurant and would like to buy more sugar, tea leaves and milk. Grace E. currently has a business selling bread and has applied for this loan in order to buy cooking oil and flour to sell. Tereza S. sells onions and tomatoes at the market and would like to open up a shop. Mary K. sells beans and onions at the market and hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy furniture for a hotel

loans.name: Siulepa

texts.en:
Siulepa S., 44, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also friends 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Siulepa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will assist her in operating her business. Her husband assists her business as a financial supporter when he receives his salary from Ott Transport as a full time employee.

loans.use: purchasing equipment such as shovel, bushknife, weedkiller machine, spade, chemicals

loans.name: Kichama's Tusichukiane Group

texts.en:
Kichama is 32 years old, married, and has three children, ages 12, 10, and 5. She became a bites (bread and cake) and coconut seller in 2008. Every day, she works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Kichama now hopes for a loan to buy more bites products and coconuts for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in clothing sales, tailoring, bites sales, and charcoal and firewood sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 28 años, vive solo.  Siempre le agradó la agricultura y gracias a ello logró obtener su independencia económica, y sobre todo ayudar a sus padres. Pero esta labor le toma todo el día, se ocupa de sus chacras desde muy temprano, prepara sus alimentos para luego salir a sus terrenos, esta todo el día  trabajando en limpiar y  abonar la tierra.Como es soltero le agrada su trabajo, aunque es pesado, pero es algo que le agrada realizar, sobre todo abonar sus terrenos, aunque  lo que le resulta difícil es adquirir estos abonos, por su costo altísimo, pero indispensables en todo cultivo.
Lo que le motiva es su futuro, para que cuando tenga su familia pueda ofrecerle lo necesario para su felicidad.
Jaime invertirá en la compra de abonos que mejoren sus productos, sobre todo mantengan a sus terrenos altamente productivos, y con el tiempo tener una familia, ser un gran agricultor y comerciante.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 28 year old single man. He has always worked in agriculture, and because of that he has been able to achieve economic independence and help his parents. His work takes all day, and he works in the fields from early in to morning - preparing his food and taking it with him. He spends the day cultivating and fertilizing his crops. As a single man he enjoys his work, particularly fertilizing his crops. The fertilizer is quite expensive, but it is critical for every crop. What motivates him is a vision toward the future, so that once he has a family he will be able to offer them what they need to be happy. Jaime will invest his loan in the purchase of fertilizer which will improve his product and will keep the production rate of his fields high. Someday he hopes to have a family and to be a fine farmer and merchant.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for agricultural fields.

loans.name: Maulu

texts.en: Maulu T., 53, is married with 3 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the donuts and coconut bun business. She sells to village people 6 days per week. This is her first loan with SPBD.  She would like a loan to purchase ingredients used in her business.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Maulu's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients used in her business

loans.name: Mario Aurelio

texts.es:
El Joven Mario Aurelio P. de edad de 33 años, su estado civil es  acompañado quien tiene 3 hijas con edades de 10 años  quien esta cursando recientemente el 4 grado de primaria, su otra hija tiene 17 años y cursa el quinto año de secundaria y su ultima hija  tiene 3 años de edad que todavía no estudia,  su compañera de vida es ama de casa quien a la vez desempeña el papel de administradora del negocio que tienen, uno de los propósitos que tiene es mantener activo  ambos negocios, otros de sus propósitos es de darle mejoras a sus vivienda ya que esta no posee las condiciones necesarias y así darle a sus hijas un futuro lleno de oportunidades y de estudios.

La actividad económica de Don Mario es una pulpería que expande los productos como: golosinas, galletas, arroz, azúcar,  pollo, gaseosa, detergentes entre otros productos. El tiempo que tiene de tener este negocio es de 1 año, el inicio su negocio con una pequeña canasta que contenía golosinas y al ver que esta tuvo afluencia de clientes fue que decidió invertir un poco mas en su negocio y así logra establecer su negocio en su casa logrando  mas  estabilidad, su otra actividad es la venta de queso y crema que también lleva cabo en su casa de habitación; el motivo de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para tener mas crecimiento en su pulpería  y dar  satisfacción a sus clientes por consiguiente satisfacer su  demanda, e invertirá mas en su negocio y de poder comprar sus productos en un lugar mas favorable a fin que le genere un margen de ganancia mas alto, ya que al comprar por mayor el costo de compra es mas bajo.
texts.en:
Mario Aurelio P., 33, has three daughters: a 10-year-old who is in the 4th grade, a 17-year-old who is in high school, and a 3-year-old. His common-law wife is a stay-home mom, and also manages the businesses they run out of their home. One of Mario Aurelio's objectives is to keep his two business growing, and the second is to make necessary improvements to his house so that his daughters have a future filled with opportunities. Mario Aurelio runs a small corner store in which he sells, among other items, candy, cookies, rice, sugar, sodas, and detergents. He opened this store one year ago. He started with a small stand of candy, and when he saw that sales were good, he invested more in the business until it became the small store that they run out of their home. The other business they have is the sale of cheese and cream. Marco Aurelio is requesting a loan for work capital to expand the corner store and meet his customers' growing demands. He will purchase products at wholesale prices to increase his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: worok capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Qory Qaytu (“Thread of Gold” in Quechua) Village Bank.  Elizabeth is 28 years old and is married with two children. Elizabeth runs a store from her home in the Conchopata neighborhood, where she sells dry goods, vegetables, meat, drinks and ice cream. She works every day.  

Elizabeth needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy rice and sugar. Elizabeth dreams of having a larger business, of offering a wider variety of merchandise, and of saving enough for her children to overcome the obstacles in their lives. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow 
 
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu que significa Hilo de Oro en quechua.
Elizabeth es casada, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Elizabeth tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el barrio de Conchopata, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, bebidas, helados, actividad que realiza todos los días.  
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.  
Elizabeth sueña con tener un negocio mas grande, surtido, ahorrar lo suficiente para que sus hijos se superen.

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Maria Amélia

texts.pt:
Maria Amélia C. é natural de Maputo e tem 42 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos, com idade entre 26, 22 e 15 anos respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta irmãos que vive com eles. Vive na casa própria.

Maria estudou até 8ªclasse e parou quando ficou grávida e assim viu se obrigada a ir ao lar. Tendo ida ao lar aos 16 anos de idade, a sua infância passou com a sua mãe dado que o seu pai morreu mais cedo. Aos 30 anos começou a trabalhar na educação e devido ao salário que era muito baixo deixou e iniciou um negócio de venda de carne o qual desenvolve até data Hoje. O mesmo estabelece um horário das 7:00h até as 15:00h. Com um rendimento mensal de 12000,00mt.

 Para Maria este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o estoque afim de responder da melhor maneira a procura nesta quadra festiva. E pretende pagar antes do tempo afim de solicitar outro para compra de mobília.
texts.en:
A native of Maputo, Maria Amélia C. is a 42-year-old married mother of 3 children (of 26, 22 and 15 years of age). Along with her children, she supports her brothers, who also live with her. Maria lives in her own home. Maria studied up until the 8th year and stopped when she became pregnant and was forced to return to her mother's home. Since she spent her time at home since 16, her childhood was spent with her mother. Her father passed away at an early age. At 30 years of age she began to work in education. Because her salary was low she decided to start her own business selling meat, a job she performs to this day. She works from 7am to 3am. This is Maria's first loan. She intends to increase her stock, especially in response to the holiday season. She also intends to pay back the loan as soon as possible in order to ask for another loan to purchase furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Avegael

texts.en:
Avegael N. is a vegetable vendor in the village of Yeban Sur. She was married to Frederick when she was 18 years old. Their son, Alvin Jay is now six years old and already in elementary school. They are living in an agricultural area where the majority of the residents are farmers and corn is the main crop.  

Avegael chooses to engage in the vegetable vending business to help her husband earn a living with the hopes of uplifting their poor living conditions.  

To further improve her vending business, she wants to ask for a loan of PHP 4,000 which she will utilize to buy different vegetables that she will sell in their neighborhood. Avegael and her husband are also planting vegetable seeds in their backyard so that they do not have to depend too much on their capital. In this way, they can also increase their income. She and her husband will work hard to maintain their livelihood for their family to have a better way of living and for their son to continue his education.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia T. is a 48 year old woman. She is divorced and has six children. One child is in school whiles the rest are taking care of themselves. She lives with her last born and her granddaughter in Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Afia is an achiever and a resourceful woman. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. 

Afia trades fruits such as bananas by the road of Koforidua where she has lived for 10 years. She treks to surrounding villages to purchase bulk stocks of bananas from the farmers and sells them retail to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to buy enough stock to make enough profit to support her family. With a loan of $750, Afia wants to purchase bulk supplies of banana products to enable her to increase business growth. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her family She also wants to use part of the profit to support her child's education. Afia belongs to a village bank called "Nso Nyame ye" which means "with God all things are possible".

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of bananas.

loans.name: Milagros De Cumayasa 1 Group

texts.en:
Yokatsa R. is the representative of a group of five women. These five women are from a group called "Milagros de Cumayasa." The members come from a very poor area in San Pedro, Dominican Republic. When this group first came to Esperanza International, almost none of the members had a steady income, and all were having a difficult time paying for life's basic necessities. Now, through hard work, this whole group is receiving their 4th loan, and are continuing to grow their small businesses. 

Yokatsa is a mother to one young child and wants nothing more than a better life for that child. With her first loan, she started a small beauty salon in her house and now has a very successful business. For the first time in her life, she feels like she has something of her own, and feels like she can provide her child with all the things he needs. She is excited to continue expanding her business, and feels like this next loan will really help her salon. Thanks for all your support!

loans.use: To buy products for her salon

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en: Latifat is 38 years old and married and with three children. She sells medicine to people in her community. She is a LAPO client. She requests a loan of $950 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Muminahon

texts.en:
K. Muminahon is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Khujand and is engaged in selling small wares. It is street trading, and she trades in chewing gum, cigarettes, and packages. Muminahon is a school teacher by profession but she does not work as a teacher because of the low salary. 

Muminahon dreams of eventually opening a serious business, such as a restaurant with national cooking. She is ready to work hard to realize her dream. So, Muminahon has applied for a Kiva business development loan of 2500 STJ to start a business selling flour. Her brother brings the flour from Kyrgyzstan and she intends to sell the flour but needs to open a trade outlet.

loans.use: To start a business selling flour

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia  has sold eggs and chickens in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for the past 2 years. She belongs to the Maendeleo A  loan group (Group code 2015).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more chickens to increase her stock. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Lydia is 29  years old, married, and has three children: ages 10, 5 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more hens and eggs to increase her stock.

loans.name: Josefa Maricela

texts.es: La señorita Josefa tiene 22 años de edad, Soltera de oficios Costurera, “Confección de Pants” cuenta con un taller de 3 maquinas, habita junto a sus padres ellos  se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar pants en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xepatriz del Cantón Nimapa , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Miss Josefa is 22 years old and single. She is a seamstress and has a shop, "Confeccion de Pants", that has three sewing machines. She lives together with her parents, who are also in the same business. They have two employees. She has been making sweat suits for the last 6 years, in her home located at the Xepatriz del Canton Nimapa stop of the Totonicapan department in Guatemala. Currently the demand from her customers has grown, but her financial conditions are not enough for her to increase her capital. This is her reason for coming to ASDIR Association to request a loan, which will be used to purchase raw materials and result in increased sales and better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Kesi

texts.en:
Kesi has been a bites seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to Yarabi tupe Salama group loan (group code: 2030). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $25. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Kesi is 35 years old, married, and has given birth to one child who is now 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa A. is twenty–eight years old. She is married and has two children - one girl and one boy, who are both in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer. Theresa is a trader. She trades in jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, chains, and rings. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She hawks and treks to other markets to sell as well. Theresa has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy jewelry in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Namig

texts.en:
Namig is a 23-year-old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He settled in the village of Boyuk Bahmanli in Fuzuli region.
This young man has 6 years of experience in his business. He sells juices and foodstuffs wholesale.

This young man is married. Now he needs a loan of 1500 AZN to buy foodstuffs and juices to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy juice and foodstuff

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna A. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 23 years old. Lorna is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a sari-sari store (general store). The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Lorna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Isiah's Group

texts.en: K. Isiah is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is a married man with a retail shop as his business on Bufunda Street in Ibanda. He sells products like sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, flour and many others and he is able to make profits between 250,000/= - 400,000/= and he attributes this to the quality of his products plus the availability of enough stock. He hopes to see his business expand further as well as have a happy family. This is Isaiah’s 20th loan and he hopes to restock his shop with more products to avoid shortage so that he can be able to make more profits. He is so hard working and can do more with an additional capital.

loans.use: Restock his shop with more products.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus O. is from the village of Resthouse, Aurora, in the province of Zamboanga del Sur, located in the Philippines. He is 30 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jesus owns and operates a motorcycle transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle transport services. Jesus has been engaged in his business for over one year, and earns approximately 5000 PHP (Philippine pesos) a month.

In 2009, Jesus joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation, and his ability to engage in business activities. Jesus is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase an additional vehicle for the business. This loan will be the first loan for Jesus from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase an additional vehicle

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 32 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells kerosine in wholesale and retail to her customers.She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more kerosine to sell.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de matériels de travail

loans.name: Ana Esther

texts.es: Ana Esther P. D. G. resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango del departamento D. San Salvador. Ana tiene 49 años D. edad vive con su esposo y tres hijos Josué D. 24 años quien trabaja, Alexander D. 15 años y Jonathan D. 12 años años, ambos estudiantes. Ana tiene cuatro años D. haber iniciado su negocio que empezó solo con unas cuantos perfumes que comercializaba con su vecinos pero ahora ella ya ha comprado una pequeña vitrina donD. tiene exhibidos sus productos, el deseo D. Ana es poder tener un bazar en su casa donD. ofrezca mas variedad D. artículos para sus clientes como camisas, pantalones, zapatos,  entre otros; es por ello que solicita D. un crédito que le permita surtir su inventario
texts.en:
Ana Esther lives in the Soyapango municipality of the San Salvador department. She is 49 years old and lives with her husband and her three children: Josué, 24, who works; Alexander, 15 and Jonathan, 12, both of whom are students. Ana started her business 4 years ago and she began with just a few perfumes which she would sell to her neighbors. But now, she has purchased a small display case where she has her products. Ana's wish is to have a bazaar in her home where she can offer her customers a wiD. variety of articles such as shirts, trousers, shoes, among other things. This is the reason she is requesting a loan, to purchase inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inventory.

loans.name: Lenyvel

texts.en: Lenyvel C. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Lenyvel owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling dried goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lenyvel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for daily needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Biyinzika Women's Group Of Lugazi

texts.en:
Prossy B. is 32 years old and the leader of her group in Lugazi. She is married and cares for her two children and her elderly parents. Prossy is a farmer who sells her crops at the Kikawula Trading Center, the central market in town. 

She has been in the business for one year and has learned a tremendous amount from the experience. Customers would sometimes not pay for her produce on time, making it difficult for her to operate, but now she requires all payment up front. She would like to use the loan to inject more capital into her business to insure a steady supply of goods for her customers. With continued hard work and determination, she hopes to one day be able to educate all her children and build her family a modern home.

loans.use: Capital for her farming business

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
el sr. Santos R. se dedica  a la elaboracion y venta de muebles de madera, tiene mas de 11 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, esta casado y es padre de 4 hijos, su  hija mayor cursa la secundaria y los tres menores cursan la educacion primaria, con los ingresos que le genera  este negocio suple todos los gastos familiares y otros compromisos. El credito que esta solicitando es para comprar madera que es la materia principàl para la elaboracion de muebles,  se aproxima la temporada lluviosa y esto le dificulta ya que no cuenta con madera seca y desatiende a su clientela, esto le ocasiona perdida de tiempo y de ingresos. 
Tambien cuenta con un molino donde ofrece los servicios de molienda de maiz nixtamalizado y cafe.
Santos R. nos comento que esta muy feliz ya que las ganancias que ha tenido antes las a invertido en comprar maquinaria y tiene bien establecido su taller de carpinteria. ahora solo necesita invertir en la madera para la fabricacion de sus muebles.
sus muebles los vende al credito.
texts.en:
Señor Santos R. is dedicated to the manufacture and sale of wood furniture. He has been dedicated to this type of activity for more than 11 years. He is married and the father of 4 children. His oldest daughter attends secondary school and the three younger attend primary school. With the income that his business generates, he provides for all the family expenses and other commitments. The loan that he is requesting is to buy wood which is the raw material for the making of furniture. The rainy season approaches and this complicates his business, since he can not rely on finding dry wood and often disappoints his customers. This causes him lost time and income. He also relies on the income from a mill where he offers the services of grinding coffee and nixtamal (maiz mixed with lime to improve the maleability of the flour). Señor Santos R. tells us that he is very happy since the profits that he had before were invested in buying machinery. His carpentry workshop is well established. Now he needs to invest in wood for the making of furniture. He sells his furniture to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cedar, mahogany, laurel and pine wood, varnish, nails and screws.

loans.name: Dina Vda De

texts.es: Dina cuenta con 57 años, es viuda y tiene a su cargo una nieta de 10 años, la misma que estudia en un establecimiento fiscal en nivel de primaria. Cuenta con casa propia dotado de los principales servicios básicos. Su principal actividad es el comercio de ropa y algo de zapatos que los comercializa en las ferias móviles de la provincia, adicionalmente percibe un sueldo de renta de viudez. Tiene 10 años de experiencia en el rubro. El rubro de comercio de ropas y zapatos tiene bastante competencia dentro del mercado interno de la provincia, sin embargo su fuerte esta en que los comercializa en las ferias móviles de ciudades y provincias aledañas de forma que llega a mas clientes potenciales en distintas zonas, siempre con nuevas novedades y con precios que le permiten contar con buen margen de ganancia. El crédito que lo obtuvo lo destino a la ampliación y mejora de su vivienda con el fin de contar con mejores condiciones de habitabilidad. Dina cuenta con 5 créditos en la institución, demostrando un excelente comportamiento de pagos, además de contar con experiencia crediticia en otras financieras.
texts.en:
Dina, 57, is a widow who has a 10-year-old granddaughter, who is enrolled at a public elementary school, under her care. She has her own house and it has all the basic services. She peddles clothing and some footwear in the various movable markets in her province. She also receives a widow's pension. She has been in this line of work for 10 years. There is quite a bit of competition in her occuption in the province. However, her strong point is that she sells in markets in adjacent cities and provinces so that she reaches more potential customers in different areas. She always has the latest items at reasonable prices that produce a good profit margin. The fund received were used to improve her home so that it would be more habitable. Dina has had 5 loans with the Institution having demonstrated excellent repayment habits besides having had credit history with other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For construction.

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en: Zaki is an electrician. He has been working in this sector since 1997. He’s 29 years old and married with one child. He works hard to satisfy his family's needs. Today, Zaki is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy a special compressor, designed for his work, in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a special compressor designed for his work.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en: Daylinda M. is from the village of Burnay, Gitagum, Misamis Oriental. She is 60 years old. Daylinda is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Daylinda runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Daylinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Daylinda joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daylinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Daylinda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Daylinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, y vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi que adquirió hace un año. Ella nos comenta que la inicativa de este negocio nació debido a la necesidad de apoyar a la economía de su familia, ya que lo que su esposo percibe como trabjador agrícola no es suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares.

El servicio lo brinda en el area urbana de su distrito y en los anexos del lugar. La unidad movil es manejada por un chofer y eventualmente por su hijo. Debido al execesivo uso y a que los caminos que conectan Cayaltí con sus anexos son bastante accidentados, la mototaxi ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación, por lo que Sofía se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su hijo una educación de calidad que le asegure un futuro exitoso. Ella es una mujer honrada, trabajadora y que siempre ayuda a los que la necesitan.
texts.en:
Sofía is 47 years old, married, and lives together with her husband and son in the district of Cayaltí, located one hour outside the city of Chiclayo. She works transporting cargo and passengers in the mototaxi she acquired a year ago. She tells us that the initiative to start this business was born out of the need to support her family, since her husband's job as an agricultural worker does not seem to be enough to support their household costs. The services Sofía offers are in her district's urban area and outskirts. Her only mototaxi is driven by a driver and eventually her son. Due to excessive use and the fact that the roadways that connect Cayaltí with its outskirts are fairly accident-prone, the mototaxi has began to suffer some damage that requires urgent repair. This is why Sofía is asking for her first loan through Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 nuevos soles. Her biggest dream is to give her child a quality education that assures him a successful future. She is a very respectable hard-working woman who is always helping those who need it.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Pav

texts.en: Pav C. H. is a 60 year old widow who resides with her child in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She sells charcoal and firewood in her village, earning approximately $6 a day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, including her child’s education. She has been with this business since 2002 and it has improved her standard of living, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. H. is requesting a loan of $500 to repair the truck she used to transport firewood and charcoal for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To repair the truck she uses to transport charcoal and firewood for sale.

loans.name: Hosiyatmo

texts.ru: Забирова Хосиятмо проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем, не имеет детей. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупно- рогатого скота. Имеет небольшой коровник. Покупает молодых бычков, откармливает и продает на рынке. В этом ей помогает муж. Она одновременно занимается растениеводством. У нее земельный участок. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота. Она хочет купить дойную корову и продавать молоко.
texts.en:
Hosiyatmo Z. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 40 years old, married and has no children. She earns a living by breeding cattle and has a small cowshed. Hosiyatmo buys young bulls, raises and sells them at the market. Her husband helps her with this business. She is also involved in agriculture and has a plot of land. Hosiyatmo is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle. She wants to buy a dairy cow and sell milk.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Suy L. E., aged 54, is married and resides with her child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business as a recycler, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a bike repairman, earning an income of USD 8 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Suy L. E. and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to transport recyclable materials to sell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Claudia Gisel

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Gisel T. vive acompañada, tiene dos hijos a su cargo vive en el barrio san Agustín junto a su familia, tiene su negocio de venta comida  rápida en su casa de habitación desde hace dos años. Ademan de su negocio trabaja en la alcaldía municipal como operaria de limpieza.

 La señora Claudia Gisel T. tiene tres años de trabajar con créditos ha cancelado diecinueve créditos en tiempo y forma demostrando responsabilidad, los créditos anteriores le han ayudado a mantener estables su negocio e ir evolucionando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Gisel T. lives with her life partner and has two children under her care. She lives in the San Agustín neighborhood with her family. She has sold fast food in her home for the last 2 years. In addition, she is employed as a municipal cleaning lady. She has managed loans for three years and has always repaid in a timely fashion. She used her previous loans to maintain her business stability and to evolve.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals.

loans.name: Sanu Devi

texts.en:
Sanu Devi M., a resident of Thecho, lives with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Sanjay M., is a carpenter. He opened his own furniture shop three years ago. He makes various kinds of furniture in his shop, such as beds, chairs, tables, and drawers. He makes furniture according to the orders he receives from customers.

The demand for this furniture is increasing. To meet the demand of his customers, he needs to purchase wood. Due to lack of funds, he is unable to purchase the wood. Mrs. Sanu Devi M. is requesting a loan in the amount of 30000.00 NPR to help her husband purchase wood for his work. Her husband's income is the only source of income for her family.

Mrs. Sanu Devi M. has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 9 and her son is in grade 3.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Celida

texts.es:
La señora Celida  de 33 años de edad es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropas Argentinas y nacionales, cuenta con salón comercial propio en su casa,  vende prendas de vestir  para damas,  caballeros y niños, son  exclusivas y delicadas como blusas de licras, vestidos, jeans y otros.
 Anteriormente ella misma confeccionaba y comercializaba por la zona, aumento su clientela y actualmente además de confeccionar compra las mercaderías.  

 Celida  esta conforme con la actividad que realiza, así también su clientela.

Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de jeans, pantalones, camperas y otros abrigos de la temporada para satisfacer la gran demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
Celida, 33, is clothes merchant; she stocks domestic and Argentinean clothing in a store located in her own home. She sells unique and delicate items, such as lycra blouses, dresses, jeans, etc. for women, men and children. She used to make the items she sold in the area herself but her clientele grew and now, besides making items, she also buys merchandise to stock. Celida is satisfied with her work; so are her customers. She is asking Fundación Paraguaya for funds to buy jeans, pants, jackets and coats for the season in order to meet the great demand she has.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jeans, jackets, pants and coats.

loans.name: Ahontefoo Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Seth is a 38-year-old man who describes himself as loyal.  He is the leader of a group called 'Ahontefoo', which means “Righteous” in Twi, the language most commonly spoken in Ghana.  Seth has been a grocery trader for the past 7 years.  He will use the loan to buy provisions for his shop.  Seth hopes to become one of the best-known grocery sellers in the area. 
 
Seth is married and has 5 children between 1 ½ and 14 years old.  He hopes to provide his children with educational opportunities.

loans.use: buying groceries needed to replenish inventory

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 49 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho para sobresalir, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Fortunato de 65 años y sus 4 menores hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los cultivos de Olga, es uno de los mejores cuidados de su poblado, la producción de plátano y café son de muy buena calidad, ya que ella ha procurado aplicar abono a sus chacras. En el mercado de Pichanaki, que es donde vende sus productos, los clientes solicitan mucho su cosecha, motivo por el cual siempre obtiene un buen precio por ellos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la época de recolección, ya que siente que los meses de arduo trabajo, son recompensados, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y parte de su trabaja es cuidar sus plantas de las plagas. Con el tiempo, desea mejorar su producción, para así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que siente que tiene un compromiso con la institución. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus chacras, ya que desea que estén bien fertilizadas.
texts.en:
Olga, 49, is a woman who has worked hard during her lifetime to get ahead. She lives in her own house together with her husband, Fortunato, 65, and their 4 children. The children are the main reason for her efforts. Olga's crops are one of the best cared for in her village. The production of bananas and coffee is of very good quality, since now she has been able to put down fertilizer in her fields. In the Pichanaki market where she sells, the customers look for her products and thus she always gets good prices for them. What she most likes about her work is harvest time, since she feels that the months of tough work have been paid back. She has been farming for 30 year and part of her work is to keep her plants free of disease. With time she wants to improve her production so that she can increase her earnings. This is the fourth loan with MFP. She has always been punctual with her payments since she now feels committed to the institution. In her communal group she is a member who is committed to the development of the group. With the one thousand five hundred new sols that she is requesting, she will buy fertilizer for her fields since she wants to keep them well fertilized.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Abdallajh

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 39-year-old borrower from Lebanon. He has four children. He has been working in the field of agriculture since 1995. He owns livestock, specifically sheep and goats. He raises livestock and sells milk. 

Today, for the first time, Abdallah has requested a loan. He hopes to purchase a sheep. When he first started, he had difficulty starting up his business, but his efforts paid off. His clients are people from his region and its surroundings. For the future, he plans to expand his livestock and therefore improve his income.

loans.use: To purchase a sheep

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Abomey dans le Zou au Bénin, G. Bernadette est mariée à DJOSSOU Benoît, un menuisier. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont trois sont leurs enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Bernadette vit avec sa famille depuis cinq ans à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Bernadette vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu de son activité. N'ayant jamais fréquenté l'école, Bernadette a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce depuis trois ans et qui lui permet de faire face à ses charges. Dans le but d'agrandir son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Bernadette sollicite pour une première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Abomey in the Zou region of Benin, Bernadette G. is married to Benoît Djossou, a carpenter. The couple has five children in their care, three of which are their own. Some of the children are in school. Bernadette has lived with her family for the last five years in Ekpè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. She helps her husband to pay the family’s expenses, thanks to her business income. Never having gone to school, Bernadette learned hairstyling and has been in the business for the last three years, which helps her to pay her expenses.
