With the goal of expanding her business and better meeting her clients’ needs, she is requesting a loan for her first time through ALIDé.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and hair products.

loans.name: Cay

texts.en: Cay T. T. was born in 1956. She not only grows rice but she breeds 200 chickens too. She has two children who are married. Her husband is a carpenter. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 5,450,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

loans.use: To buy food for her chickens

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun P., 48, is married with three children living at home in the Takeo province. She makes and sells rice wine, typically making $4 (USD) each day, and her husband raises pigs. Her husband, Som Sophal, typically makes about $5 each day as a pig farmer. Bun P. would like a loan of $1200 to purchase more pigs to breed and also to purchase feed for the pigs.

loans.use: Raise pigs.

loans.name: Huchitbold

texts.en:
Huchitbold S. lives with his wife and seven year old son in a rented house in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. His wife works as a designer in an Etno salon. He operates a cell phone retail business in the biggest market, Narantuul. 

Huchitbold began his business in 2008 and, because of his strong customer service skills and stable business operation, he has become very successful. He purchases CDMA system cellphones from a wholesale supplier and he imports GSM system cellphones from Erlian, a border city of China. He hopes that soon he will be able to expand his business further and buy new house for his family. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more cellphones to increase his working capital for the business.

loans.use: To purchase more cellphones.

loans.name: Zuena

texts.en:
Zuena is married to a businessman with four children -- three already completed their education and the last born is a university student. She has been operating her business of selling clothes for over ten years, wholesale and retail, door to door and from home.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to pay school fees for her child. She gets some financial help from her other children. Zuena faces the major challenge of transportation and seasonality. She hopes to get a loan to expand her business and become a wholesaler, which is her major aim in working with Yehu. She lives at her own house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Manuel Ascencio Padilla Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “Manuel Ascencio Padilla” iniciará su  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, es decir es una asociación nueva, será parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta de doce integrantes.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de celulares, taller de cerrajería, tienda surtida, repostería, tejidos de mantas, venta de papa, costura de overoles, venta de fruta, tejido de chompas y chalinas, venta de verduras, venta de comida, tejido de mantas y confección.

La  señora Julia es la presidenta,,  indica que  cuenta con diferentes negocios: una tienda de barrio, que esta ubicado en su domicilio, atendido por sus hijos;  formalmente un puesto de venta de fruta cerca a la Ceja de El Alto y tejido de mantas, estos dos últimos negocios son llevados adelante por ella sola.
Su solicitud de crédito es por Bs. 1000.- espera que este dinero pueda impulsar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The “Manuel Ascencio Padilla” Communal Association is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer since it is a new group that is part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of twelve members who are involved in various businesses such as mobile phone sales, a locksmith shop, general store, bakery, weaving blankets, potato sales, manufacturing overalls, fruit sales, weaving sweaters and scarves, vegetable sales, food sales, and weaving articles of clothing.

Sra. Julia is the group president. She indicates that she is involved in different businesses. Julia has a neighborhood store in her home that is managed by her children. She also has a formal fruit stand near the edge of El Alto and produces woven blankets. Julia manages the last two businesses by herself. She is requesting a loan of 1000 BOB and hopes the money will boost her businesses.

loans.use: Purchase wool & other products

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon who lives with his parents and two siblings. This talented young man has owned a metal shop in his town since 2007.  Lebanese families work together to meet the needs of the life, and this is certainly the case of the borrower who helps his father with the household.  Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a large quantity of metal wholesale to increase his work operation. In the future, he hopes to open a commercial center to sell metal.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of metal wholesale

loans.name: Khlây

texts.en:
Selling fish is an important part of 55-year-old Khlây L.’s daily routine. She always gets up early in the morning in order to buy fresh fish from the other fishermen in the rural area around her community in bulk and at a reasonable price. And she hurries up to sell it in the busy local market. 

She has a life partner in Mr. Khoun Roun who is employed as a building worker. This couple have two children. Khlây L. is a hard-working woman, and her business is getting better and better because of her good management. As a result of the increasing needs of her customers, Khlây L. is applying for a loan so she can purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred B. is from the town of Banga. She is 35 years old, married and has 2 children ages 9 and 13. Mildred earns through farming and hog raising. She helps her husband plant and harvest rice crops and she also grows hogs for fattening. Mildred does her best to be a good wife and mother and says she only wants her family to be happy and healthy.

Mildred joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mildred is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mildred from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: María Fausta

texts.es:
María Fausta tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío El Romero, una zona rural poblada principalmente por gente humilde y bastante trabajadora, pertenece al distrito de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega en su domicilio, allí ofrece a sus vecinos y clientes diversos productos de uso diario, entre abarrotes y alimentos. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la calidad de productos y al buen trato que suele brindar. Esta actividad es muy importante para su familia ya que con los ingresos que ella percibe se encarga de ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico familiar.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos y de esa manera satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, asimismo desea implementar su negocio con la compra de productos navideños, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Fausta, 25, is married and lives with her husband and children in El Romero, a rural area populated mostly by humble, hard working people.  It belongs to Lambayeque district and is located in Lambayeque province over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small grocery store in her home.  She offers her neighbors and customers a variety of daily use items among groceries and food items.  The store is well received due to the quality of products and the good customer service she tends to provide.  This activity is very important for her family because income from it allows her to help her husband support the family.

María wants to expand the business buying more products to meet current demand.  She also wants to stock the store with Christmas products.  She, therefore, has deemed it wise to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to help her reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Jerilyn

texts.en:
Jerilyn C. is from the village of Usocan. She is 54 years old. Jerilyn is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately $345 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jerilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. 

Jerilyn is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 9th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Quinto

texts.en: Quinto is 28 years old and married. He sells motor vehicle spare parts for a living.  He has been running the business for just one year.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been empowered economically and has learnt how to save his money.  He dreams of expanding his business into selling wholesale in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy leaf springs, arms and bushes.

loans.use: To buy leaf springs, arms and bushes

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Sourn S., 40, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. She is a farmer, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a traditional musician, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 42 on food, USD 10 on the children’s education, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. Sourn is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to improve one of her children’s carpentry business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: improve one of her children's carpentry business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del banco comunal “Alondra” perteneciente a la comuna de Tomé. Ella se dedica a realizar composturas y confecciones a pedido, de ropa y otros artículos como por ejemplo cobertores de cama, desde hace más de 6 años. 
Con este préstamo pagará el arreglo de su máquina de coser overlock y  comprará los materiales que le faltan: hilos y géneros.
Vive con su marido, quien trabaja de manera dependiente y su nieto de 14 años.
El sueño de María es seguir creciendo en su negocio, ya que cuando comenzó solo tenía una máquina de coser y ahora cuenta con cinco distintas, lo que le permite hacer más y mejores trabajos.
A María le han servido tanto los préstamos que ha recibido de Fondo Esperanza, como los talleres sobre cómo administrar su negocio, ya que aprendió a llevar registros de sus ganancias y gastos, lo que le ha permitido organizar su dinero de mejor manera.
Tomé es una comuna del sur de Chile, ubicada cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Biobío. Su economía local se sustentaba de manera importante en la actividad textil que se origina a fines del siglo XIX, con fábricas que producen paños de lana de oveja, Textiles Bellavista Oveja Tomé, cerrada en 2007, trayendo consigo altas tasas de desempleo que han sido cubiertas por nuevas actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Maria is part of the village bank "Alondra" in the community of Tomé.  For more than 6 years, she has been designing and producing clothing and other products like bedspreads as requested by her customers. With this loan she will pay to fix her sewing machine overlock and to buy materials that she is lacking - threads and fabrics.

She lives with her husband, who has a stable job, and her grandson who is 14 years old.  Maria's dream is to continue growing her business, since she began with only one sewing machine and now she has five, which allows her to make more and better products. 

Tomé is a community in the south of Chile, located near the city of Concepción in the region of Biobío.   The local economy is based largely on the textile activity that began in the 19th century, with factories that produce cloth of sheep's wool.  When  Bellavista Oveja Tomé Textiles closed in 2007, it caused a high rate of unemployment, which has gone down with the creation of new economic activities.

loans.use: Repair a sewing machine and buy materials

loans.name: Mok's Group

texts.en:
There are ten members forming this village loan.   They are located in Preaek Run village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Mok S. was born in 1961 and is the village bank leader. She was selected to be the village bank leader by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Yon Sokhom, are Khmer cake-sellers who are able to earn a small income to support their famiL.'s needs.  Mrs. Mok Shimom would like a loan to purchase baking supplies for Khmer cakes.

This couple has five children.   Two are Khmer cake sellers who support their parents' business, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the other two are students.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer cake supplies.

loans.name: Kateken

texts.en:
Kateken O. T. is 33 years old, married, blessed with three children and supports four other people from his family. Kateken is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land as he has been doing for the last six years.

He learned about KADET LTD from other men in a group already registered with KADET LTD in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is plans to use to buy bags of Kenya seed certified wheat and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent home and expand his farming activity.

Kateken's dream is to construct rental houses and educate his children in order for them to have a better future. He is an industrious man who is determined to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy bags of Kenya seed certified wheat and fertilizers

loans.name: Cecilia Gakenia

texts.en:
Cecilia has practiced both crop and animal farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 9 years.  She is 47 years old and married to Benson K.. They have 2 children.  

Cecilia was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Cecilia hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Mr. Soeun was born in 1956. He is married to Mrs. Yoeun and they have four children, one of whom is a Korean teacher, while the others attend a local public school. Mr. Soeun is a village chief and his wife is a farmer who owns a 3.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice. She sells some of the rice and uses the rest for her family. In addition to farming she is a pig breeder, too. In the rice field, they have some problems because the field is infertile, has a lot of insects and is far from the irrigation system. So to improve its condition, Mr. Soeun is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es:
La señora Noelia tiene ya mas de dos años dedicándose a la fotografía este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia, ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de mediana edad bajo su responsabilidad y a quienes  les quieres dar el estudio necesario para su futuro y que tenga una mejor vida económico. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar un equipo de impresión más moderna y que tenga la impresión fotográfica de mejor calidad ya que desea darles a sus clientes un buen servicio y así la puedan recomendar con sus amigos y familiares. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá de su negocio ya que teniendo el nuevo equipo tendrá mas trabajo y ingreso al negocio.
texts.en:
Noelia has been doing photography for over two years now; this business is her source of income for family support because she’s a single mother with two preteen children still in her care for whom she wants to provide schooling necessary for their future and so that she can have a better economic life.

She is asking for a loan to buy more modern printing equipment so that the photographic images will be of better quality because she wants to provide a good service to her customers so that they will recommend her to their friends and family members.

She plans to repay the loan with profits obtained from her business since having the new equipment will lead to more work and income in the business.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Sop Nabi Group

texts.fr:
Sop Nabi groupe de solidarité du Banc Villageois Artillerie Baax Yaay est composé de 12 femmes qui habitent le même quartier; elles sont parentes, voisines et amies et ont comme principale activité le petit commerce. Il est créé le 27 août 2009.

Madame Boury N. la responsable du groupe est âgée de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère 5 enfants en charge; (elle est debout à droite sur la photo est habillée en camisole vert et pagne orange) 

Elle fait de la restauration. Elle a une expérience de trois ans dans ce domaine. Elle vend au marché central de Louga.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter du riz, de l'huile, oignons et tous les condiments nécessaires pour la préparation du déjeuner et petit déjeuner.

Elle participe aux dépenses familiales pour soutenir son mari et subvenir aux besoins de scolarité de leurs enfants.
texts.en: The Sop Nabi "Banc Villageois" solidarity group in Artillerie Baax Yaay was born on August 27, 2009. The 12 members are women who are related, neighbors or friends and they all have small business. Madam Boury N., 41 year-old, is the leader of the group. She is a married mother in charge of 5 children. She stands on the far right in the picture, wearing green and an orange loincloth. She is in the catering business and has a 3 years experience in this field. She sells the products in Louga's main market. With the loan, she hopes buying rice, oil, onions and all the needed spices to prepare lunch and breakfast. She participates to the family's expenditures to help her husband and take care of her children's schooling.

loans.use: To buy and resell food products for catering purpose

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia C. is from the village of Bagong, Maslob, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 63 years old. Florencia is married and has five adult children. 

To make a living, Florencia sells food and drinks for passenger in the bus terminal. Florencia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Florencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Florencia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fruits, candies, cookies and bottled water for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Florencia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, candies, cookies and bottled water for sale.

loans.name: Ikromiddin

texts.en:
Ikromiddin is 37 years old. He is married and is the father of 3 children. Ikromiddin owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenues generated from this store. He is requesting a loan of US$1800 to increase his stock of foodstuff in his grocery.  Ikromiddin is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress through their studies, and he is doing his best to help them.  We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his business.       

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: stock more inventory for his store

loans.name: Pua

texts.en:
Pua is 46 years of age and married with seven children. Pua owns & operates a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  She has 4 years of experience in this business. Pua needs a loan of WST $2500 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to make improvements to her house.

Pua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Pua's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Elizabeth has operated a business selling clothes. She sells clothes wholesale to retail clothing sellers in the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a general store in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to pay school fees for her two children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her two children.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Joann has a shop that sells vegetables like tomatoes & string beans. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional vegetables.
Joann has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Joann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
Lonah is a hardworking 38 year old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with 5 children. She has been operating a hotel for the last 2 years for the benefit of her family. In the next 5 years she wants to have a restaurant in more spacious premises.
Lonah is requesting a loan of 10000 Kenya shillings to buy beans, maize and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize and charcoal

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a hardworking businessman.  He owns a school where he employs six people. He has been operating the business for three years.  He gained experience for running the business because he was previously employed as a teacher. Through Faulu Kenya, he was able to open the business.  He also earns extra income from his video shop and motorbike transport business. Joshua hopes to expand his business in the future.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to add classrooms and buy desks and chairs.

loans.use: To add classrooms and buy desks and chairs.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана замужем. Ее супруга зовут Иван. У них двое взрослых детей. Проживают в селе Веселое.  Муж занимается сельским хозяйством, а  Оксана имеет свой собственный бизнес. 

Оксана владеет небольшим магазинчиком. Торгует она  бытовой химией, товарами для дома, одеждой, обувью, канцтоварами и игрушками. Конкурентов нет, так как  ее магазин единственный в селе. Люди не едут за сорок километров в город, что бы купить какую-нибудь мелочь для дома. И поэтому товар очень востребован. Оксана предприимчивая, трудолюбивая и прилежная. Имеет хорошую репутацию и дружеские отношения с клиентами. Ее бизнес является основным доходом семьи.

Оксана просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на закупку посуды, игрушек и одежды.
texts.en:
Oksana lives in the village of Veseloye. She's married to Ivan and they have two children. 
Ivan is a farmer, while Oksana runs a small store. She sells household cleaning products, home goods, clothing, shoes, office supplies and toys. Her goods are in high demand. She owns the only store in the village, allowing customers to buy local and not travel 40 kilometers just to go shopping. Oksana doesn't lack initiative and is hard-working and diligent. She has a good reputation and great customer relations. Her business is the family's main source of income. 
Oksana's requesting a loan in order to purchase glassware, toys and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase glassware, toys and clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear items such as polo shirts and men's briefs at wholesale.

loans.name: Cinthia Mabel

texts.es:
La Señorita Cinthia tiene 20 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora, ella es soltera, vive con sus padres Don Anselmo y Doña María, su hermano Luis de 24 años es Licenciado en Enfermería. Su familia es muy humilde y trabajadora, viven en la Ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
Chintia es estudiante de la carrera de Administración en la Universidad Nacional, como es una joven activa emprendió su pequeño negocio que es el de realizar fotocopias y trabajos prácticos con diseños, a fin de poder ayudar a sus padres a costear su estudios. Comenta que le va muy bien con los muchos contactos que tiene en la universidad, y por más que le esfuerza, a la par que estudia, no se deja vencer porque desea progresar y llegar a todos sus objetivos, una de ellas es de ser una buena profesional.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintas, hojas y mantenimiento de equipo. Está muy contenta por la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya al poder tener la posibilidad de obtener el crédito.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 20 years old and is an enterprising young person. She is single and lives with her parents Anselmo and María and with her brother Luis who is 24 years old and has a Bachelor’s in Nursing. Her family is humble and hardworking; they live in the city of Coronel Oviedo. 

Cinthia is a student pursuing a career in Administration at the National University. She is an busy young person who has started a small business making photocopies and work projects with graphic design in order to help her parents pay for her schooling. She says things are going very well with the many contacts she has in the university. As hard as she works, she’s studying at the same time. She will not give up because she wants to progress and to reach all of her goals, one of which is to be a successful professional. 

She asks for a loan to pay for ink, paper, and equipment maintenance. She is very happy because Fundación Paraguaya has made it possible for her to get a loan.

loans.use: to pay for ink, paper, and computer equipment maintenance

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal “Medallitas de Oro II”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos, tiene estudios de educación secundaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace dos ciclos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su carro, ella realiza servicio de transporte.
Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 800.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar asientos para su auto, ella trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es tener una empresa de transportes con muchas unidades, esto le generaría muchos más ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, responsabilidad y las charlas.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the “Medallitas de Oro II” community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 28 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She studied at high school.

Adela has been working with Movimiento Manuela R. for two loan cycles.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her car (she provides a transport service).

Adela is now requesting a new loan for 800 soles which she will use to buy seats for her car.  She works together with her husband.

Adela's dream is to own a transport company with many vehicles.  This would make her a lot more income.

What Adela likes about her community bank is the punctuality, the responsibility and the talks.

loans.use: to buy seats for her car

loans.name: Belyse

texts.en: Belyse is 26 years old and married to a taxi driver. They have 2 children aged 1 month and four years. The older one attends school. Belyse sells charcoal which she has been doing for 6 years. She would like to use the loan to buy more charcoal to expand her business.  Belyse would like to use the profits to provide for her family and create savings for her future. She would like to see her business double in size.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more electricity for resale and to buy a printer and more materials.

loans.name: Rakel

texts.en:
Rakel has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 26 years. She is also involved in dairy farming. She is 49 years old and is married to Peter. They have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers; this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs and enhance her farming.

In the future, Rakel hopes to improve her farming skills and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, nails, and hammers.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with seven school going children. Her husband Dzombo is a farmer who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. They own a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Salome has operated a livestock (goat) selling business for the past seven years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan Salome wants to purchase more goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial facilities to do business.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a focused 31-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children who are in school. She has been running a grocery business for the last three years to support her family. Her potential customers are local residents and passerby. She has employed one person to assist her in managing the business. In the next 5 years, she plans to establish a wholesale operation. Jennifer is requesting a loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings to buy onions, vegetables and fruits for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy onions, vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Maria Joey

texts.en:
Maria Joey is 38 years old and single. She is a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She manages her household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Maria Joey operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials such as metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. They sell to junk shops like Maria Joey's for a small profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 700 PHP in sales every day.

Maria Joey is requesting a loan for11, 000 PHP, which she will use to augment her current revolving fund to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria Joey hopes her business grows more in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase scrap materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of them are in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Kator, South Sudan for 5 years.

Amani is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale

loans.name: Florentine Odile's Group

texts.fr: Responsable du groupe de deux personnes, Florentine vit avec son mari et a deux enfants. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de divers, cartes de recharge, oeuf et de l'eau glacée. Elle exerce ses activités sur fonds propres et s'approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Dans l'objectif de diversifier son  activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus accrue, elle a sollicité et obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Par conséquent, elle vise à maximiser ses intérêts et  à contribuer aux charges de son foyer.
texts.en:
Florentine is responsible for this two-person group. She lives with her husband and has two children. She specialized in selling various products, such as phone recharge cards, eggs, and iced water.

She runs her business on her own capital and gets her supplies from the neighboring markets. In order to diversify her business and meet an ever increasing customer demand, she sought and obtained a loan from Kiva's partner, Finadev.

Her goals is to maximize her interests and help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 8 trays of eggs, 15 bags of sugar, and phone recharge cards

loans.name: Jorge Martin

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Jorge se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Industrial, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las acogedoras calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jorge trabaja como Asistente Contable, en una empresa  comercial de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jorge se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una moto lineal, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder transporte hacia su trabajo, ya que actualmente vive en un lugar muy alejado de la ciudad, de esta manera el podrá ahorrar un poco de dinero para poder utilizarlos en otras necesidades, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Jorge, a young man of 20, lives in the city of Chincha with his wife and their two small children, who he loves are are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of his efforts to get his family ahead. Thanks to his work and the support of their parents, Jorge is studying Industrial Engineering in college. In his free time he likes to walk through the inviting streets of his city, and sometimes he cooks a delicious Arroz con Pato [rice with duck] to share with his family.

By his own initiative, with a lot of tenacity and dedication, Jorge works as an assistant accountant in a commercial business in his city. He works every day from early in the morning, and can work up to 10 hours. He is happy doing his work and believes that it's going well because of his performance and the friendly way he treats others.

Jorge is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help he will be able to buy a motorcycle which will help him get to work since he lives far outside the city. This way he will save a little bit of money to use for other necessities. He will continue working and making an effort to achieve his biggest dream of having his own business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jesus Est La Solution Group

texts.fr: JESUS EST LA SOLUTION est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Vigbégnon Lucienne (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 32 ans a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Vigbégnon Lucienne est mariée à un certain du nom de Richard. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Vigbégnon Lucienne et son mari. Pour cette raison, Vigbégnon Lucienne vend du maïs, du tapioca (farine d'amidon de manioc), du haricot et des liqueurs à son domicile depuis dix ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Vigbégnon Lucienne sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESUS EST LA SOLUTION, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, du tapioca (farine d'amidon de manioc), du haricot et des liqueurs.

loans.name: Adjoa Bénédicte

texts.fr: Adjoa Bénédicte âgée de 28 ans, n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Adjoa Bénédicte est célibataire. Adjoa Bénédicte vit seule. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par elle.  Pour cette raison,  Adjoa Bénédicte vend depuis un ans de façon ambulante, du ablo (aliment à base du riz). Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Adjoa Bénédicte achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Adjoa Bénédicte sollicite pour une deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du riz.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
El Sr. Gonzalo de 39 años de edad, desde hace mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a atender pacientes en un Hospital publico de Nueva Guinea como auxiliar de Enfermería; habita junto a sus pequeños hijos quienes están su cargo y estudian.  La Vivienda la ha venido construyendo a base de créditos que poco a poco los ha pagado; es así como viene superando Don Gonzalo que cada día lucha para brindar lo mejor a sus pequeños.  En este momento necesita comprar cemento, arena, Hierro, Inodoro, Piedras Canteras, tuberías y demás materiales para levantar el sumidero en su propiedad e instalar Inodoro dentro de la Casa, ya que la letrina que usa actualmente cada día presenta menos condiciones higiénicas y teme por la salud de sus hijos y la contaminación del medio ambiente; Su única alternativa para echar andar este proyecto es con este crédito que solicita a Kiva el cual le permitirá gozar de un ambiente saludable en su hogar.

Con otro préstamo desea continuar con las mejoras en la vivienda, sobre todo hacer un dormitorio para uno de sus hijos que dentro de poco estará en edad mayor requiriendo su propia privacidad.

loans.use: hacer sumidero e inodoro y tener donde hacer sus necesidades mas higienicamente con su familia y evitar malos olores y contaminación del medio ambiente que provoca la letrina.

loans.name: Santillan Parra

texts.es:
El señor Omar un hombre luchador es soltero tiene 1 hija de cinco años que vive con él, lucha día a día para salir adelante, actualmente es maestro en construcción tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y es muy solicitado en el sector y lugares aledaños; motivo por el cual ha tenido varias veces que irse muy lejos a trabajar y dejar a su pequeña hija con su madre. Aprendió de esta actividad por iniciativa propia, ahora desea emprender en la producción de pollos broiler tiene el conocimiento necesario ya que sus familiares se dedican a esta actividad y desean apoyarlo para que inicie su propio negocio. Tiene un galpón listo para emprender su negocio al mismo le dedicará de 4 horas diarias.
Don Omar agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada ya que con esta ayuda podrá iniciar su negocio y dar un mejor futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
In the Canton (municipality) of Pedro Vicente Maldonado lives Mr. Omar, a fighting man who is single and has a five year old daughter that lives with him, he works day to day to move forward, he currently is a construction expert, has many years of experience in this field and is very sought after in this area and in surrounding areas; for this reason he has had to travel far for work several times, leaving his daughter with her mother. He learned of this activity through his own initiative, now he wishes to start producing broiler chickens, he has the necessary knowledge since his family members work in this trade and they want to support him in starting his own business. He has a barn ready to start his business and will dedicate 4 hours each day to it. 
Don Omar thanks Kiva for the support and the opportunity offered since with this help he will be able to start his business and give a better future to his daughter.

loans.use: To start his chicken breeding business, and to be able to provide a better future to his daughter

loans.name: Los Vecinos Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad tranquila de origenes mazahua, habitan personas muy alegres responsables, muy orgullosos porque pertenecen a un lugar así, para llegar al lugar se viaja en autobus o en taxi aproximadamente son 45 minutos de recorrido mientras se viaja se pueden apreciar paisajes muy lindos, como sus cerritos, bosques lleno de arboles grandes y sus cultivos llenos de maiz.
 Rene Rolando es un chico muy alegre sumamente siempre esta de muy buen humor, es muy trabajador, tiene grandes aspiraciones en la vida para lograr lo que quiere dice que recibió siempre una muy buena educación, "Mis padres siempre me inculcaron que trabajar siempre era muy bueno porque de ahí podíamos obtener nuestros ingresos para obtener una mejor calidad de vida, tiene 22 años es soltero y aun vive con su mamá.
 Rene tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes desde hace un año platica que la inicio porque su mamá tiene una tienda de ropa y como veía que vendía muy bien también se animo a emprender con su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ademas se dedica a comprar animalitos desde pequeños los crece engorda para después venderlos. "En mayoría de las ocasiones a los animales solo los compro para engordarlos y después venderlos para asi obtener mas ingresos" Comento Rene.
 Con la cria y engorda de animales lleva ya siete años en los cuales le ha ido muy bien siempre ha tenido muy buenas gannacias lo que le han permitido seguir estudiando y apoyar con los gastos de su hogar.
 Rene lleva ya varios ciclos en VFMexico por lo que esta muy contento y agradecido con sus prestamos porque ha podido hacer crecer poco a poco sus negocios, ahora comprara dos becerros, zacate y maiz para alimentar a sus animales.
 Platica que no tienen ninguna dificultad al menos que se le lleguen a enfermar pero casi no ocurre porque siempre trata de alimentarlos muy bien y si llega a ocurrir de inmediato los lleva al veterinario para que los medicamente y puedan salvarse.
 El sueño de Rene es ternimar su carrera para ejercer sin tener que abandonar sus negocio porque de alguna manera tambien quiere emplear a personas de su propia comunidad.
Los integrantes del grupo son Adela quien invertira en ropa, Rosa en servilletas y Antonia en tortillas.
*La fotografia fue tomada en el negocio de Doña Adelina porque es el punto de reunion; ella es quien la palyera azul y el suéter verde*
texts.en:
En una comunidad tranquila de origenes mazahua, habitan personas muy alegres responsables, muy orgullosos porque pertenecen a un lugar así, para llegar al lugar se viaja en autobus o en taxi aproximadamente son 45 minutos de recorrido mientras se viaja se pueden apreciar paisajes muy lindos, como sus cerritos, bosques lleno de arboles grandes y sus cultivos llenos de maiz.
 Rene Rolando es un chico muy alegre sumamente siempre esta de muy buen humor, es muy trabajador, tiene grandes aspiraciones en la vida para lograr lo que quiere dice que recibió siempre una muy buena educación, "Mis padres siempre me inculcaron que trabajar siempre era muy bueno porque de ahí podíamos obtener nuestros ingresos para obtener una mejor calidad de vida, tiene 22 años es soltero y aun vive con su mamá.
 Rene tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes desde hace un año platica que la inicio porque su mamá tiene una tienda de ropa y como veía que vendía muy bien también se animo a emprender con su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ademas se dedica a comprar animalitos desde pequeños los crece engorda para después venderlos. "En mayoría de las ocasiones a los animales solo los compro para engordarlos y después venderlos para asi obtener mas ingresos" Comento Rene.
 Con la cria y engorda de animales lleva ya siete años en los cuales le ha ido muy bien siempre ha tenido muy buenas gannacias lo que le han permitido seguir estudiando y apoyar con los gastos de su hogar.
 Rene lleva ya varios ciclos en VFMexico por lo que esta muy contento y agradecido con sus prestamos porque ha podido hacer crecer poco a poco sus negocios, ahora comprara dos becerros, zacate y maiz para alimentar a sus animales.
 Platica que no tienen ninguna dificultad al menos que se le lleguen a enfermar pero casi no ocurre porque siempre trata de alimentarlos muy bien y si llega a ocurrir de inmediato los lleva al veterinario para que los medicamente y puedan salvarse.
 El sueño de Rene es ternimar su carrera para ejercer sin tener que abandonar sus negocio porque de alguna manera tambien quiere emplear a personas de su propia comunidad.
Los integrantes del grupo son Adela quien invertira en ropa, Rosa en servilletas y Antonia en tortillas.
*La fotografia fue tomada en el negocio de Doña Adelina porque es el punto de reunion; ella es quien la palyera azul y el suéter verde*

loans.use: Comprara dos becerros zacate y maiz.

location.town: San Nicolas Guadalupe, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Amia

texts.en:
Amia is deeply encouraged by Kiva and its lenders for their kind heart of lending her funds several times in the past which really helped sustain her store. At age sixty nine she is still full of hope that good days are still ahead for her and her family.

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of Php 8000 to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for six years already. She is hopeful for your positive response. Her earnings will help in her plan to improve her house.

All Amia prays for God to give her long life and good health and that she will be able to improve her dwelling. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Maria Xiomara

texts.en:
My name is Maria R. and I have been making and selling tortillas in my own store for the last 3 years. I conduct my sales in the foothils of Juane Lainez to certain businesses such as local markets and bars. This allows me support my family and in the future I would like to be able to hire others in order to increase my sales. My goal is to expand my inventory and my sales and renovate my home with the profits.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria R. me dedico a la fabrica y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, y mis ventas las realizo en las falda del cerro Juana lainez en ciertos negocios como ser mercaditos y pulperias de la localidad, dicha actividad me ayuda a mantener a mi familia y me gustaría en mi futuro poder darle trabajo a otras personas para que mis ventas se aumente, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion.

loans.use: Buy corn flour, salt, water, lime, phosphorous, charcoal, firewood

loans.name: Peter Agwo

texts.en:
Peter is a widower with five children. 

He joined GHAPE in 2004. With his two previous loans, he succeeded in providing his community with food. He is proud of having earned some money which he used for paying tuition for his children.

Given a loan of $200, he plans to buy piglets and fingerlings. He is optimistic given the fact that the supply of fish is limited and manure is always in great demand. He plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment will be four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: selling fish and pigs

loans.name: Basura

texts.en: Basura M. lives in Beylagan and works in the Beylagan city bazaar, where she rents a small booth. She is married and has 3 children. She started her business in 1998. Basura specializes in night clothes and bed linens. She has been a client of Normicro Beylagan Branch since 2004. Basura has taken out 2 loans from Normicro totaling $700. Now she needs $500 to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.en:
Yaneth R. lives in a small community on the outskirts of Ayacucho, Peru, with her husband and 2 children. She owns and operates a sizable grocery store, supplying the neighborhood with soda, canned milk, cleaning products, and a multitude of other items. Her most popular product is baby diapers, which she sells daily, either individually or in large packs. Her clients are friends, family, and neighbors, who often stop in the store just to say hello or have a chat.

She has run this shop for three years. Prior to opening the store, which is just down the street from her home, she worked at a small kiosk in the informal market in the city center. Yaneth, who’s friends call her Yanita, much prefers working at the shop because it is closer to home, so she doesn’t have to commute into town and has more time with her children, who are both in school. The space is also much larger than the kiosk where she worked, allowing her to hold more inventory and continually expand her product line.

She hopes to receive a loan of $300, which she would use to purchase more of the most popular products to have on hand. She would also use part of the money to begin selling more specialized, high-end beauty products, which has been a goal of hers for several months.

loans.use: Purchase more of the most popular products to have on hand; begin selling more specialized, high-end beauty products

loans.name: Muazama

texts.en:
Muazama G. is a cheerful person, as you can see from this picture. She loves life and children very much. That is why she decided to choose this kind of business, selling toys. Her sales point is located in Chkalovsk, in Khujand. She has several shelves for her goods and two tables--that's it. She sells various toys such as dolls, cars, balls, and so on. She says that her business place is very crowded every day and she sells her goods in a short time.

The turnover of her working capital is good and she makes a good profit under the circumstances. She gets her toys from distributors from China. Her chief problem is the condition of her sales point especially in rainy and snowy weather. (It is upsetting to her and bad for business when her goods became dirty.)

The government of Chkalovsk plans to build shops in this market and Muazama hopes in future to be able to rent one for her business. For this purpose, she wants to increase her inventory of goods and save money for a future shop.

loans.use: increase her inventory so as to save to have her own shop

loans.name: Calixta

texts.es:
Calixta lives down in Domingo Abreu Gomez street, Complemento Yunguyo neighborhood, El Alto city. She lives alone with her 3 years old boy because her husband works as a motor mechanic out of town. She'll use the loan to purchase merchandise for her general store, located in the Alto Lima area where she sells mass consumption goods. It's her first credit with Impro and she qualifys for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Calixta vive en la calle Domingo Abreu Gomez de la zona Complemento Yunguyo de la ciudad de El Alto . Vive junto a su hijo de tres años, pues su esposo trabaja como mecánico fuera de la cuidad. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de mercadería, pues posee una tienda de abarrotes en la zona de Alto Lima, donde vende artículos de consumo masivo. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Ziyafet

texts.en:
Ziyafet V. is from the Jorat settlement of Sumgayit city in the Azerbaijan Republic. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is busy with trading a small variety of industry goods and different sort of retail things. She began her business with $200 in 2003. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, she cannot earn enough money to meet her family's important consumption needs. She wants to rent a space in the trading area in the central market and increase the assortment of her retail trade. She has already gathered some money for it. But it is not enough, so she needs to borrow money.
Ziyafet needs $300 for expanding her business. She wants to increase the assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of retail goods. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business. She believes that this will further improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of retail goods

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. is 36years old, married with 5 children, lives in Benin City. Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and food Items, She is soliciting for the loan of $875 to buy more provision and foodstuff for sale. She started the business in 2002. She is a LAPO client. she thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Rano Kanjaeva lives in the Rudaki Region. She is 45 years old, married, and has 3 kids. She is in the business of cattle breeding: she buys animals at a low price and resells them at a higher price. This loan will be used for her business. She plans to purchase 2 young bulls at a low price because during this time of the year the prices go down due to lack of food for these animals. This will give her an opportunity to earn a higher margin by selling the bulls during the spring season at a better price. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Кенджаева Рано проживает в районе Рудаки, 45 лет , замужем имеет 3 детей.Занимается животноводством , покупает по более дешевой цене и продает по более выгодной цене. Данный кредит клиентка запрашивает на животноводство. Она планирует на эти деньги купить двух бычков подешевле,т.к в феврале цены на животных падают в связи с нехваткой корма.Это даст возможность выиграть в цене и продать бычков весной по более выгодной цене. Запрашиваемый кредит планирует погасить в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: To purchase young bulls

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Like any mother who wishes the best for her children, Gloria S. U. works hard in order to provide her children with an education and a brighter future. She sells both generic and natural products. Gloria's work functions as a second source of income for the family. She has helped her husband handle family expenses and together they have made it through tough economic times. Her husband works in a wholesale food market.

Gloria, a diligent woman from Juárez, is requesting a $475 loan, which she will pay back within 3 months. With the money she will buy the products that her customers demand.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Gloria S. U. como toda madre de familia deseosa de que sus 3 hijos tengan un mejor futuro y sabiendo que esto se puede lograra a través de la educación decidió iniciar las venta de productos genéricos y naturistas para apoyar a su marido quien trabaja en una mercado de abastos, dado que sus ingresos eran insuficientes para los gastos de escuela de sus pequeños y pasaban por un periodo económicamente critico.

Es así como ella una mujer emprendedora de Juárez, N.L. solicita de su apoyo para reunir US $475 que pagara en un plazo de 3 meses para poder comprar los productos que sus clientes le solicitan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sekinut

texts.en:
Sekinut A. is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her business is not too common in her community where she lives; she sells plywood and packing case wood. She hails from Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria and has been in business since 1998.

Sekinut has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years and she is requesting a loan of $875 to enable her buy more plywood and packing case wood to sell.

loans.use: To buy more of plywood and packing case wood

loans.name: Chantheourn Monh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantheourn M. is a fish seller and wants to expand her business. She has applied for a loan from AMK to buy more fish to re-sell in the market. Last year, she helped a friend obtain a loan, but now she would like one for herself. 
Mrs. Chantheourn M. is a widow with three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Three months ago, she got in a motorbike accident and had to spend $500 on treatment.
 This loan will be split between twenty-three members in Preak Tanop Village in Kandal Province.

loans.use: To buy fish to re-sell in the market

loans.name: Ndiaga

texts.fr:
Ndiaga T. is a single young man who lives with his brothers in the district HERSENT DE THIES. He is 34 years old and has been working as a tailor for a few years. He has a cantine in the Khelcom marketplace and has two sewing machines and a few apprentices. With the funds he is requesting, he wants to buy a new machine in order to finish his customers' orders and to better meet their demands.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

ndiaga T. est un jeune célibataire qui vit avec ses frères au quartier HERSENT DE THIES .il est agé de 34 ans et exerce la profession de tailleur depuis quelques années .il a une cantine au marché khelcom et dispose de deux machines à coudre et de quelques apprentis .avec la somme qu'il sollicite il veut acheter une nouvelle machine en vue de terminer ses commandes et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ms. Sandra has worked very hard along with her husband in order to improve their eight children's lives. She works in housekeeping and also sells beauty products through a catalog. Her husband is a musician and together they work every day to ensure that their children are educated and that they grow up to be good, respectable people. Their greatest desire is that their children succeed in life.

Ms. Sandra has been selling beauty products for credit through catalogs for ten years now and this loan will allow her to purchase more of these products so that she always has merchandise on hand to offer her clients. Her future plans include being able to dedicate herself 100% to her business and to be able to solidify the business so that she can guarantee her children the education that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Sandra junto a esu esposo han luchado muy duro para poder sacar adelante a su numerosa familia de 8 hijos. Doña Sandra es empleado doméstica y también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. Su esposo es músico, y junto a ella velan cada día por la formación de sus hijos para que estos sean personas honradas, de bien y sobre todo con muchos deseos de superación.

Doña Sandra tiene 10 años de tener el negocio de las ventas al crédito por catálogos, y el préstamo le ayudará en la compra de los productos que ofrece, y así siempre tener productos que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Sus planes futuros son poder dedicarse 100% al negocio de las ventas, así como también poder establecer su negocio, para poder asegurarle a sus pequeños la educación que ellos necesitan.

loans.use: Working capital, purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov M. is divorced with one child. She lives in Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. Lubov sells clothing in the local market. She offers affordable merchandise at reasonable prices and invests much time developing her business. She has already been in this trade for 3 years. Lubov currently has about $5000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit amounts to $800.

Lubov is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to increase restock her inventory and increase her sales and profit. She is hoping to invest the generated profits in the further expansion of her venture and open one more vending facility. We believe her responsible approach to business and current financial assistance will be beneficial for Lubov's business by keeping it competitive and promoting growth so that it will continue to provide necessary income for her and the family.

Note: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. est née en 1970 à Danyi Elavagno, village dans lequel abondent les fruits tels que ananas, mangue, avocat etc. Il est marié et est père de deux enfants. Il a toujours aimé la couture et avait rêvé être un grand couturier. Faute de soutien, il n’a pas pu faire cet apprentissage. Néanmoins il s’est lancer dans la fourniture des articles de mercerie qu’il livre aux couturiers. Son affaire évolue et depuis 2002 il s’est installé à son domicile et ce sont les couturiers qui viennent s’approvisionner chez lui.
A cause de la rentrée scolaire il à besoin de ce crédit pour étoffer son stock de mercerie pouvant permettre au tailleur de bien faire leur métier.
texts.en:
Mr. Komla A. was born in 1970 in Danyi Elavagno, a village in which fruits such as pineapples, mangoes, avocados, etc. grow abundantly. He is married and has two children. He has always liked sewing and dreamed of being a big fashion designer. Due to a lack of means, he was unable to do an apprenticeship. Nevertheless, he began to supply haberdashery items, which he delivered to designers. His business has grown and since 2002, he has run his business from home, and the designers now come to him to supply themselves. Thanks to the start of the school year, he needs this loan to fill out his haberdashery stock and allow the tailors to better carry out their work.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy haberdashery items in preparation for the start of the school year

loans.name: Ryanna

texts.en: Ryanna A., 31, is married with 3 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the taxi business and her husband drives a taxi too. Her taxi serves the public 6 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  Ryanna would like a loan to purchase new wheels, new parking lights, a seat cover, a renewal of her taxi license. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Ryanna's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase new wheels, new parking lights, a seat cover, a renewal of her taxi license

loans.name: Nem

texts.en: Mr. Nem H. is a villager in Saraong Village in Takeo Province. He owns a small piece of land for cultivating rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he now faces a small problem because of infertile soil. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support his field to make a better crop. His wife, Mrs. Nget Sy, assists him on the plantation. Mr. Nem H. is 34 years old and the father of two children who are enrolled in the local school. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support his field to make a better crop.

loans.name: Celia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Celia del Socorro V., tiene la edad de 37 años habita en el sector de buenos aires ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo y dos hijos los cuales actualmente estudian y le ayudan cuando hay producción, el esposo de doña Celia trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una casa privada para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar. La señora de dedica a la agricultura y va cuatro días de la semana a vender al mercado de la capital Managua, ella comenzó su negocio de lo mismo que cultiva, pero eso solo lo hacia cuando sale la cosecha; después de un tiempo decidió comprar frutas y verduras que con sus propios esfuerzos y de su esposo ha logrado establecer un poco su negocio. Con la ayuda de Afodenic que durante cuatro préstamos la ha apoyado, la señora se siente contenta porque su producción la vende a mejor precio, por los insumos que le aplica con cada préstamo que hace a nutra institución
texts.en:
Mrs. Celia del Socorro V. is 37 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Buenos Aires located in the municipality of Ticuantepe along with her husband and two children who are currently in school and who also help her with her work. Celia's husband works as a security guard in a private home to help her with household expenses. She works in agriculture and goes four days a week to sell in the market in the capital city of Managua. She started her business by selling what she herself grows but only when she produces products to harvest. After a while she decided to buy fruits and vegetables and with her own effort, and that of her husband, has managed to somewhat establish her business. With the help of Afodenic, that has supported her with four loans, Celia feels happy as she can sell her products at a better price because the supplies that she buys with each loan help to nourish her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and insecticides for crops

loans.name: Ninh Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Ninh năm nay 34 tuổi, hai vợ chồng chị đang sống cùng 3 con nhỏ tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hóa. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Hiện tại  ngoài thời gian đi làm thợ xây chồng chị Ninh còn  hỗ trợ thêm cho chị trong việc chăn nuôi và trồng trọt.Với mức thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống gia đình chị Ninh đang ngày càng ổn định và được cải thiện hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn, vịt về nuôi..
texts.en:
Mrs. Ninh Thi V. is 34 years old. She and her husband live with their 3 small children in the town of Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa province. She joined the Fund in 2006. Currently, besides his job as a construction worker, Mrs. V.'s husband also helps her with raising livestock and farming. With an income of 2,500,000 VND/month, the family's quality of life is becoming more stable day by day and is improving. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in buying pigs and ducks to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs, ducks

loans.name: Moung's Group

texts.en: Mrs. C., age 53, is the selected leader of a small group loan with four members. Mrs. C. runs a business renting bass speakers to villagers for different occasions, including wedding parties and ceremonies. Her strong communication skills have helped her business grow successfully. She earns approximately $1.5 per day. Her husband is a civil servant in the Education Ministry. They has eight children. Two are married while another two are single and employed as staff at a hotel. Mrs. C. is requesting a loan to purchase more bass speakers so that she can meet the growing demands from customers.

loans.use: To purchase more bass speakers

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou G. est une femme mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle veut, avec ce prêt renforcer son commerce. Elle a une cantine au marché et y vend de la vaisselle. Avec cette activité, elle pourrait mieux contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou G. is a married woman and the mother of four children. With this loan, she would like to bolster her business. She has a little shop at the marketplace where she sells dishes. With this activity, she would be able to contribute more to the family's daily expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of dishes

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Valentina es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Valentina viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, productos que transporta con un carro alquilado.
Valentina necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, zanahoria.
Los sueños de Valentina son construir el segundo piso de su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Valentina is a member of the Violeta communal bank. She lives with her common-law husband, is 35 years old and has 4 children. Valentina travels to the Ayacucho jungle where she sells groceries and vegetables, which she transports in a rented car. She needs a loan for 1500 soles, which will be used to buy potatoes and carrots. Valentina dreams include building a second floor onto her house and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes and carrots.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica sells women's shoes and slippers and also rents out DVDs. Jessica is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She requests a $700 loan to purchase more women's shoes and slippers to sell.  She says thanks to everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more women's shoes and slippers to sell

loans.name: Homid

texts.ru:
Эшонов Хомид 1981 года рождения имеет одного ребенка. Он закончил всего лишь 10 классов,в университете не учился.  
Сейчас он разводит дома скот, а в свободное время мастерит квартиры и помещения , куда приглашают на работу. Во дворе имеет 2 коровы. Также имеет около двух тон сена и других кормов для скота. он жалуется , что в прошлом году было холодно и скот было не чем кормить.  После холодной земли  на лугах мало было травы.   В этом году он благодарит бога за  то что на пастбищах  много травы и коровы и овцы приходят сытыми.
texts.en:
Homid E. was born in 1981 and has one child. He graduated from secondary school, but was not able to go to college. Now he breeds cattle at home, and in his spare time works as a handyman. In his yard he has two cows. In addition, he has nearly two tons of hay and other cattle feed. Unfortunately, last year it was cold and there was nothing to feed the cattle. Due to the cold ground, there was little grass in the meadows. However, this year he thanks God that there is a lot of grass in the pastures and the cows and sheep can eat their fill.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Y. is forty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. She says some of her children are in junior high school while others are in senior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Elizabeth works to assist her husband financially to provide for the family and especially meet the children’s school demands. Her husband is a teacher by profession.

Elizabeth buys cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. from nearby smaller communities and sells to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Quina Ernesto

texts.pt:
Quina Ernesto C. é natural de Maputo, tem 42 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 6 filhos com idades entre o primeiro com 20 e o ultimo com 6 anos respectivamente. Apenas sustenta os filhos e todos moram com ela.

Quina estudou até 4ªclasse e parou quando faleceu a sua mãe, em 1996 inicia actividade comercial que consistiu na compra e venda de feijão Nhemba, milho e mandioca, negocio que veio a mudar para venda de roupa adquirindo na terra do rand e este segundo ela lhe proporcionou um avanço maior nos resultados dai que até data hoje vive deste negocio, qual tem rendimento mensal de 18000,00mt a 20000,00mt.

Quina solicita empréstimo pela primeira vez na Hluvuku com qual pretende aumentar o seu volume de negocio, futuramente pretende solicitar empréstimo para a conclusão da sua casa parte exterior.
texts.en:
Quina Ernesto C. is a native of Maputo and is 42 years old. She is a widow and the mother of 6 children. The oldest is 20 years old and the youngest is 6 years old. She only supports her children, all of whom live with her. Quina went to school until the 4th grade and stopped when her mother passed away. In 1996 she began her commercial activities which consisted of buying and selling Nhemba beans, corn, and cassava. Her business has changed to selling clothing which she acquires in South Africa. She was given an advance that allowed her to earn a living from her business. She has a monthly income of 18,000MT to 20,000MT. Quina is soliciting a loan for the first time through Hluvuku, and she intends to use it to increase the volume of her business. In the future she wants to request another loan to finish the outside of her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of clothing

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 28 years old and married with three children. She has a boutique where she sells clothes and shoes.

She is requesting the loan of N60,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchases more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Rufina es casada, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Rufina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, bebidas, además Rufina viaja a la feria de Paras en donde vende abarrotes y de la feria compra quesos y animales menores.
Rufina necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Rufina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rufina is a member of the communal bank, "Violeta." She is married, is 45, and has 2 children. Rufina has a store in her home where she sells general groceries like vegetables, meats, drinks, and other items. Rufina travels to the market in Paras where she sells groceries, and at the market she purchases cheeses and small animals.
