Rufina needs a loan of 1,600 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Rufina's dreams are to see her children become professionals and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu V. is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more food in the restaurant to sell. Dudu is 32 years old and is married to a husband who is a secretary to the Sudanese People's Liberation Army Party. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more foods to sell in her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a second store

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia R., from the village of Landing, Camella Talakag Bukidnon, is a 54-year-old married mother of nine adult-aged children. To make a living, Artemia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop whose main source of income comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Artemia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. Sometimes she also gardens, cultivating crops for sale.

In 2009, Artemia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of family members and expand the business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She makes a living selling foodstuffs in her shop. Charity has been selling foodstuffs for over 12 years. This business is the source of her income. Charity is 40 years old and married with 5 children. Charity hopes for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nwokocha

texts.en: Nwokocha is married with 5 children and she is 45 years old. She lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells kitchen utensils like cooking pots. She has been in this business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan K. is a 44-year-old farmer who lives in Pursat Province. Chan K. is married to Mr. Chan Sie, age 44, who works with her in the farming business. This couple currently owns a cultivating machine that they use for their farming. In addition, they use their machine to plow a nearby farmer’s farmland for profit. In addition, Chan K. hopes to raise animal in order to sell their mature but she is not enough money to buy it, so she has decided to seek a loan from Kiva's partner HKL to buy piglet, chicken, and duck to breed.

loans.use: To buy piglet, chicken, and duck to breed

loans.name: Marcia Argentina

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Marcia M. es propietaria de su propio negocio de venta de ropa el cuál es atendido por ella misma ofreciendo ropa tanto para damas como para caballeros y niños. 

Actualmente, la señora Marcia solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la mercadería como lo es la ropa para continuar en su venta y así brindarle mejor servicio a sus clientes que a diario le visitan en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Marcia owns her clothing sales business which she operates herself in the department of León. She offers clothing for women, men and children. She is asking for funding to buy more clothing so that she can continue with her sales and offer her customers, who visit her establishment daily, better service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es: “Clavel” es el nombre de la asociación perteneciente al Centro Focal Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto, este grupo cuenta con diez socias, con mucha dedicación ya llevan un año en la organización, dedicándose además de ser amas de casa, también a diferentes actividades generadoras de recursos para el sustento de sus familias.  Justa es la presidente del grupo, ella al igual que la mayoría de sus compañeras se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos, una vez realizados los venden a mayoristas para su comercialización en la ciudad de El Alto.Todas si excepción precisan incrementar su capital para comprar materia prima, solo de ésta forma podrán incrementar  la rentabilidad de sus emprendimientos y mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas y de sus familias.
texts.en:
Clavel is the name of the association that belongs to the Exaltación Community Center in the city of El Alto. This group has ten members. They have one year of much dedication with the organization. Besides being devoted housewives, they also have different businesses, which generate resources for the support of their families. Justa is the president of the group. She, like most of her colleagues, makes bricks. Once they are made, they are sold to wholesalers to be marketed in the city of El Alto. All of them need to increase their capital to buy raw material. This is the only way they can increase the profitability of their enterprises and improve the quality of life for themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Chorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chorn P. is the group leader of four who all live in Trapeang Khchau village in Takeo province. She raises pigs. Since her pig business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets to raise to earn more income.

Mrs. Chorn P. is 47 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer while the other is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Pao Nguon, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Aside from farming this plantation, he is also a laborer.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
el sr. Joel G. C. se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños, cremas, zapatos, pastillas tambien vende pan, churros y refrescos, tiene poco tiempo de haber iniciado su negocio, el tomo la decision de montar su propio negocio ya que la situacion en este pais es dificil y no se encuentran trabajos en empresas privadas ni publicas, ahora el esta empezando poco a poco a surtir su negocio pero necesita capital para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi poder hacerlo crecer, es por esta razon que el esta solicitando el credito.
es casado y tiene hijos.
texts.en:
Joel G. C. sells children's clothing, shoes, pills, creams, bread, churros, and soft-drinks. Not too long ago, he made the decision to start his own business now that the situation in the country is difficult and there aren't jobs to be found in either public or private businesses. He is beginning to expand his business little by little, but he needs money to be able to buy more merchandise so that it can grow. It is for this reason that he is seeking a loan. Mr. C. is married with children.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 24 years old, married, and has a child who is currently in school. She sells baby clothes, Pampers, powder, diapers, detergents, feeding bottles, etc. through hawking. She balances her stock on her head and walks miles to sell to her customers on their doorsteps.
Rita is requesting a loan to inject more capital into the business to make further progress. She wants to use the loan to buy supplies of baby clothes, diapers, Pampers, baby oil, detergents and plastics, to increase her stock. Rita hopes to make more income to provide her child with a good education.

loans.use: To purchase baby items in bulk

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 48-year-old married man with 7 children, 4 of whom are still unemployed. He owns a van that he uses to transport students to their schools. He started his business in 2000 with 15 years of previous experience. Today, Khodor is requesting a loan of $1,200 to perform maintenance for on van and replace his vehicle's wheels.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his van and change his vehicle's wheels

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 42 años, es madre soltera, su hija se llama Dina y tiene 8 años. Ambas viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en una zona lejana de la selva central del Perú.
Sacar adelante a su hija es la meta principal que desea alcanzar, es por eso que para brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida Magdalena es “mil oficios” y no se cansa porque todo lo hace con amor. 
Desde hace 4 años tiene un negocio de venta de comestibles que instaló en la casa donde vive, por las noches trabaja atendiendo en un grifo a algunas cuadras de sus casa, y los fines de semana se dirige al pueblo donde arrienda algunos terrenos agrícolas y donde desde hace un año también plantó frutos cítricos y plátanos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el resultado de poder vivir cómodamente con su hija, esa es su mejor recompensa.
Para el futuro, desea comprar más tierras cultivables y un terreno donde construir su casa propia y donde pueda ampliar su negocio.   

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y sabe que pagará puntualmente sus cuotas, agradeciendo la confianza que le brinda la institución. Además está satisfecha con el trabajo que desarrollará dentro de su banco comunal porque sabe que las personas que la integran son responsables. Con el dinero que solicita podrá comprar tres sacos de fertilizante y dos botellas de insecticidas para cuidar sus plantas de las plagas.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 42 years old and a single mother. She has an eight-year-old daughter named Dina. The two of them live in a rented house located in an area far from the central forests of Peru. Her main goal is to provide her daughter with a brighter future. In order to provide her with a decent quality of life, Magdalena works a thousand different jobs and is never tired because she does it all with love. For the past four years, she has had a grocery supply business, which she operates out of her house. At night, she works at a gas station several blocks from her house. On the weekends, she goes to the town where she has several plots of land rented and where, for the past year, she has planted citric fruits and bananas. What she loves most about her work is that in the end, she and her daughter are able to live comfortably. For her, this is the best compensation. In the future, she would like to purchase more cultivable land and a plot, where she could build her own house and also expand her business. This is her first time seeking a loan from MFP and she is certain that she will make punctual payments. She appreciates the faith that the institution has in her. In addition, she is satisfied with how her communal bank is developing because she knows that the people that are forming a part of it are responsible. With the loan that she is applying for, she will be able to buy three sacks of fertilizer and two bottles of insecticide to protect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
Franklin A. R. es agricultor del Municipio de Telpaneca y se dedica a cultivar y cosechar café.

El Sr. Franklin R. solicita un crédito para el mantenimiento de su cultivo el cual es café, dicho mantenimiento consiste en  que las plantas de este cultivo sean abonadas y cultivadas así como el alporque de la tierra para que aumente considerablemente sus rendimientos.

El tiene aproximadamente 13 años de dedicarse a esta labor, el empezó con el objetivo de aumentar sus ingresos ya que el café es un cultivo que deja muy buenos ingresos principalmente cuando la laza esta buena.

La propiedad de el Sr Franklin R. esta ubicado en la parte alta del municipio de Telpaneca, es una zona húmeda apta para dicho cultivo, el lo asiste antes y después de la cosecha para que la planta mantenga su condición y por ende sus rendimientos, antes de dedicarse a este cultivo es se dedicaba a la cosecha de granos básicos.

El espera que con el crédito que se le otorgue asistir bien el plantillo de café y seguir aumentándolo con la siembre de nuevas plantas para en futuro obtener mayor rendimiento y ganancias.

Franklin es casado y tiene dos hijo y una niña y un barón ambos son menores y aun no están en edad estudiantil.

 Este es el crédito numero 7 que Franklin tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de 6 años, dichos crédito le han ayudado a mejorar su fuente de ingreso el cual es un plantillo de café, el se muestra muy alegre por que los crédito le han impactado positivamente y le han mejorado en gran manera su condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Franklin A. R. is a farmer in the Telpaneca municipality. He grows and harvests coffee. Franklin R. is asking for a loan for the maintenance of his coffee crops. This maintenance consists of fertilizing the plants and cultivating them in order to considerably increase their yield. He has been doing this work for approximately 13 years. He started with the objective of increasing his income. Coffee is a crop that brings good income, especially when the harvest is good. Franklin R.’s property is located in the high part of the Telpaneca municipality. It is a humid area, which is suitable for this crop. He cares for it before and after the harvest so that the plant stays in good condition for a good yield. Before he grew this crop he grew and harvested basic grains. With this credit he hopes to take good care of his coffee plants. He will continue increasing his crops by planting new plants so that he can get greater yield and more income in the future. Franklin is married and has two children; a daughter and a son. Both are young and are not yet school-age. This is the seventh loan that Franklin has had in a period of six years with Ceprodel. These loans have helped him improve his source of income, planting coffee. He is very happy because the loans have positively impacted him, and they have help him greatly improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leaf fertilizers and pay for the labor to maintain his coffee

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto G. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. He is 35 years old. Alberto is married. To make a living, Alberto owns & operates a business selling "ukay-ukay" or used clothing in the local community. Alberto has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alberto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alberto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Alberto is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Alberto from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Watfa

texts.en:
Watfa is a 49 year old married woman with 2 children. When she got married 30 years ago, she started running a tailoring business from her home to earn more income for the family, in addition to being independent with her own business activity. She is well-known in the whole region due to the amount of experience she has in tailoring. She creates many different products, and also offers repairing services. 

Today, Watfa is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine to replace the used one, so that she can faster serve her clients and maintain her good reputation.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang D., aged 44, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business selling motorbike spare parts at a local market in the province, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a motorbike repairman, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Seang D. and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more motorbike spare parts to stock the store. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts for resale

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Juana Maria A. B. tiene la edad de 37 años, vive en el barrio Medardo Andino, es casada y su esposo es chofer, y le apoya económicamente a los gastos que la familia tiene mensualmente, ella trabaja como conserje desde hace 3 años, ellos son una familia humilde y sus ingresos mensuales son bastante limitados.

Una de las necesidades que tiene la familia es mejorar las condiciones de la infraestructura del hogar, pero sus limitaciones económicas no le permiten llevar a cabo este proyecto, motivo por el cual solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción y remodelar de esta manera toda su humilde morada, este apoyo les ayudara  a ellos dos, ha habitar en un espacio más cómodo y seguro,  gracias a esto mejoraran sus condiciones económicas-sociales
texts.en:
Juana Maria is 37 years old and lives in the Medardo Andino barrio in Managua, Nicaragua. She is married and her husband is a taxi driver, and they support each other to cover the family's monthly expenses. Juana has worked as a caretaker for the past three years. This is a humble family, and their monthly income is quite limited. One of the family's biggest necessities is to improve their home's infrastructure, but their limited economic resources haven't allowed them to take up this project, which is why they are requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to remodel their humble home. This support will help both Juana and her husband, giving them a more comfortable and secure dwelling and improve their socio-economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel home

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La Señora Laura tiene 29 años, está  casada con el Sr. Fabiano de 31 años, ambos son  comerciantes y tienen una hija de 5 años llamada Estefani quien actualmente está cursando el primer grado de la   Educación Básica.
 Ellos viven en la casa de los padres de Laura ya que les fue imposible comprarse una casa propia.
Laura se dedica a la compra y venta de calzados, comenta que hace más de 15 años se dedica a la venta pero trabajando para otras personas, y que hace tres años se hicieron de capital vendiendo sus electrodomésticos y empezaron a trabajar por cuenta propia. 
Ya que sus ventas las realiza en forma ambulante, ella depende mucho del buen clima, ya que en los días de lluvia se dificulta las ventas, pero deseosa de salir adelante siempre busca la manera de aumentar sus ganancias; para ello solicita el crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de calzados, pues tienen bastante demanda en su negocio.
Ella demuestra que es una gran persona dispuesta a seguir luchando para lograr aumentar su nivel de vida y considera el crédito como una herramienta fundamental para que su negocio crezca de manera a asegurar el bienestar de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Laura, age 29, is married to 31 year old Fabiano. They are both merchants. They have a five year old daughter, Estefani, who is currently in first grade. They live in Laura’s parents’ house because it was impossible for them to buy their own house. Laura buys and sells footwear. She says that she has been selling for over 15 years, but she worked for other people. Three years ago they started working independently using money from selling their domestic appliances. She sells as a street vendor, and she relies a lot on good weather. On rainy days it is difficult to make sales. She wants to get ahead, so she always looks for a way to increase her earnings. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy footwear. There is a lot of demand in her business. She demonstrates that she is a great person prepared to continue fighting in order to improve her standard of living. She considers the loan to be a fundamental tool for her business to grow in a way that assures the well-being of her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes, sneakers, clogs, and boots for women, men, and children

loans.name: Del Pilar

texts.es:
La Sra. Del Pilar M. González de 37 años de edad es vendedora de leche conocido en la zona, vende varias partes de la zona de Villarrica. 
Empezó hace 5 años con la ayuda de su esposo Ricardo Cabral Benítez, quien trabaja como capataz de dicha una estancia (establecimiento ganadero).
La señora Del Pilar quiere aumentar la cantidad de leche para vender y para ello debe comprar una vaca lechera y  solicita el préstamo a la Fundación Paraguaya ya que ella no cuenta con el dinero para realizar dicha compra.
Ella confía mucho en su trabajo y tiene mucha esperanza de que puede mejorar la situación de vida actual.
texts.en:
La señora Del Pilar M. González is 37 years old and is a well-known seller of milk in the area. She sells in different portions of the area around Villarrica. She began 5 years ago with the help of her husband, Ricardo Cabral Benítez. He works as a foreman on a large ranch. La señora Del Pilar would like to increase milk sales and therefore must buy a dairy cow. She has requested a loan from the Fundación Paraguaya (local lending institution) because she doesn't have the money to buy a cow. She feels confident of success in her work and fully expects to improve her current living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow from Holland

loans.name: Cecilio Efrain

texts.es:
El señor Cecilio Efrain O., es casado y su esposa realiza los trabajos del hogar con sus dos hijos menores de edad, habitan en el barrio Los Ríos, él se dedica a la agricultura de la piña desde hace mucho tiempo atrás, siendo esta su fuente de ingresos más importante del hogar.

Uno de los principales problemas que ha tenido y que obstaculizan el día a día es la escases de agua que no abastece la zona, para sufragar este problema tienen planeado construir una pila receptora de agua que les almacene  para los días de escases, fue gracias a la reforma agraria que la familia inicio sus días en la siembra, otro de sus planes, es realizar un estudio detallado del suelo donde se siembra para realizar cambios significativos que a futuro le genere mejor producción, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales vegetativos y fertilizantes que mantengan en buenas condiciones el terreno donde cosecha , esta inversión a sus tierras a futuro les traerá una mejor ganancias que permitirá llevar a cabo los planes que se ha trazado, para el bienestar de su familia.

Con  apoyo de Afodenic y los Fondos Kiva a logrado mejorar sus niveles de vida que le han permitido un progreso a su bienestar y el de toda la familia, espera se le continue apoyando para futuros proyectos que le fomenten sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Cecilio Efrain O. is married. His wife and older children do the housework, and they live in the Los Rios neighbourhood. Cecilio has been a a pineapple farmer for many years, and this is the most important source of income for their household. Water scarcity in his area is one of the main problems that bothers him day to day. To solve this problem they plan to build a basin to collect water to store for shortages. Thanks to the agrarian reform, the family was able to start farming. Another plan of theirs is to perform a detailed study of the soil in order to make significant changes and achieve better production. They are requesting this loan to buy plant materials and fertilizer to keep their soil in good condition. This investment in their land will bring them better earnings and allow them to realize their plans for the welfare of their family. With the support of Afodenic and Kiva funds they will be able to improve their quality of life and well-being. They hope that this support will continue in future projects to improve their income.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and plant material

loans.name: Ker

texts.es: Ker tiene 66 años de edad, se le considera un hombre muy carismático, vive con su hijo en su casa propia. Siendo natural de la selva peruana, Ker aprendió desde muy pequeño los secretos culinarios de la selva, gracias a su madre, quien le enseño con mucha paciencia como se debían preparar, logró instalar un restaurante en su ciudad natal. Sin embargo tuvo graves inconvenientes con los ladrones por lo que cerrar su negocio. Es así que decidió darse otra oportunidad pero en otra ciudad, lugar donde ahora tiene su casa, acondicionando un pequeño restaurante, que con ayuda de su hijo ofrecen actualmente los mejores platillos de la selva, siendo muy conocido por los lugareños de su barrio. Además el esfuerzo y empeño que pone a su trabajo ha hacho que gane clientes, quienes están muy contentos de ir a su restaurante, ya que además de comer muy rico también pasan un buen momento. Se le considera un cliente muy antiguo en MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual con el pago de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Ker is 66 years old and considered to be a very charismatic man. He lives in his own home with his son. Being a native of the Peruvian jungle, Ker learned at a young age the secrets of jungle cuisine from his mother, who taught him with great patience how to prepare these dishes. Ker managed to open a restaurant in his hometown, but he faced serious problems caused by thieves which forced him to close his business. However, he decided to give the restaurant business another opportunity, but this time in another city where he now makes his home. After equipping his small restaurant, Ker now has the help of his son in offering the best jungle dishes that are well-known among the neighborhood locals. As a result of the effort and commitment to his work, he has been able to attract customers who are happy to come to his restaurant so that they can enjoy the rich food and have a good time.

Ker is a long-time client of MFP and has been very prompt with his payments. The loan he requested will be used to buy ingredients for preparing his dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients used in preparing his dishes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married woman. As the mother of three school-age children, she decided to build up a tailoring business in her home. She takes on tailoring work upon client request and produces a variety of new clothes in addition to offering clothing repair services. With her home business income, she has been able to help her husband in supporting the household. She and her husband share the goal of supporting their children in completing their education through the university level. 

Today, she is requesting $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. in order to improve her business. She also wants to purchase textiles so she can offer a variety of products to her customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: To improve her business and to purchase textiles

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
Kirindi-Kayunga is where 38-year-old O. Umaru has been operating his butcher shop for a decade now. With weekly 100,000 shillings profits accruing to his business, he is able to make ends meet reliably. As a result of his hard work and the good rapport he has with the meat suppliers, his business has prospered. Being a responsible married father, he has ensured all his 3 children are in school. 

With this loan, he wants to expand his business by constructing another butcher shop and he also believes he will be able to buy more kilograms of meat as his prospects improve.

loans.use: construction of second butcher shop; purchase of meat

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married and has three children. She lives in Novyi Rozdil where she sells sheets, blankets and bed linens in the local marketplace. She started her business fifteen years ago. Presently, she has 10,000 UAH in inventory and her income is over $1,100.

Galina is seeking a loan of 12,000 UAH to increase her working capital and her sales as a result. She is a good planner which has always helped her approach all her liabilities with wisdom and responsibility. She admits it was risky to launch her enterprise fifteen years ago when there was so much instability in the country. However, she is happy she ventured and succeeded. 

Galina is hoping to keep her business running smoothly which would help her provide for her family needs and pay all the bills.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Nanda Kumari

texts.en:
This is 65 year-old Nanda kumari S.. She is married and has 3 children aged 45, 35, 26. In 1980, she established her grocery shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to increase inventory of store. In the future, Nanda kumari plans to capitalize more. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: increase inventory of store

loans.name: Assylyn

texts.en:
Assylyn D. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 48 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Assylyn owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily-use products. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Assylyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase additional products to sell and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Assylyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
el señor Celso A. tiene 54 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Concepcion Alvarez con quien procrearon 6 hijos y solo dos dependen de ellos.
viven en la Caucara desde hace 20 años dedicandose al cultivo de maiz y a la compra/venta de granos basicos, refrescos, abarroteria en general.
Su pulperia esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, el credito lo utilizara para compra de refrescos, jugos, arroz, frijoles, azucar, leche, sopas, pastas, harina de maiz y trigo, churros, manteca, aceite, candelas, pan, huevos, pastillas, sal, condimentos, papel higienico.
 
su mayor deseo es que su cosecha sea mejor este año comparada con los años anteriores.
texts.en:
Celso A. is 54 years old and is married to Concepcion Alvarez. They have six children, but only two still depend on them. They’ve lived in Caucara for 20 years, raising corn and buying and selling basic grains, soft drinks, and general groceries. Their general store is located within their home and they will use the money from this loan to buy soft drinks, juices, rice, beans, sugar, milk, soups, pasta, wheat and corn flour, churros, lard, cooking oil, candles, bread, eggs, cakes, salt, condiments, and bathroom tissue. [Celso’s] greatest desire is that this year’s harvest will be better than those of previous years.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Melida Eudocia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita,  conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Melida ella tiene 74 años de edad, hace varios años quedo viuda, su querido esposo y compañero de toda su vida falleció  hace ya 5 años aunque dice ella que las heridas de su partida aun lastiman su corazón, tuvo tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y tienen sus familias, una de sus hijas vive con ella.

Tiene un local de ventas de repuestos automotrices, trabaja junto a su hija desde las 8 am hasta las 17h00, su negocio ya tiene 14 años, los repuestos se los traen desde Guayaquil y Quito.

Es socia del Banco Comunal hace 4 años y le gusta la forma como se organiza el Banco y además por los beneficios que brinda la institución. Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mas repuestos para tener de todo para sus clientes.
 
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio hasta que Dios le de fuerzas.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas (United Women) Microfinance Group meets in the San Alejo residential community of the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabi province, which is known for its gorgeous beaches that are visited by both national and international tourists.

Here we found Ms. Melida, age 74. She became a widow several years ago; her husband and life-partner passed away 5 years ago, though she states that the wounds of his departure still hurt her heart. She has three grown children who have their own families. One of her daughters lives with her.

She has an auto parts shop, and works with her daughter from 8:00am until 5:00pm. She has been in business for 14 years, and she brings the auto parts all the way from Guayaquil and Quito.

She has been a member of this microfinance group for 4 years, and she likes the way it is organized. Furthermore, she likes the benefits that the institution offers. She will utilize this loan in purchasing more auto parts so that she can have everything that her customers need.

Her goal is to keep expanding her business as long as God gives her strength.

loans.use: Purchase spare auto parts

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina C. is currently in the business of selling sugar, beer and soda at a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and soda to sell.  

Regina is 22 years old and married to a farmer. She has no children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia A. is 48 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the municipality of Medina, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Letecia runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she primarily buys and sells canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits and snacks in the local community. Letecia has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Letecia successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Letecia is requesting a new loan, her fourth from HSPFI, of 13,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph M. is a dairy farmer.  He has been farming for eight years and has employed two people.  He sells milk to the people of his local residence.  Besides farming, he is engaged in a transport business as a driver.  He is a hardworking man who hopes to be self-employed in the future. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become determined in his business and hopes to prosper in the business. He has requested for 70,000 KES to buy a dairy cow and to renovate the cow shed.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and renovate the cow shed.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Adelina V. is from the Barangay of Pulot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years-old and married to Alejandro V..  They are blessed with four children some are adults and others still school age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store and a coconut, charcoal and firewood buying and selling business. Her husband is her assistant in this business. They’re been engaged in these businesses for 20 years already. They earn an average amount of not less than P5,000.00 a month from these businesses. 

On November 25, 2009 Adelina joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelina, as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities, has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php7,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php6,000.00 as her third loan availment which will be used to provide  additional capital for her businesses.  The additional future income will be used to meet their basic needs, to make loan repayments and to pay for the children’s education. She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her businesses.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva N. is 38 years old, married, and supports her family by operating two business ventures: buying & selling ready-to-wear clothing and farming (sugarcane plantation) businesses. She lives in 111, Brgy. Dancalan, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her buying & selling of ready-to-wear clothes and farming (sugarcane plantation) businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 14,700. Eva is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can continue to purchase more clothes to sell.  This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Eva aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.ar:
محمد في عمر 27 سنة ليس متزوج يعمل في بيع السكاكر والمشروبات الغازية والقهوة له في العمل حوالي 3 سنوات
يحب عمله وعائلته يريد دائما التجدد في العمل يسعى الى امتالك عمل خاص به ويريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة 
الى توسيع المصلحة شراء بضائع جديدة له زبائن يقصدونه هم من جيرانه ومحيطه يتميز بالنظافة في العمل والدقة
وحسن المعاملة لكنه يعاني من صعوبة مادية ليزيد من مدخوله العملي
texts.en: Mohamed is 27 years old and single. He has been selling candy, sodas and coffee for the past three years. He loves his family and his job and is always seeking to enhance business. Mohamed would like to own a private business. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, he seeks to expand business and purchase new products. His clients are his neighbors and acquaintances. Mohamed maintains the shop well, and is accurate and courteous to his clients. He has financial difficulties and seeks to increase his income.

loans.use: Purchase new products for his shop

loans.name: Korng

texts.en:
Korng L., 58, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She is a housewife while her husband is a traditional doctor, earning an income of approximately $23.80 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $20 on other necessary expenses.

L. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a plot of land to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a plot of land to resell

loans.name: Jose Henry

texts.es:
José reside en Osicala departamento de Morazán, tiene 22 años de edad, está viviendo con su esposa y su hijo de dos meses de edad, José es dueño de un camión de carga y lo usa para comercializar arena y piedra, trabaja a tiempo completo abasteciendo a los clientes con materiales de construcción, tiene un año de experiencia en el trabajo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para comprar materiales arena y piedra, los cuales necesita para continuar en el trabajo y ofrecer a los clientes, este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar el negocio y ha contar con este trabajo por un tiempo más.
Para José sus objetivos son muchos como el de poseer casa propia, estabilizar su situación económica, para alcanzarlos el tiene mucho esmero en su trabajo y no duda en llegar a realizarlos en el corto plazo.
texts.en: José lives in Osicala, a Department of Morazan.  He is 22 years old and lives with his wife and son of two months old.  He is the owner of a cargo truck, which he uses to sell sand and rock.  He works full time to supply his clients with construction materials and has over one year of experience in this sector.  He is seeking a loan in order to purchase more sand and rock, which would help him expand and maintain his business for a longer amount of time.  José has many objectives: possess his own home and stabilize his economic status.  In order to achieve this, he puts a lot of care into his work and is determined to reach his goals in a short amount of time.

loans.use: Purchase materials to sell, such as sand and rock.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: selling Ready to Wear (clothing), selling cosmetics and operating a general store. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 40,000. Helen is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Helen aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Marcia Argentina

texts.es:
La Sra. Marcia Argentina Martínez Munguía, es madre soltera de ocho  hijos de los cuales solo uno  tiene a su  cargo actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en el mercado la estación de la ciudad de León, cabe mencionar que lleva 12 años dedicados a esta labor, lo que ha venido ayudarle a mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia.
Con los créditos que Ceprodel  le ha brindado ella compra por  pacas la ropa usada anteriormente realizaba  sus compras por piezas y así  obtiene mayor ganancia lo que   ha logrado a incrementar su capital,  lo cual le ha ayudado realizar  mejora a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcia Argentina Martínez Munguía is a single mother of eight children, but only one is still in her care. She sells used clothing at the station market in the city of León. It should be mentioned that she has devoted twelve years to this business, which has helped her improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

With the loans from CEPRODEL, Marcia has been able to buy used clothing in bales. She previously bought individual pieces. Now she has more income as a result of increased capital. This has helped her make improvements to her home.

loans.use: Purchase two bales of used clothing

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a businessman who operates motorbike transport business to earn his living.  He also sells charcoal so as to boost his income.  He was previously employed before he went into business.  He has really learnt a lot about business management through the training offered by Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his charcoal-selling business into wholesale in the future.  He also plans to buy another motorbike so as to earn more income.  He has requested 30,000 Kes to buy charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Naidansuren

texts.en:
Naidansuren, 38, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on the outskirts of the city. He is a skilled carpenter and makes wooden products to fill custom orders. In addition to his carpentry business, he operates a food shop with his wife. They started the shop with a working capital of 300,000 MNT and their current working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT.

 They want to expand their business and enlarge their shop. Naidansuren is a very hard-working and honest person who is trying to build everything by himself. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more foodstuffs for the shop.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza T. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Analiza is widowed and has seven school-aged children. Analiza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling canned goods, junk food, detergents & beverages in the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2011, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & beverages. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Analiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & beverages

loans.name: Phlorng

texts.en: Phlorng Y., 61, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Y. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about $1.50 each per day. Three of her children are employed, earning an income of around $3.50 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $25 on food and $60 on the other necessary expenses. Y. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella L. is from the village of Lubid, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 49 years old. Estrella is married and has five adult children. 

To make a living, Estrella makes and sells food and drinks for passengers in the bus terminal. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Estrella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Estrella is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook snacks for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Estrella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook snacks for sale.

loans.name: Rokel Group Ii

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Rokel II” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Yeabu. Yeabu was born in the village of Massorkoh about 50 years ago. She is a widow with four children. Yeabu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), groundnuts, etc. With this loan, Yeabu is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business. 

Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, gari, groundnuts, etc., in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Elvis Paul

texts.es:
Elvis de 21 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en el  zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la misma que se  encuentra en el departamento de Piura.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque sus pobladores desarrollan la actividad de agricultura , ganadería y artesanía.

Desde hace 2 años Elvis se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de animales (ovejas y cerdos), su corral lo tiene en la parte externa de su casa para mayor seguridad y comodidad.  Sus animales se venden rápido en los mercados que los ofrece por estar bien alimentados con comida balanceada y pastos naturales,  lo cual le permite aumentar sus ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias.  

Por lo mismo Elvis a solicitado un préstamo  de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Aleternativa para la compra de animales y su respectiva comida. Al incrementar sus ventas podrá solventar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  

Elvis es conocido por los comerciantes de la zona y en de los distintos mercados donde ofrece sus productos por ser un hombre honesto, trabajador y con muchas ganas de  mejorar en la vida, para seguir ayudando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Elvis, 21, is single living with his parents in their house that only has electricity located in the rural part of Tambogrande District which is itself located in Piura Department.  This district is notable because its residents farm, raise livestock and are craftsmen.

For the last two years Elvis has been buying, raising and selling animals (sheep and pigs).  His corral is located in the rear of his house for better security and comfort.  His animals sell quickly at the markets he sells them at because they are well fed with nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses which allows him to increase his profits to meet daily needs.

For this reason, Elvis has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy animals and their respective feed.  By increasing his sales he’ll be able to repay the loan and improve his quality of life.

Elvis is knows by all the local merchants and in the various markets where he sells his products for being an honest, hard working man with a strong drive to improve his life to continue helping his parents economically.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with seven children. Five of the children attend school and two are still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three months, she has operated a perfume selling business and a business selling clothes, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of owning a cosmetics shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase body sprays and ladies dresses to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase body sprays and ladies dresses to sell

loans.name: Vouen

texts.en: Vouen, aged 45, is a worker. She is a single mother with three children, one of whom is studying while the other two work in a factory. This family can earn income of $10 per day. Every month, she has to spend $65 on food, $4 on electricity, and $10 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work. She plans to get a small store in the market so her daughter can sell groceries instead of working in the factory: after her son finishes high school she wants him to study motorbike repair. She expects their daily income can support her children and achieve her plans.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work

loans.name: Téné

texts.fr:
Mme Téné est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé à 10ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. Un va à l’école et elle a 04 personne a sa charge.

Elle vend des pagnes et des mèches depuis 05 ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont ses voisins, ses amies et toute personne ambulante.

Elle veut s’acheter 10 pièces de pagnes et un carton de mèches. 

Mme aide son mari dans l’entretien de la famille avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique de pagnes, de produits de beauté et de mèches. Et aussi aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ms. Téné is married and the mother of two children. The elder is 10 years old, and the younger is three. One goes to school. Téné has four persons to support. She has been selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and hair extensions for five years. She gets her supplies at the market of Sector 10 of Ouagadougou. Her customers are her neighbors, friend, and anyone walking by. She want to buy ten lengths of pagne cloth and a box of hair extensions. With her profits, Téné helps out her husband in caring for the family. Her ambition is to open a large store selling pagne cloth, beauty products, and hair extensions, and also to help cover her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy a half-bale of 'pagne' cloth and a box of hair extensions

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi est un jeune homme de 32 ans. Il est célibataire et sans enfant.
Kossi travaille comme photographe  et comme revendeur depuis 2007.Il revend des cd et des batteries dans sa boutique nommée « About » à Baguida face à la station d’Afanoukopé.Elle achète les batteries et les cd à Lomé. Il travaille avec un employé.
Kossi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afind’acheter des cartons de cd et des batteries.
texts.en:
Kossi is a young man of 32 who is single and has no children. He has been working as a photographer and small-scale retailer since 2007. He sells CDs and batteries in his little shop called « About » in Baguida opposite the Afanoukopé station. He buys his batteries and CDs in Lomé. He works with one employee.

Kossi has requested his first loan from WAGES so as to buy cartons of CDs and batteries.

loans.use: to buy CDs and batteries.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva, de 35 años, convive con Sergio, de 35 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Mirla y Nelsi. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. “Me siento feliz de poder continuar con mis objetivos, a paso firme”, afirma muy contenta. El principal trabajo de Primitiva, es la compra y venta de animales menores como: cerdos, gallinas, ovejas y cuyes, los que enseba, para luego revenderlos en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma. Pero hace un año, compró un auto con el que realiza trasporte público; cubriendo las rutas Palcamayo – Tarma; en esté negocio, Primitiva, obtuvo muy buenos resultados, pues según menciona; existe poco acceso a los poblados lejanos de la localidad, donde la mayoría de sus habitantes necesita trasladarse a la ciudad para comprar víveres, comestibles y negociar sus cultivos y demás trabajos independientes que realizan. Por ello, hace poco concretó la compra de una movilidad más, con el que está adquiriendo más ganancias, pero continúa ahorrando ya que se quedó sin capital de trabajo por su nueva adquisición. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente alegre de poder compartir su éxito con los demás integrantes. Razón por lo que agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes y promete ser puntual con sus cuotas.
Primitiva de recibir su apoyo; invertirá en la compra de varios animales menores para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Primitiva, aged 35, lives together with Sergio, aged 35.  They have two children, Mirla and Nelsi.  The family lives together in their own home, located in the town of Ricrican. 

"I feel fortunate to be able to continue with my goals at a steady pace," she says happily.  Primitiva's main occupation is the purchase and sale of small animals such as pigs, chickens, sheep and guinea pigs.  She fattens them so she can later resell them in the central market in the town of Tarma. 

However, a year ago she bought a car with which she provides public transport, covering the routes from Palcamayo to Tarma.  Primitiva has been very successful in this business, because as she mentions, there is little access to the remote villages in the area.  It is from these remote villages that the majority of people need to get to town to buy food and groceries, to negotiate regarding their crops, and to do other types of independent work.  Therefore, she recently completed the purchase of a further vehicle, with which she is now earning additional profits, but she is continuing to save money as she has run out of working capital for new acquisition. 

She belongs to the communal bank "Mirando a un Futuro Mejor", ("Looking for a Better Future"), and this is her third loan through MFP, where she feels happy to be able to share her success with the other members. This is the reason that she is grateful for the support of all of you, and promises to be punctual in her repayments.

On receiving your support, Primitiva will invest in the purchase of several smaller animals to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy small animals.

loans.name: Dhanmaya

texts.en:
Dhanmaya is 38 years old. She is married and has two children aged 17 and 13.  In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working six days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Dhanmaya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

As a borrower, to improve her living standard, extra training is needed.  Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia tiene 65 años D. edad, está casada desD. hace mucho tiempo con el señor Simeón D. 87 años D. edad, y viven en su propia casa que está situada en la ciudad D. Encarnación.
La señora Virginia es comerciante desD. hace tiempo, tiene una Despensa y Carnicería en su domicilio que es atendida por ella misma, y con la ayuda D. su familia. Comenta que tiene mucha clientela que acuD. diariamente a su local. Ella además le cuida a su marido quien ya es mayor y está en silla D. ruedas debido a una caída que tuvo. Gracias a su negocio ella pueD. salir adelante, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier imprevisto que se le presente. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por tratar D. tener una vejez digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. carne, pollos, embutidos, panificados, bebidas, artículos D. primera necesidad en general. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues D. obtener el crédito le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Virginia is 65 years old and has been married for a long time to Simeón who is 87 years old. They live in their own home that is located in the city of Encarnación.
Virginia has been a merchant for some time. She has a store and a butcher shop in her home that she tends herself and with the help of her family. She says that she has a lot of customers that come to her store daily. She also takes care of her husband who is already elderly and is in a wheelchair due to a fall. Thanks to her business, she is able to get ahead, maintain her home and pay for whatever unexpected expenses come up. She says that everything she does is to try to have a dignified and decent old age. She is requesting the loan to buy meat, chicken, sausages, baked breads, drinks and basic goods in general. She thanks the Foundation for the opportunity that it gives her; obtaining the loan will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, sausages, baked breads, drinks and basic goods in general.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Zoila es socia del banco comunal El Cisne, vive por una comunidad alrededor de la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia está rodeada de montañas las mismas que nos regalan hermosos paisajes, su gente es muy amable, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Doña Zoila tiene 61 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, casados y viven independiente. Ella  vive con 3 nietos quienes le hacen compañía. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propia y es el sacrificio del trabajo conyugal en su juventud.

La Señora. Zoila hace 15 años labora como empleada en una casa en la cual trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. También se dedica a la cría y venta de animales como son cerdos, cuyes y pollos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 10 años y es una de las socias fundadoras, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  cerdos y en su alimento.

Su meta es criar más animales.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of 'El Cisne' (The Swan) community bank.  She lives in a community in El Valle parish.  This parish is surrounded by mountains which provide us with beautiful landscapes.  The people are very kind and they maintain the culture and traditions of their parents.  They work in commerce, raise animals and farm.

Zoila is 61 years old, married, and has four children who are all grown up, married, and live independently.  Zoila lives with three grandchildren who keep her company.  Her husband works as a builder.  They own the house in which they live.  It is the result of their joint sacrifice and work during their youth.

Zoila has been working in a private home as an employee for 15 years.  She works from 8 o'clock in the morning until 3 o'clock in the afternoon.  She also raises and sells animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.

Zoila has been a member of her community bank for ten years.  She is one of the founding members.  She will invest her new loan in buying pigs and pig feed.  Her goal is to raise more animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es: Honorata, de 24 años, es una mujer entusiasta y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su  pareja Richard de 26 años  y su querida hija Samerli de 05 años de edad. Desde muy joven tuvo a su hija, y al ver que la necesidad albergaba su hogar decidió acompañar a su pareja en sus faenas rutinarias, que es la agrícola y desde entonces juntos trabajan para salir de la pobreza. Es así que todos los días sale a trabajar sus fincas sembrando cacao, café y hoja de coca, productos que una ez cosechados son llevados a vender a distintas empresas de chocolates y pastas dentales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad y el horario, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga sw insectos que perjudican sus plantas. Este será su noveno crédito con MFP y espera de un pequeño préstamo para poder seguir desarrollándose y por lo cual esta dispuesta en cumplir con el pago respectivo de su préstamo. Con el crédito le será de mucha utilidad ya que con ello comprará varios costales para poder almacenar sus productos y mas adelante planea comprar nuevas tierras.
texts.en: Honorata is 24 years old. She is an enthusiastic and hardworking woman who lives with her partner Richard, 26 years old, and her beloved daughter Samerli who is 5 years old. She had her daughter at an early age and, on realizing the need for a home, she decided to join her partner in his routine agricultural tasks; since then they have worked together to overcome poverty. This is why she goes out to work her land every day, planting cocoa, coffee and coca leaf, products that once harvested are taken to be sold to different companies that make chocolates and toothpaste. What she likes the best about her work is the freedom and the working hours as she can freely enjoy her green fields. She has been doing this work for 5 years and believes that the hardest part of the job is protecting their crops from insect pests that damage the plants. This will be her 9th loan with MFP and hopes with this small loan to be able to continue growing and as such is willling to make the repayments necessary on her loan. The loan will be very useful as with it she will buy several bags in which to store her products and later plans to buy new land.

loans.use: to buy bags in which to store her products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hoi is 53 years old. She lives in An Ninh village. She has two children. She has a general store. She sells groceries. She has been working this job for 5 years. She has a monthly income of about 3,500 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008 and repaid her loans punctually. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Almendra

texts.es: Almendra, de 20 años, es una señorita emprendedora y trabajadora. Es soltera, vive con sus padres, sus dos hermanos de 18 y 16 años de edad respectivamente, la casa que habita es de sus padres. Las actividad que realiza Almendra es la venta de zapatos femeninos, para lo cual cuenta con un local alquilado en una zona comercial denominada Huequito, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace dos años, en ella cuenta con el apoyo de un ayudante para la atención al público. Paralelo a esto, se dedica a la manicure y pedicure a domicilio, tiendo como principales clientes a sus amistades y familiares, o por recomendación, éste oficio lo aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace cuatro años, y realizándola sola. Lo que le gusta de sus actividades, es el sentirse a gusto realizando una actividad que le gusta, que es la de estilista, y ser una empresaria con la venta de zapatos, a la vez se entretiene. Considera rentable su negocio de venta de zapatos, pues esta ubicada en una zona comercial que tiene una buena afluencia de consumidores, asimismo desea montar un spa en su casa. Este sería el segundo crédito con la institución MFP, le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal, por el apoyo que viene recibiendo. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de zapatos femeninos de diversos modelos a la moda.
texts.en:
20-year-old Almendra is an entrepreneurial and hard-working young lady.  She is single and lives with her parents and her siblings who are 18 and 16 years old.  The house in which she lives belongs to her parents.

Almendra's business is selling women's shoes and she rents a sales location in a commercial area called Huequito.  She has been in this business for two years and has the support of an assistant who helps serve her customers.  In parallel with this, she also provides manicures and pedicures at home.  Her main customers are friends and family members or people who she has been recommended to.  She learned this trade at an occupational training center.  She has been in this business for four years and works alone.

What Almendra likes about her businesses is that she feels happy carrying out work that she enjoys (being a stylist) and she also enjoys being a businesswoman selling shoes.   She considers her shoe sales business to be profitable as it is located in a commercial area which is busy with a good number of consumers.  She would like to set up a spa in her home.

This will be Almendra's second loan from MFP.  She enjoys working with her community bank for the support that she receives.  She will invest all of the sum she has requested in buying different, fashionable styles of women's shoes.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Farmers Initiative B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Farmers Initiative B Group in Western Kenya! Mildred is the facilitator of the Farmers Initiative B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mildred  takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Mildred had a very good maize yield, harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mildred was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mildred  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Mildred will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Farmers Initiative B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 60-year-old married lady who has four sons and daughters. She is married to Mohammad who works as a land broker.

Fatmeh is known for her delicious bread called Shrak. It is commonly used to make Shawerma sandwiches and other food dishes. Her friends used to ask her to make them some bread, so she thought of turning it into a business five years ago. She started selling by the kilo to neighbors and friends.

Recently she expanded her services and started to make larger quantities and distribute to the food shops and cafeterias. Now she has more orders than she can keep up with because of her old Saj, which is used to bake the shrak. Therefore, she applied for a loan in order to buy a new Saj and a new oven to help increase her productivity.

loans.use: To buy a new bakery oven

loans.name: Buud Nooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme FELICITE est la représentante du groupe BUUD NOOMA. Elle est  mariée  et mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé  a 05ans et  le moins âgé a 02ans. 01 va  à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes  en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes  et prêt à porte depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont  les femmes.

Elle veut  s’acheter 10 complets pagnes et 15 prêts à porté pour enfants.

 Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour  contribuer aux  dépenses de la famille. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir une grande boutique.
texts.en: Mrs FELICITE is the representative of the BUUD NOOMA group. She is married and the mother of 02 children. The elder is 5, and the younger 2 years old. One goes to school. She has 03 dependents. She has been selling traditional cloth and ready to wear clothing for 06 years. She buys her stock in the market in sector 10. Her customers are women.
