She wants to purchase 10 traditional cloth suits and 15 ready to wear outfits for children. She uses her profits to contribute to the family's living expenses. She hopes to open a large store.

loans.use: to buy 10 traditional cloth suits and 15 ready to wear outfits for children

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has 6 children.  She is a petty trader, selling saucepans and groceries at Mpredwow, which she has done for 6 years. Her husband is a miner. Esi uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more saucepans and groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maysa

texts.en: Maysa is a 23 year old single woman from Al Zarqa in Jordan. She has requested a 400 JOD loan to buy woman and children clothes to resell in the same of area for her friends and neighbors. In the future she would like to expand her project, and buy a house. Since Maysa is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Ibrahim .s

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Ibrahim.  He is married, and has two children aged 6 and 4 years; one is a school going child. In 2010, Ibrahim established his electronics (torch lights, tapes, radio) business. He began his business because he wanted to help develop his family and improve his livelihood. 

Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about Le 678,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to Pharmacy. In the future, Ibrahim plans to improve his business and his family status. He is working forward for funding as he requires more capital He thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy more dorse

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with five children and one attending school. She is also looking after her mother. She operates a food stall from home for the last three years. She works seven days a week. She generates additional income from operating a pub. She has requested for a loan of UgShs 2,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy crates of beer,soda,a bag of Irish potatoes and cooking cassava. Her challenges include high taxes and high prices of beer and soda. Her dream is to become a supplier of beer, wines, and spirit in her home area. She resides in her own house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer,soda,spirits,cooking oil,irish potatoes

loans.name: Nidia Xiomara

texts.es: NIDIA XIOMARA: Es una joven sonriente y emprendedora de 23 años de edad, con deseos de superación, casada, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Ella en conjunto con su esposo se han dedicado al comercio, debido a la falta de un empleo formal, de esta manera obtienen sus ingresos, contribuyen con los gastos del hogar. Anteriormente su esposo trabajaba como vendedor en una distribuidora; poco a poco con su salario, establecieron una pulpería desde hace 5 años estableció. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: Granos básicos, chiverías, pan, entre otros productos. Gracias al crédito otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, le han permitido comprar una mantenedora, ofreciendo embutidos, jugos y gaseosas. Su sueño es tener su propio tramo, ya que actualmente alquila, pagando una mensualidad de C$ 1,000.00 (Un Mil Córdobas Netos.).

loans.use: para comprar: Granos básicos, chiverías, pan, entre otros productos

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 46 years old and married with three children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Maribel is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Maribel has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya is married, has two sons. Her elder son studies at the Baku State University, he is a lawyer. Her younger son studies at the Economy University. 
Ofelya is a teacher at the music-school. She has talent for music. She can play the national musical instruments: accordion, tar, kamancha,  zurna and etc. 
She borrowed the loan $400 to buy accordion (national musical instrument).
The second loan amount $1000 she spent to buy musical instruments. 
She plans to borrow the loan $1500 to build the room in order to teach the children as a music hometutor. She has been engaged in this busness for 25 years. She is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region. She was settled in Absheron region Masazir village.

loans.use: To build the room

loans.name: Freida

texts.en:
Freida joined Life in Africa in July 2006 as a volunteer with the Internet4Change program. She is a young unmarried lady still staying with her parents. Before she joined, life was not easy because of a lack of full-time employment. At LiA, she has participated in many activities besides the Internet, like craft-making and community leadership work, in which she has excelled. In March 2007, she was offered a full-time position as Marketing Manager for the Life in Africa community.

She now earns a modest community salary of 200,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) per month. (1USD = 1,722 UGX). From the crafts she's learned to make, she earns about 50,000 per month. She is requesting a loan of 250,000 UGX to start a public payphone service in a rented stall near her home. She plans to repay the loan in 3 months.

Freida will be paying her sister 20,000 UGX to help her do the phone business. Since Freida stays at their home, the family is aware of her plans. I met the sister at their home in Kyebando, and she was very happy about the phone business. After paying her sister every month, she will remain with 140,000 UGX.

Freida's project budget is as follows:

1 phone set 150,000 UGX

Renting stall space 30,000 UGX

Airtime 70,000 UGX

Total 250,000 UGX

Freida has also saved 80,000 UGX from her craft sales in recent months, which will help her to meet any unanticipated additional costs for this project.

loans.use: Buying a phone set and renting the operational space.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S., 53 years old, is a mother of 7 children and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She is a hard working mother who struggles in her life to maintain and control all the family's expense, while her husband has had a serious illness for ages. S. sells fruits at the market and typically makes around $7day in revenue. One of her children works at a hotel, while other two work for a small private company as drivers, and the rest attend school.

S. hopes to use the loan to invest more fruits to sell in her stand due to a great demand of her clients. In the future, she is thinking about how to expand her current business with many kinds of fruits in order to satisfy the needs of her clients.

loans.use: To invest in more fruits to sell at the market.

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Ms. Kuy P. is 21 years old and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She runs her own grocery store, called Kuy P.. With her current inventory, she only earns four dollars a day.

But she hopes that she can increase this income. She wants to expand the variety of her products. Her current inventory is limited so she believes with an additional $400 in loans, she can add more types of food products.

loans.use: To purchase products for her inventory

loans.name: Kankoh

texts.en:
Kankoh S. is fifty-two years old and is a widow with five children. Although the children are grown up, Konkoh says her income is to help them to start good homes of their own. She sells vegetables and other items.

With her previous loan, Kankoh purchased one cow, paying the loan installments with income from her petty trading business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 175 to invest in her business. Her future plan is to raise cows and sheep.

loans.use: Purchase livestock to diversify her business

loans.name: Moana

texts.en: Moana is one of the older ladies within the Apolima borrowing center. She weaves fine mats, which are used for special events such as weddings and funerals. Weaving fine mats takes an incredible amount of time and patience, but just twenty inches of fine mats sells for about 2000 Tala or $800. It is very profitable and that’s why Moana prefers does this to make money. This is her 6th loan and she needs $300 to help her business turn a profit.

loans.use: To buy traditional Samoan materials, including laufala and fulumoa for creating fine mats (ietoga)

loans.name: Tina Henriette

texts.en: Koré Tina Henriette is a 30-year-old single mother. She has three children and lives with them in her big brother's house in Yogougon-Sideci, in the north of Abidjan. She has sold plantains and cassava since she was 12 years old. Tina's elder child is in secondary school, and the younger children are both in elementary school. Tina's plantains and cassava business is her sole revenue resource from which she pays household and education expenses. Tina is very courageous and faced a difficult situation when she was left alone to care for her children. She has been able to send all her children to school. She is requesting a loan of $1,100 so she can increase her stock and begin to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more produce

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Mrs. Augustina U. is 30 years old, married with a child, and lives in Benin City, where she sells drinks. She is soliciting a loan of $875 to buy more drinks for sale. This, she said, will help her boost her business. She learned her trade from her mother and started her business in 1994. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Salomatkhon

texts.ru:
Salomatkhon N. lives in Dushanbe. She is 35 years old and is married with two children. She has a secondary education. Salomatkhon sells food products. She has been in this business for three years. Salomtkhon wants to use her loan to purchase products such as flour, sugar, and oil, which will help her expand her business. Her business is the main source of income for her family. She plans to repay her loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Неъмонова Саломатхон Курбоновна. Проживает в городе Душанбе. 35 лет , замужем имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Занимается этим уже 3 года. Планируемый кредит хочет использовать на покупку товара (муку, сахар, масло и др.) , тем самым расширяя свой бизнес. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Komila

texts.en:
Komila is 36 years old and is married with four school-age children. She runs a private store in which she sells a wide range of goods including foodstuffs, soft drinks and perfumes. Komila has been in this business for 13 years and is successful. Her husband left for Russia to increase his earnings and now Komila works even harder to generate sufficient income for her family.

Komila plans to enlarge the range of goods for sale in her store. For this purpose she requests US$650.00 for 3 months. Komila has been a client of IMON since 2005 and has proved herself to be reliable. She promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To diversify  goods in a store.

loans.name: Fatuma's Chimbuko Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 51, is married and has four children, ages 21, 19, 17 and 4 . For the past six years, she has made a living selling cosmetics and food. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily, and makes a monthly profit of around $26.

In the past, Fatuma took out two loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to start her businesses. Now she has applied for a new loan to increase her capital and expand these businesses. Fatuma will share this loan with the Chimbuko group, which has 15 members. These members will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. They run a variety of businesses which sell food, soft drinks and beer, oil, clothing, charcoal and other items.

In the picture, Fatuma is second from the left in a blue dress.

loans.use: To buy more food items and cosmetics

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Madam Yeabu C. thanks KIVA for improving her business and life. KIVA’s loan brought a lot of joy to her life. With the profits she earned, she bought new clothes and shoes for the children and she has saved some for their future school fees. Her plan is to diversify her business to provide more income. She is therefore requesting another loan to purchase 50 gallons of palm oil and other food stuffs.

loans.use: Purchase stocks of salt, tomato paste, onions and palm oil

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en: Rafael I., 48, sells milk to the local milk factory. He has more than 20 years' experience in raising cows. Rafael, his wife and their four children live in the southern region of Bilasuvar, in the Internally Displaced People Settlement. He works as a teacher in a local school and receives social support in the amount of $70 US as an Internally Displaced Person. But the combined salary of $30 US and social support is just not enough to cover basic family needs. To somehow improve his condition he started keeping a cow, but the milk from that cow goes to family needs rather than to the milk factory. Rafael thinks that he needs an additional two cows to expand his milk sales to the factory; they will increase his income and improve his life condition. For this purpose he is applying for $1200 US.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.es:
Clemencia has always had the desire to bring out feminine beauty so she decided to study cosmetology. She began working part time in a beauty salon, and after gaining some experience she was able to open her own salon. In addition to doing good work, she has the qualities of charisma, cheerfulness and good taste, which bring her many clients—clients who come with many requests and for whom she provides new services. Clemencia has in mind several beauty products she would like to buy to complete her salon and to offer better service to the clients who have made this beauty salon one of the most popular in the area. Toward this end, Clemencia appeals to you for your financial support and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Clemencia siempre tuvo gran inclinación por resaltar la belleza femenina, es por ello que decidió estudiar cosmetología, se inició trabajando medio tiempo en un salón de belleza, luego de adquirir mayor experiencia pudo abrir e implementar su propio salón. Su trabajo es complementado con su carisma, alegría y buen gusto, cualidades que le permiten contar con gran cantidad de clientes, clientes que al mismo tiempo le hacen un sin fin de solicitudes y nuevos servicios. Clemencia tiene en mente adquirir algunos artículos de belleza, para terminar de implementar su salón y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes que hacen de este centro de belleza en uno de los más concurrido de su localidad. Con ese fin Clemencia recurre a ustedes para un apoyo económico que promete pagar debidamente.

loans.use: To buy the beauty products needed to complete her salon and offer better service to her clients

loans.name: Yaneth Roxana

texts.es:
Yaneth is 23 years old, and makes sweaters, little caps and everything else her hands can create, an activity thet helps her to support herself, as she lives alone. Yaneth has been passionate about knitting since she was 19, beginning at first with crochet, she now creates garments with a knitting machine, an activity that she does from home with much happiness and pleasure. She produces about four sweaters a day, which she makes with much creativity, inventing new shapes, models and colours. She doesn't find her work difficult as she has a passion for working with textiles. The only problem is that sometimes she has not budgetted for the cost of materials. Yaneth only thinks of her future and works very hard to create a better future for herself. With her loan she will buy material to produce many more garments of better quality and original designs, and to grow her business little by little until she can open her own textile workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Yaneth, con sus 23 años, se dedica al tejido de chompas, gorritos, chullos y todo lo que sus manos puedan crear, actividad que la ayuda a mantenerse, ya que vive sola. A Yaneth le ha apasionado el tejer desde los 19 años, comenzando en ese entonces con tejidos a crochet, hoy se dedica a la creación de prendas tejidas a máquina, actividad que realiza dentro de su casa con gran alegría y placer.Al día, produce un aproximado de cuatro chompas, las cuales elabora siguiendo su gran creatividad, inventando nuevas formas, modelos y colores, su trabajo no se le hace difícil ya que a ella le apasiona el tejido, la única deficiencia es que algunas veces no cuenta con presupuesto para poder adquirir material y realizar sus nuevas creaciones. Yaneth al encontrarse sola piensa en su futuro y trabaja arduamente para forjarse un mejor porvenir. Con el dinero que obtenga, adquirirá material para producir mucho más, con mejor calidad, modelos más novedosos e ir creciendo poco a poco hasta poder montar su propio taller de tejidos.

loans.use: To buy materials of high quality for the Compra de materia prima para la production of her fabrics

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Madame A. Abla est marié et mère de deux enfants à 40 ans. C’est une esthéticienne de formation qui s’est aussi spécialisé dans le métier de coiffeuse. Elle a ouvert depuis 2007 à son domicile un salon de coiffure AMAZONIE COIFFURE. Elle y a aussi associé la vente des produits cosmétiques, des pagnes et de mèches.
Cette association d’activités a donné un coup de pousse a son métier car elle a besoin d’un crédit pour augmenter son stock par l’achat de 5 cartons de mèche et 5 sachets de bijoux.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abla A., 40, is married and the mother of two children. She is a trained beautician who also specialized in hairdressing. In 2007 she opened in her house a beauty salon which she calls Amazonie Coiffure. At the same time, she sells cosmetics, pagnes (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), and hair extensions.

This constellation of business activities has given her salon a boost, and she now needs a loan to add to her stock by buying 5 cases of hair extensions and 5 sets of costume jewelry.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics, costume jewelry, and pagnes

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta E., 50, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the German bun and sewing business. She sells to the village people 3 days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Mareta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use this loan to assist her in buying materials for her sewing business and ingredients for her bakery business. Her husband and children help out.

loans.use: buying materials for her sewing business and ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mr. Hong R. is a villager in Klaong Thvear village in Takeo Province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Pen Sokhoen, is a farmer. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Even though they have different businesses, they do not earn much money for good living conditions. Thus, Mr. Hong R. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to add to his business. He hopes to increase income and improve his living conditions with this loan. He is 25-years-old and the father of one child, who is too young to work or study. His wife is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to his business.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.en:
Raquel M., a member of this group loan and the hardworking mother of two children, is doing everything possible, along with her husband, to feed those children, but at the moment they are not earning sufficient money to ether educate them or feed everyone in the house. The family is currently totally dependent on the money Raquel's husband earns while Raquel stays at home to take care of their children.

Raquel came to Esperanza International after learning about it through a friend, and after several meetings and workshops she has decided to start a small business selling used clothing out of her house, where she can still watch over the kids. She feels that having her own business could really help out the family, and hopefully someday pull them out of the poverty they are in. Raquel is therefore excited about requesting the loan and starting the business, dreaming that one day she will have a big business and be able to send her children to college.

She knows this is just the first step, and there is still a lot of work ahead. Raquel is ready for this new challenge, and she and her family are very appreciative of this possibly life-changing opportunity!!

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị N.  năm nay 47 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và  4 con tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hóa. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm  2006. Hiện tại  nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi, nấu rượu và sự hỗ trợ của hai con đã đi làm với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 5.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lúa dự trữ phục vụ cho việc nấu rượu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị N., 47 years old, lives with her husband and four children in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hóa province. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2006. At present, the main sources of income of the family are raising animals and making rice wine. Also, two of her children have gone to work and contribute to the total family income of about 2,000,000 VND (120 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 5,000,000 VND (300 USD) to invest in buying more rice for their wine production business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice for making wine

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience A. is a single parent and has two children.  Patience received schooling through junior high school.  For the past three years, Patience has sold groceries like biscuits, canned products, etceteras at Roman Assinadze in Cape Coast.  Patience uses her income to pay for rent, utilities and other financial expenses.  Patience will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet customer demand.  With the additional profits from her expanded business, Patience plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Patience will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet customer demand

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba es una  mujer soltera, que a sus 34 años lucha por mejorar su futuro, vive en un cuarto alquilado, el cual comparte con su hermana. Ella viaja todos los fines de semana, de Juliaca a la ciudad de Moquegua, lleva sus artesanías para venderlas en la feria dominical, este traslado le es muy difícil y cansado, pero sabe que tiene que realizarlo, para vender sus productos, ella disfruta de ofrecer su preciada mercadería a las personas que pasan por la calle, tiene 12 años en este trabajo y su negocio es muy rentable ya que solo ella vende ollitas, platitos y otros utensilios de barro.
Pero no solo vende en Moquegua, ya que de lunes a viernes, vende en las ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca, Elba es muy trabajadora y desea tener su propia tienda de artesanías, para ello trabaja arduamente y sin descanso. Siendo este el cuarto préstamo al que accede, tiene ya buenos antecedentes en MFP de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y eso lo saben bien los miembros de su banco comunal, es por ese motivo que confían en ella. Elba comprará más implementos para fabricar más artesanías de barro, los cuales costarán alrededor de mil nuevos soles, invertirá todo en incrementar la cantidad de su mercadería
texts.en:
Elba is a single woman who at 34 years of age fights hard to create a better future for herself. She rents a room which she shares with her sister. Every weekend she travels from Juliaca to the city of Moquegua to sell her crafts at the Sunday market. This trip is both very difficult and tiring but she knows she must make it to sell her products; she also enjoys offering her prized merchandise to passers-by. She has been in this business for 12 years: it is very profitable as she is the only one selling pots, plates and other clay kitchen utensils. She does not only sell in Moquegua as from Monday to Friday, she also sells at the markets of Juliaca. Elba is very hard-working and wants to have her own craft store, which is why she works so very hard without rest. This will be her fourth loan; she has a good track record with MFP, having repaid previous loans on time as is well known to her fellow community bank members which is why they have vouched for her. Elba will buy more items to make more clay crafts; she estimates this will cost 1,000 soles. She will invest the entire loan in increasing the amount of goods she has for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her crafts

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Hormigas.
Maria es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Maria junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de precocidos como pallar, arveja, garbanzo, panza, patas, también elabora gelatina natural de pata, sus ventas los realiza a domicilio dependiendo de los pedidos, también vende ambulatoriamente.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azucar, leña, descartables, bolsas.
Los sueños de Maria son tener una empresa de precocidos en un local estable y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the community bank, Las Hormigas ('The Ants'). She is 43-years old, married, and has three children. Maria and her husband prepare butter beans, peas, chickpeas, tripe, beef shank, and natural gelatin made from hooves. They sell these dishes from home when there are customer orders, and also sell from a handcart. Maria needs a loan of 2,000 PEN to invest in the purchase of sugar, firewood, disposable utensils, and bags. She dreams of running her business from a permanent location, and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, firewood, disposable utensils, and bags.

loans.name: Morenike

texts.en: Morenike is a struggling young woman who she sells jewelry by hawking all day from Monday to Sunday, from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m., in order to make more sales and increase her profit. Morenike is 39 years old and married with four children. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more jewelry to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en: Mrs. Sieng V., 51, has a job as a vegetable seller. She sells her vegetables to buyers at the market and she is earning around $3 per day. She has six children who are single and living with her. Four of them are employed. Two daughters are garment workers and two sons are blacksmiths. V. hopes to build her son's business using this loan to buy additional ferrous materials.

loans.use: To buy additional ferrous materials for her son

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 48-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Mahmoud has been working as a car painter. He requested a loan of US $1500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase painting tools for his work. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan.

Mahmoud is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network. Mahmoud decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his work and learning new decorating techniques.

loans.use: To purchase painting tools

loans.name: Maria Ángela

texts.es:
La señora Maria Ángela M. M. tiene 23 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella cursa estudios Superiores Técnicos (Secretariado).  Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II.
Maria se dedicaba a la venta de ropa interior, trabajando solo con pedidos (empezó con poca mercadería), ahora su producto lo distribuye por su casa entre sus familiares y vecinos; y también los ofrece en su centro de estudios entre compañeros de clases y profesores.
Recién se ha iniciado como socia en Manuela Ramos.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá  en la compra de mercadería (ropa interior) en diferentes tallas y modelos.
Maria tiene como sueño poner una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Ángela M. M. is 23 years old, and lives in the Florencia de Mora District in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad, Peru.

Maria is currently completing studies in Advanced Secretarial Skills. She is a member of the Community Bank "United for a Better Future" II.

Maria devotes herself to the sale of undergarments, working only on orders (she began with little inventory). Currently she distributes her products from her home to her extended family and neighbors. She also sells in her school to her classmates and instructors.

Maria has recently become a client of Manuela Ramos. With a loan of 300 soles, she will invest in the purchase of inventory (undergarments) in different sizes and styles.

Maria's dream is to own a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purhcase of inventory (undergarments)

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: Paz O. is from the town of Luyongbonbon Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old, widowed, and has four adult children. Paz owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Paz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to purchase improvements for the house. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Luchando Contra La Pobreza Group

texts.en:
Lucia M. R. started her business two years ago with her first Esperanza loan. She opened a colmado out of the side of her house. In the Dominican Republic, a colmado is a small, neighborhood general store. Lucia sells several staple food items such as rice, dried beans, cookies and crackers as well as razors, toilet paper and other daily necessities. Her business has been very successful, and she is now on her third Ezperanza loan.

Lucia's business has helped put her two children through college. She has a son, age 25, and a daughter, age 23. She is enthusiastic about the success of her business and plans to continue to expand her business as much as possible. The community she lives in loves the convenience of having a colmado in the neighborhood. Lucia is now a group leader for Esperanza and her story provides encouragement to all the women in her loan group.

loans.use: Inventory for a colmado

loans.name: Miraga

texts.en:
Miraga A. is married. His wife is a homemaker and they have two children. 

He has always been a hard worker. He started working at an early age, helping his uncle with his clothing business, and contributing his earnings to them from the time that he was 35 years old. When Miraga married, his expenses increased and he had to strike out on his own to build a business that would support his own family. With the help of his savings, he started his own clothing business, and his wife helped him in her spare time. His business has grown little by little, but he wants to continue to grow in order to achieve a better quality of life. 

Miraga is asking for a $2000 loan to buy merchandise for his business so that he can continue to expand. He and his family are very grateful for the support you are providing to help them get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase women's clothes for the rest of the season

loans.name: Amada

texts.es:
Amada  es socia del Bancomunal  San Luís 
Amada es madre soltera, tiene 56 años, dos hijos de 38 y 16 años el ultimo esta estudiando en al escuela estatal.
 Amada  desde muy joven se dedico a trabajar en las ventas, empezó vendiendo libros y revistas le iba muy bien de repente las ventas empezaron a bajar, y ya no le resultaba,  tuvo que buscar otra cosa que vender,  se puso a vender desayunos en la  calle en una carreta  con los años a logrado tener un puesto reconocido por la municipalidad donde da desayunos todos los días de lunes a sábado, todas las mañanas.    
Desde que Amada esta en Finca cuenta con más capital para invertir, su economía ha mejorado.
Amada necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de café, leche, pollo, embutidos, para dar desayunos.
El sueño de Amada es tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Amada is a member of the Bancocomunal San Luis. She is a 56 year old single mother with two children, ages 38 and 16. The youngest is studying in a state school.

From a very young age, Amada has been involved in working in sales. She began selling books and magazines, which went very well for her until suddenly sales began to go down and no longer succeeded for her. She had to look for something else to sell and began selling breakfast in the street from a cart. With the years she succeeded in having a recognized spot by the city hall where she makes breakfasts every morning from Monday to Saturday.

Since Amada is in Finca calling upon on more capital for investing, her economic situation has improved. Amada needs a loan of 1200 soles for the purchase of coffee, milk, chicken and sausages in order to make breakfasts. Amada's dream is to have a clothing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of coffee, milk, chicken and sausages

loans.name: Esther Mafabi’S Group

texts.en:
Esther is 42 years old and married with five children aged between 11 and 19 years. All her children are in school. She resides in and owns a three roomed house where she is staying with eight people. Esther takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area where she owns a canteen in Naguru Go-down. She incurs extra transport costs from and to Nakawa. Esther sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last ten years and besides the canteen business, she sells charcoal.

Esther has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more charcoal and merchandise for the canteen. Esther aspires to seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent home.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mrs. Im T. and her husband have been married since 1987. They have two sons and two daughters. One of their sons is radio repairer, one daughter is a garment factory worker and other attends school. The family lives approximately 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

The couple has been farming more than 20 years. They grow vegetables and other kinds of crops on their farmland in the village and sell their products to a middleman who comes to their house. Im doesn't have enough capital to farm, so she is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase oxen to plow her farmland.

loans.use: To buy oxen

loans.name: Teodora Benita

texts.es: Doña  Benita es originaria y con residencia en el canton Poxlajuj Totonicapan se encuentra ubicado a seis kilometros de la cabecera departamental con acceso accecible su actividad que realiza es ama de casa con los ingresos que obtiene, le a brindado estudios a sus tres hijos necesita de un credito ya que un hijo de ella esta finalizando sus estudio del nivel difersificado, en la elaboracion del seminario con el tema cuidemos el medio ambiente ya que es un requisito fundamental para, culminar el ciclo escolar dos mil nuev

loans.use: Gastos de Estudio

loans.name: Ray

texts.en: Ray R., 44 years old, is a low-income people living in the province of Pursat, in Cambodia. Ray R. and her husband are local crop planters. They have also been working in the rice trade business during the coming harvesting season: collecting rice from farmers and re-selling it to earn profit. Ray R. is taking out her first loan to buy a pair of buffalo which she will use them to help plow the farmland, as well as raising its offspring in the future.

loans.use: To buy a pair of buffalo which she will use them to help plow the farmland, as well as raising its offspring in the future

loans.name: Francacio

texts.en:
Francacio G. is from the town of Tuburan, Aloran Mis. Occ. He is 55 years old. Francacio is single. To make a living, Francacio owns & operates a store, selling a variety of food products in the local community. Francacio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities. The income from his business is used for his daily needs.

In 2007, Francacio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francacio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Francacio is requesting a new loan of 7000, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Francacio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 44 years old and she is still very determined in managing her retail store that she has operated for almost a year. Her daily net income is Php 200 and, according to her, together with her husband she's covering their family's expenditures. They want their children to have a better education and that's why she's working with patience for her family.

Lydia and her husband are blessed with four children, they are: Diana, 22, a housewife; Sammy, 20, a delivery boy; Mario, 17, a farmer; and Jonalyn, 14, who stopped his schooling due to financial constraints.

Lydia is asking for a loan of Php 14,000 from Kiva lenders to strengthen her business in order to improve her family's life. She hopes that she will obtain the desired loan so as to be able to buy more products for her store.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store

loans.name: Baatarhuu

texts.en:
Baatarhuu B. is a 34-year-old single mother who lives with her two young sons in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her sons live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest son is seven years old and attends a local secondary school. Her youngest is five years old and will soon start school. B. manages a hair salon in her town. She started her business in 2008 with capital of 50,000 tugurgs after working as a hairdresser for two years in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She graduated from a hairdressing course in 2000 and has gained much experience as a hairdresser over the years. Her salon has been successful in its first year of operation. B. has quickly grown her business and built a positive repution among her many customers. Today, her working capital exceeds 500,000 tugrugs. B. hopes to continue to grow her business in the future and continue to provide excellent service to her customers. She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase tools and materials used in hairdressing. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials used in hairdressing

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas” desde hace 7 años, vive en el distrito y provincia de Puno, y departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudio hasta superior completa, se dedica a compra y venta de hortalizas.

Marleny nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para poder comprar verduras.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar mercadería como: cebolla zanahoria, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su capital propio y poder ejercer su profesión..

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros que gana.
texts.en:
Marleny, 31, has been a member of the "Las Kantutas" communal bank for 7 years. She lives in the district and province of Puno, Puno department. She is a single mother of a son. She completed higher education and she is a vegetable merchant. Marleny relates that her first, 300 sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement was used to buy vegetables. She now is requesting 800 new soles to buy more merchandise like: onions, carrots, etc. Her dream for the future is to have her own capital and be able to work in her profession. What she likes the most about her communal bank are the savings she gets.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy onions, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing cloth

loans.name: Nancy Maribel

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Crédito es formado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que buscan cada día la manera de salir en adelante y así entregarles un mejor futuro a sus familias, viven por distintas partes de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta la tercera ciudad mas importante del Ecuador, es una ciudad que tiene una belleza natural que enamora a propios y extraños.

La Sra. Nancy Vázquez  vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca por la calle al Cebollar, tiene 28 años de edad, se encuentra casada, su esposo tiene dos actividades tiene una mecánica pero también trabaja como taxista, viven en la casa de su suegra pero de forma independiente, aun no tienen hijos por lo que esta deseando pronto tener uno.

Nancy es secretaria de un Radio Taxi, lleva 7 años trabajando en este lugar, tiene turnos rotativos de 4 a.m. a 12 p.m., de 12 p.m. a 20 p.m. y de 20 p.m. a 4 a.m., tiene un gran vinculo a de amistad con todas sus compañeras y amigas del banco comunal, tiene 2 años trabajando con los prestamos que la fundación le hace entrega y le gusta por que paga interés y capital al mismo tiempo, fue su cuñada la que la incentivo para formar parte del bankito y todos los beneficios que la fundación les entrega, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de herramientas para el taller de su esposo, su gran sueño es tener un bazar para comenzar a tener su negocio propio.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Crédito in made up of a group of tough and motivated women who spend every day looking for ways to prosper and achieve for themselves and their families a better future. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, which is the third most important city in Ecuador. It is a city known for its natural beauty both by its inhabitants and by foreigners. Mrs. Nancy Vázquez lives in the metropolis of Cuenca on Cebollar street. She is 28 years old and married. Her husband has two jobs – he works as a mechanic but also drives a taxi. They live independently within her mother-in-law's house, and they don't yet have any children, although she would like to have one. Nancy is the secretary of a taxi service and has spent 7 years working at this company. She works different rotation shifts, which are from 4 a.m. to 12 p.m., from 12 p.m to 8 p.m and from 8 p.m to 4 a.m. She has close relationships with all the members of her communal bank and has been receiving loans from the foundation for two years. She likes this organization because the loan payments include both interest and capital at the same time. It was her sister-in-law who encouraged her to join the communal bank. Any profit she earns from the loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR will go towards the purchase of tools for her husband's workshop. Her greatest dream is to have a business of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools for her husband, a mechanic

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace S. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Grace is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells electronic load (phone use cards) in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Grace is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es: El joven Luís de 23 años de edad, es muy emprendedor pues durante todos estos años aprendió con su papa el negocio de reparación de todo estilo de zapatos en un mercado de la capital, el aun vive con sus padres, el cual ayuda para poder sastifacer las necesidades diarias de su familia. Por iniciativa propia decide trabajar solo en donde con ayudad de su padre y el financiamiento que otorgo Afodenic logro comprar las maquina para hacer los trabajos y comprar los materiales necesarios para este trabajo Su objetivo a largo plazo es poder comprar un tramo en donde pueda tener mejor seguridad con su trabajo como prestar un mejor servicios a los clientes ya que durantes estos años labora en un mercado muy concurridos por los Nicaragüenses Mercado Oriental. En donde se ubica a diario en una entrada, en donde venden ropa, hay días buenos y días malos pero no se deja de trabajar. Ha captado mucha clientela y con este financiamiento desea comprar materiales como: cuero, hilo de nailon, zuelas para zapatos de hombre y mujer, tapita de tacones, pastas para lustrar, anelina, clavos, agujas para coser entre otros y poder dar a sus clientes un buen servicios.
texts.en:
Luis is 23 years old and very enterprising. Over the years he has learned the business of all types of shoe repair from his father in the capital’s marketplace. He lives with his parents, and helps them meet their daily needs. He decided to begin working on his own and with the help of his father and financing through Afodenic, he was able to buy the machine and supplies he needed to do the work. His long-range goal is to be able to pay for a spot where he can have greater job security and provide better service to his clients, as he works in a crowded marketplace, “Mercado Oriental.” Each day he locates himself near an entrance, where clothing is sold. There are good and bad days, but he never stops working. He has gotten many customers and with this loan he would like to buy supplies, such as leather, nylon cord, soles for men’s and woman’s shoes, heels, shoe polish, tacks, sewing needles, and other things. He wants to be able to give better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in shoe repair supplies

loans.name: Marilyn Elias Group

texts.en:
Marilyn E. is a bonafide resident of Catarman Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old and married with four school-aged children. She has been selling fish for six years and according to Marilyn, her business is profitable. She requested a new loan of 5,000 PHP (her portion of the group loan) to purchase additional fish to sell. She hopes that her business will expand and earn more savings for her children’s education. Marilyn is thankful for the continued assistance and support of Paglaum, especially now that Kiva is helping MFI entrepreneurs.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Martha is the coordinator of her group “Mata D. Palma en Desarrollo 1,2 Group” (Palm Tree in Development), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Martha is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and Avon beauty products by purchasing creams, deodorants, makeup and blouses to sell.

Martha will use the profits to invest in repairing her rented home as well as purchasing a computer for her children to learn on. Her long-term goal is to purchase her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products and clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
La persona que aparece es la esposa.
El señor Daniel B. S. quien es empleado de una compañía muy importante en México donde se distribuye de pan. El siempre piensa en darles una mejora calidad a sus dos hijos menores a los cuales quiere brindarles un patrimonio. Hace tiempo adquirió un vivienda de interés social a la quiere ir haciéndole mejoras. El crédito lo necesita para poner piso firme en el patio de atrás para que en temporada de lluvia no se estanque el agua sucia y sus hijos puedan tomar una enfermedad infecciosa.
texts.en:
The person in the photo is his wife. Daniel B. S. is employed by a very important company in Mexico. It distributes bread. He always plans on giving a better quality of life to his two minor children. He wants to give them a legacy. A while ago he got a house through social services, and he wants to make some improvements. He needs the loan to put down a solid floor on the back patio. During the rainy season there is a lot of dirty water, and his children may get an infectious disease.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put down a solid floor on the back patio

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: La Sra. Emma esta casada, tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende fruta, en la zona de Pampahasi, y por las tardes se dedica a la confección de busos deportivos, vive también en la zona, su esposo es entrenador de Futbol de inferiores en el equipo de la ciudad, tiene dos hijos, una niña que está en colegio y un bebé que cumplirá recién un año, con las dos actividades la Sra. Emma ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, la Sra. es muy trabajadora trata de variar sus productos para atraer mas clientela. El crédito será invetido en la compra de diversidad de frutas, uno de sus deseos de la Sra. es hacer construir su casita ya que tiene un terreno y esta ahorrando para la contruccion, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emma is married and has a small store where she sells fruit in the region of Pampahasi. In the afternoons she works making athletic clothing. She lives in that same area, and her husband is a junior league soccer coach for the city's team. They have two children: a daughter in high school and a baby son who is almost one year old. With her two jobs Mrs. Emma helps her husband with the expenses of the home. She is a very hard-working and tries to vary her products to attract more customers. The loan will be invested in purchasing a variety of fruits. One of her dreams is to build a small house since she already has the land and is currently saving to begin construction. She is very thankful for Emprender and Kiva for trusting her with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan E. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos ya adolescentes que necesitan su espacio en la casa. 
Desea empezar la construcción de dos cuartos en la planta alta de la caso, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el materia y empezar la construcción de las recamaras que serán para sus niños. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una formación en el aria de gerente. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Maria De Jesus Gómez esposa del señor Juan E. ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan E. is the father of two teenage children who need space in their house. He wants to begin construction of two rooms on the upper floor of his house, but he does not have the money needed to buy the materials. Sr. Juan wants to begin the work in order to provide bedrooms for his children. He plans to repay the loan using the salary he earns from his job as a training manager.

The person who appears in the photo is Sra. Maria De Jesus Gómez, the wife of Sr. Juan E., since he was already at work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Begin construction of two bedrooms on the upper floor of his house

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: Martha Isabel tiene 48 años, su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de repostería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Ella en esta ocasión ella necesita el crédito para comprar materia prima mantequilla, queso, huevo harina en grandes cantidades pues necesario para sufragar los gastos de su hogar. El sueño de Martha es mantener el negocio, pues es muy importante mejorar sus condiciones que son necesarias de su hogar.
texts.en:
Martha is 48 years old and makes and sells confectionary items. She has been doing this for five years and has always enjoyed her work. She needs this loan in order to buy ingredients such as butter, cheese, eggs, and flour in bulk. Martha dreams of maintaining her business and improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, ya independizados, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, un distrito que ha venido experimentanto un moderado crecimiento comercial en estos ultimos años, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores agrícolas, como la mayoría de hombres del lugar, trabajó en una empresa agrícola durante algunos años y con las ganancias que obtuvo de esta actividad pudo adquirir un terreno propio en el cual cultiva granos y cereales para hacerse de ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia.

Actualmente tiene sembrado maíz, y espera tener una buena cosecha para poder asegurarle a su familia la estabilidad que merecen, es por ello que está trabajando arduamente para mejorar la producción de su cultivo. Para ayudarse a lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y asegurarse una buena producción.

Pablo es un hombre trabajador y que gusta mucho de la labor que realiza, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder darle a su esposa la calidad de vida que ella se merece. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Pablo is 60 years old. He is married and has two children who are already grown and independent. He lives with his wife in the agricultural district of Cayaltí, an area which has been experiencing moderate commercial growth in recent years. The district is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Since he was very young, Pablo has worked in agriculture, like most of the men in his area. He worked for an agricultural company for several years, and with his savings from this work, he was able to acquire a piece of land of his own, where he cultivates grains and cereals to earn income and help his family get ahead. Currently, his fields are planted with corn, and he hopes to have a good harvest so that he can give his family the stability they deserve. It is for this reason that he is working arduously to improve the yield of his crops. To help him achieve this objective, he has requested a loan of 1500 Peruvian new soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he plans to invest in buying fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his crops and ensure good production. Pablo is a hard-working man who enjoys what he does for a living. His greatest desire is to continue working so that he can give his wife the qualify of life she deserves. He has worked with our institution in the past, and he has been punctual and responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his corn fields

loans.name: Melva

texts.en: Melva T. is a widow who lives in Pader, Barangay Aguisan, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: dried fish vending and food vending. Melva joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past eighteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, Melva is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to buy more fish to sell so that she can continue to save for future home repairs. Melva is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
S. Nasiba is 36 years old. She is married and has three children. She is a very active woman. Eight years ago Nasiba started the business of raising sheep. She sells them after fattening at the local market, usually to local restaurants. With the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are playing the main role in her life. 

Despite recent success, since her business is still quite small, and it doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Nasiba would like to request some loan to expand her business, increase family income and will use the profit generate from the business to repay the loan on time. With this purpose she is asking for a loan of $3000 USD in order to buy more young sheep to later sell when they are fully grown. The well being of Nasiba’s family and her business are in your hands. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small sheep in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 31-year-old married man.  He has a one-year-old child.  He has been operating a butcher shop for four years and has three employees.  

Paul is an active member of a group in Faulu Kenya where he saves his money on a weekly basis.  So far, he has managed to finance his business through the group.  This is because the members of the group guarantee each others' loans. 

He wants to take out his second loan of 80,000 KES which he will use to buy bulls for slaughter.  Paul is a hardworking man who hopes to buy a lorry for transporting bulls for slaughter in the future.

loans.use: To buy bulls for slaughter

loans.name: Sarantsetseg

texts.en: Sarantsetseg B. is 31 years old and lives with her parents and siblings in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Sarantsetseg manages a stationery business at a local market in her town. Her father is a taxi driver, and her two younger brothers work for a local construction company. One younger sister helps Sarantsetseg with her business. Her family is very large and very friendly; all family members are working hard to achieve their goals. Sarantsetseg was able to afford a small car with her business revenues and purchased a number of cattle as well. Sarantsetseg is a modest and quiet woman who does not frequently express her thoughts to others. She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more office stationery for an upcoming academic year.

loans.use: To purchase more office stationery

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah K. lives in Katanga Wandegeya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Annah has a business of tailoring. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Annah sells her products at the shop, by means of retail.  

Annah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy an overlock machine. The main business challenge(s) for Annah include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to have more sewing and over locking machines. She decided to join MCDT because of low interest charged.  Annah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication expense(s).

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en:
Roseminda D. is from the town of Banga. She is 51 years old. Roseminda is married. To make a living, Roseminda raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Roseminda also grows ducks and turkeys. She hopes to grow pigs too.

Roseminda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roseminda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Roseminda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and livestock feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and livestock feed

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es: Erick Antonio tiene 29 años, el se dedica a una pulpería la cual está instalada en su vivienda, el vive en su casa con su esposa y su hijo el cual esta aun muy pequeño, Erick tiene 2 años con su negocio, el sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y con poder agrandar su negocio ya que el número de sus cliente se ha incrementado porque él los atiende con gran simpatía. Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para su negocio pues siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarles a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan.
texts.en:
Erick Antonio, 29, has a grocery store installed in his home.  He lives in his house with is wife and son who is still very little.  Erick has had his business for two years and dreams with improving his family’s quality of life and with enlarging his business because the number of customers has increased due to the gracious service he provides.

He is asking for funds to buy stock merchandise for the store because he’s always concerned to provide everything his customers ask for.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is currently in the business of selling beans, onions, etc., at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and onions to sell.  

Rose is 36 years old and is married to a farmer. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans and onions to sell

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Som E. is a married woman, and was selected as the group leader by the group's five members. They are located in Kaoh Touch village, in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Som E. and her husband, Mr. Matt ME., are farmers who own 2-hectares of field and a threshing machine to cultivate rice for a living. With the threshing machine, they are able to earn a little income throughing rent it to other farmers. But now their threshing machine was broken. Thus, E. decided to ask for a loan to buy spare parts for the machine.  This couple has five children who all are students and also help their parents on the farm.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for threshing machine.

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en:
Baigalmaa B. is a 30 year old who lives with her husband and three sons in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live in an apartment. Her oldest son is in kindergarten while her youngest infant twin sons stay at home. 

Baigalmaa operates a retail clothing business in her town. At first, she started to work as a salesperson in her sibling's business by selling a variety of clothing items in 2008. Since 2009, she has been operating her own retail clothing business using earnings from her livestock. 

For the future, she plans to purchase her own workplace and increase her working capital. Baigalmaa is requesting a 500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase more clothes to sell for the upcoming winter season.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Va A. is 42 years old and married.  She now lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. Va A.’s husband also assists her with the farming business. This couple has one child who is still studying in school. Va A. owns a big farm thA. she inherited from her grandmother. She grows a various crops on it. She currently grows pepper and she estimates thA. she will harvest it within the next month when the plants mature. Unfortunately, her plants are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer to help her crops grow.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer for her plant growing well.

loans.name: Resurreccion

texts.en:
Resurreccion A. is from the city of Oroquieta City. He is 45 years old. Resurreccion is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Resurreccion owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Resurreccion has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Resurreccion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Resurreccion is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Resurreccion from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy K. is a 34 year-old single mother supporting two members of her family.  Her children are Collins Amdany, 14 years-old, and Mercy Amdany,10 years-old. She runs a retail shop which has been in operation for five years.  She sells a variety of items including food and clothes.  Her monthly income is Kshs 10,000.

She is borrowing a loan of Kshs 59,000 and she plans to use it to purchase sugar worth Kshs 10,000, clothes for 40,000 Kshs and soap for Kshs 9,000.

Nancy will use the anticipated profit to invest back into the business  This is her fifth loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD after paying back the previous loans successfuly. Her dreams and hopes are to have a big business, to open a wholesale shop and to be able to manage her family well.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar,clothes and soap to sell.

loans.name: Tserendorj

texts.en:
Tserendorj is a 39-year-old man who lives with his wife and three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his mother live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His three children attend a local school, and B. operates a dairy products trading business in his town with the help of his wife. 

They own and raise 200 livestock and prepare a variety of dairy products during the summer months, and sell those products at the local market during the winter months. He began his business in 2003 and has since gained much experience in his business. 

In the future, he plans to continue operating his dairy trading business as a stable operation. B. is a hardworking man and says, "I want to live and work in the countryside as a herder after providing a higher education for my children." 

He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of dairy products at wholesale prices as well as to repair his car's engine.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of dairy products to resell

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a una granja D. gallinas indias, vive con su esposo y cerca D. su familia; su negocio lo tiene en su propia casa y es la granja D. gallinas las cuales alimenta y les da los cuidados necesarios para que pronto crezcan y engorden, para comercializarlas.
Miriam por el momento tiene la dificultad D. no tener suficiente alimento para su granja por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar concentrado, maicillo y materiales para mejorar la galera donD. viven estas gallinas, con este préstamo espera trabajar mejor, tener un lugar más apropiado para que los animales estén también mejor, además D. que tendrá alimentación para algún tiempo.
Su objetivo es que a través del préstamo pueda realizar lo planeado y realizar una buena inversión.
texts.en:
Miriam lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán. She runs a free range chicken farm. She lives with her husband, close by to her family. She runs her business from her own home, feeding and caring for her chickens so that they will grow and fatten up enough for her to sell. 

At the moment, Miriam does not have enough feed for her farm, which is why she is requesting a loan to purchase feed, sorghum and materials to improve her chicken pen. With this loan she hopes to be able to improve her work, have a more appropriate place to keep her animals and more feed for them to improve their living conditions.

Miriam's aims for this loan is to carry out her plans and make a good investment out of her chickens.

loans.use: To purchase feed, sorghum and materials to improve her chicken pen

loans.name: Mork's Group

texts.en:
The nine people who have formed this village bank loan live in Preaek Ta Sau village in Kandal province. Mrs. Mork C., born in 1971, is the village bank president. She was selected for this position by the other members. 

Her husband, Mr. Him Vannak, earns a small income to support his family by selling bread in the local village. Since this business is going well, her husband would like to start selling bread door-to-door. For this reason, Mrs. Mork C. is requesting a loan to add to her savings in order to buy a motorcycle for her husband's business. With the rest of the loan, she plans to buy more bread so as to enlarge her husband's business. 

Mrs. Mork C. is a stay-at-home mother who prepares the family meals and maintains the household. This couple has four children: two are employed as seamstresses in the garment factory, and the other two attend the local school.

loans.use: To add her savings in order to buy a motorcycle for her husband's business as well as to buy more bread for her husband to offer for sale

loans.name: Jarvin Antonio

texts.es:
JARVIN ANTONIO D. C.DE LA CIUDAD DE MANAGUA  EL TREABAJA DIARIO COMO FONTANERO, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS Y ESTOS SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON JARVI ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ZINC, PERLINES Y PINTURA PARA REPARAR EL TECHO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION.PARA BRINDARLE MEJORES DE CONDICIONES DE VIDA A TODA SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
