Jarvin Antonio D. C.is from the city of Managua.  He works every day as a Plumber.  He’s the father of three, school age children.
Jarvi stops by the Ceprodel offices to request a home improvement loan.  He wants to buy building materials and supplies like: zinc metal sheeting, metal purlines and paint to repair his house’s roof in order to provide his entire family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old married man living with his wife and two young children. He has been working with his tractor since 1999. He works independently based on customer’s demands. In parallel, he works as a taxi driver. In Lebanon, it’s very common to have multiple jobs to be able to pay for heavy life expenses. He obtained his first Kiva loan and was a very good client with punctual payments.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to perform needed maintenance on his tractor including installing a new engine. He is very positive about his future plans and willing to work on bigger projects.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his tractor.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen O. and his family are all engaged in agriculture. Currently Karen and his wife and children all share  one house with Karen’s parents, grandparents and Karen’s brother’s family. Karen’s dream is to provide his immediate family with a house of their own.

As a starting point to this dream, Karen is planning to increase the number of cattle he raises.  This should increase the family’s profit, and allow Karen to start saving for the future.

loans.use: to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 65 años de edad. Vive con su esposa en Jayanca, un distrito agrícola del departamento de Lambayeque, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo en el norte de Peru.

José es maestro de obra de construcción desde hace 08 años, un tiempo que le ha permitido a la fecha conocer a la perfección el rubro. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Los ingresos que percibe le permite ayudar con el sostenimiento de su familia y darle sobre todo una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa.

Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Con su prestamo, desea hacer arreglos en su vivienda, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
José, 65, lives with his wife in Jayanca, a farming district in Lambayeque Department located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo in northern Peru.

José has been a Master Builder for the last 8 years, time which has made it possible for him to learn the occupation to perfection.  He has an established customer base in the zone.  Income he earns makes it possible for him to support his family and, above all, provide his wife with a better quality of life.

At present, his house is a bit deteriorated.  He wants to use the loan to do some home repairs so has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to do so.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Sumber Kelapa Group

texts.en:
Hasunah, 48, works as a craftswoman who makes crafts from recycled materials such as wood waste from the furniture business, coconut shells and other raw materials. Handicrafts are produced in the form of jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, souvenirs for weddings, ashtrays and accessories for the home. All that she makes at home as a Home Industry.

Currently she requires additional funds of Rp. 1,000,000 that will be used to purchase raw materials. Raw materials are bought from a subscription that would take them directly to her house. This requires additional funds, because there are orders for wedding souvenirs. She hopes this loan will be able to increase her business revenue that can support the family income.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Paul Kamau

texts.en:
Paul has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. He is 44 years old, married to Esther Watetu and they have four children. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend, and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. 

in the future, Paul hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a single man who lives in his own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, Robert has run a carpentry business, selling from door to door to his neighbours and passersby. 

Robert faces a major challenge in the seasonality of sales and failing to get contracts from his customers. He dreams of expanding his business and wokrking with long-term contracts in the future. He has decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings he has asked for, he wants to purchase equipment for his carpentry business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Jonife

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jonife works hard to support her family.

She has a balut (fertilized duck eggs) making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising ducks.  Jonife is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more eggs and materials to enlarge her workplace for her balut making business.

Jonife has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and send her child to school.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs and materials to enlarge her workplace

loans.name: Jinkie

texts.en: Jinkie, a 22-year-old married mother of three children in the Philippines, has been providing motorcycle or habal-habal services for eight years. A new member of HSPFI, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the cost of utilities incurred in providing services. In the future, Jinkie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the cost of utilities in providing services.

loans.name: Abanyamutima Group

texts.fr: Jacqueline  est une commerçante, elle est le membre du groupe Abanyamutima. Elle est âgée de 29 ans, elle est mariée, est elle est né au Rwanda.  Elle a 3 enfants  entre 4ans et 9 ans, tous 3 vont à l’école, son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans des études  secondaire. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB.  Elle va acheter  des chemises, robes, pantalons, sous vêtements, tricots, et les vêtements des enfants. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est  l’amélioration des connaissances dans le service commercial pour bien gérer son business. Dans l’avenir elle voudrait  devenir une grande commerçante dans la région, construire sa propre maison, pour sa famille elle voudrait éduquer ses enfants jusqu’au niveau de l’université.
texts.en: Jacqueline is a merchant and a member of the Abanyamutima group. She is 29 years old, married, and was born in Rwanda. She has three children between the ages of 4 and 9, all of whom attend school, and her own education extended up through 6 years of secondary school. This is her first loan cycle with ACB. She is going to buy shirts, dresses, pants, undergarments, sweaters, and children's clothing. Her strategy to increase her sales volume is to improve her commercial and service relationships to better manage her business. In the future she would like to become a major merchant in her area, build her own house and, for her family, educate her children through the university level.

loans.use: To buy shirts, dresses, pants, undergarments, sweaters, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Oreofe Group

texts.fr: OREOFE est un groupement constitué de trente deux personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Ida. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier au Bénin et mènent chacune des activités génératrices de revenus. Ces membres ont décidé de mettre ensemble leur énergie afin de mieux réussir. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ida est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un électricien du nom de Jacques. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont un est leur propre enfant. Aucun des enfants n'est scolarisé. Ida vit ensemble avec sa famille, et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Pour y arriver, Ida produit de l'huile de palme, qu'elle vend à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Ida vend de riz frit. Ida s'approvisionne dans le Sud du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Ida et aux autres membres du groupement OREOFE, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: «Oreofe » is a group composed of 32 individuals whose representative (the woman raising her hand in the photo) is named Ida. The group members live in the same neighborhood in Benin and each earn an income. They have decided to join forces in order to achieve better results. In order to bolster their working capital, this group is seeking its first loan from ALIDé. Ida is 28 years old and is married to Jacques, an electrician. They have four children in their charge, one of whom is their own child. None of the children is in school. Ida lives together with her family and provides for the mainly needs jointly with her husband, thanks to the income from her business. Ida makes palm oil and sells it out of her home. As a side activity, she also sells fried rice. Ida stocks up in the South of Benin. This first loan will help Ida and other members of the “Oreofe” group to expand their business and increase their customer numbers and their revenues

loans.use: to buy palm fruit for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for making piñatas.

loans.name: Tomebamba (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tomebamba está conformado por cinco mujeres y dos hombres quienes son muy amables y carismáticos, laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten mejorar económicamente y salir en adelante. Viven por la comunidad de Zhizho en donde su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y mucha de su gente  labora en diferentes actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, vive por la comunidad de Zhizho, tiene 40 años, es casada y ha concebido 2 hijos de 13 y 9 años de edad, su primera hija está en el colegio y su segunda hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a laborar en la construcción, la casa es de su propiedad siendo el fruto de su trabajo.
 
Doña Rosa se dedica al bordado, esta actividad a aprendió trabajando con su mamá desde que tenía 15 años de edad.  También se dedica a la cría de  pollos, cerdos y vacas a los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de pollos.
 
Su meta es tener un local en donde vender sus bordados.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de uno de los socios que por motivos de trabajo no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Tomebamba” communal bank is composed of five women and two men who are quite kind and charismatic.  They work in different activities that permit them to improve economically and get ahead.  They live around the community of Zhizho whose residents raise livestock and are farmers.  Many of its residents have different jobs in the city of Cuenca.  Its people maintain their culture and traditions.

One of the group members is Rosa.  She lives in Zhizho, is 40 years old, married and has two children who are 13 and 9 years old.  Her oldest daughter is in secondary school and the second daughter is going to the little local elementary school.  Her husband works in construction.  They own their house which is the fruit of their labor.

Rosa embroiders.  She learned this activity working with her mother since she was 15 years old.  She also raises chickens, pigs and cows that she sells in her community.

She’s been in the communal bank for two years and will use her new loan to buy chickens.  Her goal is to have a place to sell her embroidery.

The small inserted photo is of one of the members who was unable to be present when the photo was taken due to work.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Ayde De Jesús

texts.es:
Ayde es una mujer luchadora que siempre ha contribuido con el cubrimiento de los gastos del hogar, oficios como la venta de productos por catálogo así como de comidas han sido algunos de sus negocios. Desde hace algún tiempo en la terraza de su casa acondicionó un galpón de pollos con el fin de vender diariamente los huevos. 

Actualmente Ayde necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones al galpón y así poder llegar a acomodar más gallinas que le permitan mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ayde is a hard-working woman who has always contributed to the household expenses.  She has had businesses such as selling products through catalogs, and also selling prepared food.  Some time ago she fixed up a chicken coop on the terrace of her house so that she could sell eggs every day.

Now Ayde needs a loan for some improvements to the coop so that she can accommodate more hens to improve her sales.

loans.use: to renovate the chicken coop

loans.name: Cristhian Josué

texts.es: Cristhian está estudiando una maestría en gerencia, por lo que se está volviendo para él una laptop que le permita desarrollar y organizar los conocimientos adquiridos en la maestría. El actualmente está pagando la maestría con el esfuerzo de su trabajo. Su sueño es llegar a desarrollar sus conocimientos en una empresa nicaraguense. Sus padres hace algún tiempo perdieron sus negocio en un incendio y es lo obligó a buscar trabajo para servirles de apoyo a ellos. Trata de vencer todos sus obstáculos con madurez y eso lo hace más fuerte para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Cristhian is studying for a Master's degree in Management, which is why he wants a laptop which will allow him to develop and organize the knowledge he is acquiring through his Master's.  

He is currently paying for his Master's by working.  His dream is to develop his knowledge with a Nicaraguan business.

His parents lost their business in a fire some time ago, and so he had to look for work to be able to provide his parents with support.

He tries to overcome all the obstacles he faces with maturity, and this gives him strength for accomplishing his goals.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his Master's degree studies.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PRO DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Pisaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fortunata; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, la socia vende cebollas, tomates, zanahorias entre otras verduras, ella vende en el mercado de Pisaq, ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como tomates, zanahorias, cebollas, pepinos y limones.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fortunata, 33, is a member of the “Pro Desarrollo” communal bank located in Pisaq District belonging to Calca Province, Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and alternates her daily chores with a business selling vegetables.  She sells onions, tomatoes and carrots, among other things, in Pisaq’s market.  She works from 6am until 4pm.  She is able to support her children with this business.  She wants to expand and improve her vegetables selling business and is asking for a loan to buy vegetables like tomatoes, carrots, onion, cucumbers and lemons.

She is happy because of the loan and commits to make all her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like tomatoes, carrots, onions, cucumbers and lemons.

loans.name: Unidos Al Futuro Group

texts.es: Esperanza tiene 49 años D. edad es casada y tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 01 D. ellos dependiente aun ya que está en etapa escolar. Esperanza es una mujer trabajadora que para salir adelante se ha dedicado a diversas actividades comerciales, como venta D. ropa y D. comidas,  gracias a su arduo trabajo  ha  mejorado su vivienda y  aportar en su hogar. Con el buen uso que le dio a sus ingresos, pudo ahorrar y está iniciando un nuevo negocio, instalando en su vivienda una tienda D. abarrotes, pues D. esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos, es por ello que con el fin D. seguir mejorando solicito el crédito para invertir en su nuevo negocio comprando arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche y golosinas. Su meta D. Esperanza es D. crecer en su negocio y llegar a fidelizar a sus clientes. Esperanza es integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal “Unidos al Futuro” grupo que está conformado por 07 socios entusiastas y responsable, ellos están muy agradecidos con el Programa – Prosperidad. Esperanza es la viste una blusa rosada. La señora Odilia no pudo estar presente por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 49 years old. She is married and has 5 children of which 1 is a dependent even though he attends school. Esperanza is a hardworking woman who in order to get ahead works at several business activities such as selling cloths and food. Thanks to her hard work she has improved her house and brings home an income. By wisely using her income, she was able to save and is starting a new business, setting up a grocery store in her house, as in this way she will obtain a better income. In order to continue improving she is asking for a loan to invest in her new business with the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, milk and sweets. Esperanza's goal is to grow her business and earn her customers' loyalty. Esperanza is a member of the communal bank “Unidos al Futuro” which consists of 7 enthusiastic and responsible members. They are very grateful for the program - Prosperidad. Esperanza is the one wearing the pink blouse. Señora Odilia couldn't attend because of work.

.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk and sweets.

loans.name: Gulom

texts.ru: Гулом женат и ответственный отец 2 детей. Более 10 лет он занимается скотоводством. Гулом покупает скот и местных рынках и откармливает их в течении определенный период, а затем продает на выгодную цену. Гулом любить свою семью и работает усердно. В настоящее время он имеет 7 голов крупного рогатого скота, а 4 голов мелко рогатого скота. Гулом хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить свое жилищное условия. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 3000 Сомони. Он заранее благодарить всех вас за ваше внимание и доброты.
texts.en: Gulom is married and is a responsible father of 2 children.  He has been raising livestock for more then 10 years.  Gulom purchases livestock at local markets fattens it over a period of time and then sells it for a profit.  Gulom loves his family and works diligently.  Right now he has 7 heads of cattle and 4 heads of sheep/goats.  Gulom would like to grow his business and improve his living conditions.  With this goal he is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni.  He thanks all of you in advance for your attention and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Phượng

texts.en:
Phượng is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province. She is engaged and has 2 adult-aged children. To making a living, Phượng owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture-making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling bedroom furniture to local businesses and community members. Phượng has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Phượng joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Phượng is now requesting a loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Phượng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Phượng là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province .  Cô ấy đã đính hôn và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Phượng Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị trong phòng ngủ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Phượng thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Phượng kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, Phượng đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Phượng đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Phượng dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Johaihupape Ñamba'apo Group

texts.es:
Este comité "Johaihupape Namba'apo" se integra por 14 señoras D. excelente estructura, unidas, diligentes y fraternales entre ellas. Estas señoras se reúnen en forma semanal para poder darse apoyo las unas a las otras. Tienen como fin principal el crecimiento D. todas ellas, tanto en lo personal como en lo económico.
Ramona es una D. las miembros, ella es modista, a lo cual se dedica hace ya un buen tiempo, comenta que por medio D. su trabajo ella pueD. sustentar a sus familiares. Diariamente tiene mucho trabajo que hacer, es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas, hilos, agujas y demás, con lo cual podrá cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.
Ella al igual a que sus compañeras D. comité están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que se les da.
texts.en:
The committee named “Johaihupape Ñamba'apo” consists of 14 women who have excellent organization, unity, diligence, and a bond of sisterhood among them. These ladies meet on a weekly basis in order to support one another. Their main goal is to see every member grow on a personal as well as a financial level.

Ramona is one of the members. She has been a seamstress for quite some time. Ramona says that her work enables her to support her family. She works hard on a daily basis in order to make a living. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and other supplies so that she can finish her customers’ orders.

Ramona and the other members of the committee are very grateful for the opportunity that has been given to them.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, el cual actualmente tiene 17 integrantes, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Desean que por medio del trabajo en equipo y mediante la ayuda de la fundación, puedan salir adelante.
La Sra. Elida, quién se dedica a la venta de helados, comenta que tiene muy buena venta, pues aunque haga mucho frio igual vende sus helados. Dice que ha logrado formarse una buena clientela y eso le ayuda a tener mejores ingresos. Quiere seguir en su negocio por lo que solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva, para la compra de helados de variados sabores, pues se acerca el calor y es preciso que aumente su stock.
texts.en: Kuña Guapa is the name of the group of women which was formed in the city of Villa Elisa and currently has 17 members, all of them friends and neighbours of same city. With the help of the Fundacion, they want to get ahead by working together as a team. Sra. Elida, who sells icecreams, says that she has very good sales even when its cold. She says that she has managed to establish a good clent base that helps her have a better income. She wants to stay in the business and is asking for Kiva's and the Fundacion's help to buy icecreams of various flavours, as the weather is getting hot and it is necessary to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy icecreams for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr:
Améyo est une femme âgé(e) de 30 ans. Elle est mariée å un peintre auto et ont ensemble 05 enfants.
Améyo travaille comme revendeuse de maïs, haricot, de mil depuis 2005. Elle vend dans un marché de la place et s’approvisionne à TSEVIE(une localité située à quelques kilomètres de la ville de Lomé).
Améyo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs, du haricot de la farine et autres.
texts.en:
Améyo is a 30 year old woman.  She is married to an automobile painter and together they have 5 children. 
Améyo has been selling corn, beans and millet since 2005.  She sells at the market in her area and gets her supplies in Tsevie (a town located a few kilometers from Lomé).  
Améyo has received her first loan through WAGES in order to buy corn, beans, flour, and other items.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, millet and other items.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta, tiene 45 años, ella es dueña de una Ferretería, es madre de 5 niños, es casada, es socia de Finca desde hace 2 años, 
Margarita empezó en la calle como ambulante vendiendo pollo, tuvo un fracaso y no sabia que hacer, y una amiga le invitó a Finca y desde la fecha las cosas han mejorado mucho, gracias a las capacitaciones y al apoyo financiero, valora mucho la confianza que dan a las mujeres de bajos recursos económicos, ahora su negocio ha crecido, con el préstamo comprará materiales para construcción.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Violeta Communal Bank. She is 45 and the owner of a hardware store. She is the mother of five children, married, and has been a member of Finca for two years. 

Margarita began as a traveling street vendor, selling chicken. A disaster happened to her and she didn't know what to do, so a friend invited her to Finca. To date, things are very much improved, thanks to their training and financial support. She really values the trust that they give to women of very few economic resources. Now her business has grown, and with this loan she will buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy materials for construction.

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine is 45 years old and married to Perpetua.  They have six children.  He has been into the tailoring business for the last thirteen years, earning a monthly income of KES 18,200.

He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET Ltd of KES 30,000 to buy sewing materials i.e. clothing textiles and sewing accessories.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the profits to buy more clothing materials for sewing, earning enough money to provide for his family's basic needs and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as ambitious and God-fearing. For the past 15 years, Teresia has operated an open air stall where she sells clothes. Her business is located at a convenient location and her biggest business challenge is unfavorable weather changes, especially when it is sunny. 

Teresia is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to run a boutique within five years.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a 43-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is a married woman with four children. Two of these are still dependent ages 18 and 10 years old. To earn a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store while her husband does farming. Lorna wants to improve her business in the future for her children’s education. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as drinks, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, food seasoning, toiletries and other commodities. In this way, she will be able to improve her store and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, food seasoning, toiletries and other commodities

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is a young, very kind woman. She began her business when one of her relatives was sick, and, in order to support him with the expenses of the illness, she looked for work. She found a way to work selling natural comestic products, and she began her business. Currently it is growing, but she needs $750.00 USD to buy merchandise that will allow her to increase the business\\\\\\\'s stock so that she can increase the variety of her products and to increase sales. Ludivina is a single woman; she looks for an opportunity to find work in her country and to support her home\\\'s expenses. She thanks you for your kindness and support. Support her!

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Ludivina es una mujer joven y muy amable, inició su negocio cuando uno de sus familiares estaba enfermo y para apoyarlo en los gastos de su enfermedad buscó un empleo. Encontró la manera de trabajar vendiendo productos naturales y cosméticos, fue de esta manera como ella empezó su negocio. Actualmente este sigue creciendo, sin embargo necesita de un apoyo de $750 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita crecer las existencias de su negocio, de esta manera ella podría incrementar la variedad de sus productos y sus ventas crecerían.

Ludivina es una mujer soltera, sin embargo busca la oportunidad de encontrar un empleo en su país y apoyar con los gastos de su casa, ella agradece tu cariño y apoyo. Apóyala!

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a young married man with two children. He is a trained mechanic from San’galo Institute of Science and Technology. He was working in a local garage in his area but quit in 2005 and started his business of selling new clothes.

With the support of the $150 loan through PEMCI, he plans to increase the stock of his business. He is continuously garnering experience in the business and inspiring the youth in the area to go into business as a way of breaking out of the poverty trap. Samson is worth supporting.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase an ice box to keep fish fresh

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Ms. Morn M. is a single woman of 38 years. She lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has one brother and one sister. Aside from her full-time job, she also has to take care of her parents.

She works in a garment factory and would like to buy a motorcycle to start a new business. In the future, she also hopes to open a grocery store. She hopes to receive $1,200 in financial aid to take up these endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: "I changed to this business four (4) years ago and I have no cause to regret it. My numerous customers always give me satisfaction," says Mrs. Patience O.. She is a divorced with 3 children, and is 45 years old. She needs the loan amount $400 to expand her business and buy more pepper soup items. She has been with LAPO for the past 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a 28-year-old married mother of two children, and lives in the village of Livili. She is new at her borrowing centre, and her business sells ice cakes which earns her 100-150 Tala ($40-60 US) a week. She enjoys running her small business because its simple and a quick way to earn money.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her ice cake business

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en: Mrs. Sanu M. is 24 years old and resides in Thecho. Thecho lies within The Kathmandu Valley. Most of the people in this locality are engaged in agriculture such as poultry farming. Mrs. M. has 4 members in her family including herself. Her husband's name is Sanu Kaji M.. He has gone abroad in Dubai to work. She has two daughters. The elder daughter is studying in the 7th grade class and the younger is studying in the 2nd grade class. She is engaged in poultry farming. She sells hens, cocks and even eggs in the market. She needs a loan in order to buy necessary things like medicine for the hens and even corn and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy necessary things like medicine for hens and even corn and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 34 year-old Mary M.. She is married with three children, aged 7, 12, and 13. In 2005 Mary established a mobile phone accessories and recharge vouchers business, and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.

Despite being a ‘developing’ country (forgive the label, there remains no consensus on an acceptable definition), it is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania and in Africa in general. Not just professionals, but grandmas in villages, school kids, street sellers. It can probably be attributed to a number of factors, led by the fact that it is the only form of phone communication available to most people, because there are few landlines, and followed closely by how relatively cheap mobile phones are here. All of which makes any phone-related business a safe venture. So, happy lending…

loans.use: Mary would like to purchase additional stocks of phone accessories and recharge vouchers.

loans.name: Nia

texts.en: Nia is 25, married, and has one child. She makes and sells flavoured ice and instant beverages, earning $5.00 a day. Her husband sells vegetables and earns $15.00 a day. She will use this loan to add to her business capital.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Harng

texts.en:
Mrs Harng H., 23, is married and cares for her  young child at home everyday. She and her husband, Mr. Yoeurn Yen, are rice farmers and duck feeders who earn about $6 a day. She lives with her family in the Krosung Krom Tbong Village in the Staung District of the Kompong Thom Province. The business allows Harng and her husband to support their family’s living expenses.

In order to expand her duck-feeding business, Harng  requests a loan of $1,100 to buy more 500 ducks. She appreciates Kiva for their support and promises to be prompt in repaying her loan

loans.use: To buy  500 more ducks in order to expand her duck-feeding business

loans.name: Ngot

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngot V. is a widow with four children; three sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home. Of her other two children, one weaves silk at home and the youngest one is a construction worker. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Ngot has been a weaver for forty one years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who will sell them in Phnom Penh. 

She is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase materials for weaving silk.

loans.use: To purchase materials for weaving silk

loans.name: Amador

texts.es:
Behind my dwelling, houses are being built very close to mine and there is no fence in between. I would like to give more security to my family as the house has no protection, as you can see, and access is easy from behind, so putting up a fence I protect my family more and I would feel more at ease when at work and my family is alone at home, and therefore I request a loan of $700.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

En la parte de atrás de mi vivienda se están construyendo casas, estas casas están muy pegadas a la mía, y no cuento con una barda en ella. Quisiera darle mayor seguridad a mi familia, puesto que la casa no tiene protección como pueden ver y es de fácil entrada por la parte de atrás, así que poniendo una barda protejo más a mi familia y me sentiría más tranquilo en el momento de ir a trabajar cuando mi familia se quedara sola en la vivienda, de esta manera solicito el préstamo de $700.00 dll.

loans.use: Put up a fence behind a dwelling.

loans.name: Bismark

texts.en:
Bismark N. is a carpenter. He is married and has two children, but his wife's income from the goods she sells is insufficient to pay for the family's living expenses.

Nevertheless, Bismark is encouraged by the fact that the demand for his goods is high, so he is looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding his business in order to increase his profits. Therefore, he is seeking additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for his goods by expanding his business.

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta S., 32, is married with 1 child. She has 4 years of experience running her Vegetable Garden business. She sells her vegetables to the public 5 days per week.

Henrietta has had no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). SPBD loans are Henrietta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband helps out with the business as well.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds and also for home improvement

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora is 47 years old and lives with her husband. They both take care of their small granddaughter because their daughter works outside of the city. She sells all kinds of herbs at the markets in the city. She also sells them in the city of Huancayo where she can sell them at higher prices. She has been doing this for over 5 years and this activity occupies most of her day. What she likes about this job is that it is not heavy work and does not require great physical effort. Without a doubt though, what is difficult about it is finding medicinal herbs. This is why she has to visit various places to acquire them as these herbs are the most demanded at the markets. Flora wishes to acquire a greater quantity of herbs to take them to the capitol to be sold. Most of all, she wishes to become known in order to obtain more clients which will increase her income and strengthen her business in the capitol.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Flora tiene 47 años y vive en compañía de su esposo y ambos cuidan de su pequeña nieta porque su hija se encuentra trabajando fuera de la ciudad. Se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de yerbas, las cuales vende en los mercados de la ciudad, como también las lleva a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde las vende a mayores precios, está actividad la realiza por más de 5 años, ocupando casi todo el día. Lo que le agrada es que el trabajo es liviano y no requiere tanto de esfuerzo físico, pero sin duda lo que le resulta difícil de realizar es conseguir yerbas medicinales, por ello tiene que visitar diversos lugares para adquirirlos, ya que son estas las que más demanda rentabilidad tienen en los mercados. Flora desea adquirir mayor cantidad de yerbas y llevarlas a la capital para venderlas, sobre todo darse a conocer, para captar clientes que le ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos económicos y consolidar su negocio dentro de la capital..

loans.use: Increase the quanity of herbs that she sells.

loans.name: Sergio Natalio

texts.es:
Sergio es productor de leche de vaca, esta es comercializada en la población para la producción de queso, percibe un sueldo quincenal por dichas ventas, tambien cultiva maiz (producto a comercializarse en el mes de octubre, temporada de cosecha). 

Vive solo en casa propia (ubicada en la población de Palomar).

El crédito será destinado para comprar una vaca lechera ya que desea incrementar su producción 
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro, esta calificado para obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Sergio is a milk cow producer. The milk is commercialized in town for the production of cheese. He perceives a fortnightly salary for such sales. He also cultivates corn ( which is commercialized in October during the crop period). He lives alone at his own house located in the city of Palomar. The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow since he wants to increase his milk production. This is his first loan with Impro, and he is qualified to obtain the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Saili

texts.en:
Saili T., 46, is married with 10 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She has 5 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Saili's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to finance house repair supplies. Her husband does all the farming.

loans.use: Purchase weedkiller, pesticides, gromozone, knives ,cement, timber and also labour cost for carpenter

loans.name: Samoth Kong Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 13 people located in Trapang Chambok Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, led by Mr. Samoth K.. He and his wife, Mrs. Sor Malai, are farmers who own 1.5-hectares of land upon which they cultivate rice. Due to soil infertility, Samoth is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers.

Mr. Samoth K. is 38 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young at the age of three and four to begin formal education.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Twelve members have end-of-term loans and one has a monthly payment loan. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because the are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support his wife's rice field.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es:
Martha Beatriz Pérez Méndez tiene la edad de 38 años, su estado civil es acompañada, esta Joven tiene 3 hijos su hijo mayor de 19 años cursa recientemente el 3 año de secundaria, su otro hijo de 18 años trabaja en el lavado de carros y su hijo menor de 11 años cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora taxista, sus sueños son de establecer su negocio en su casa de  habitación y en sus propósitos esta darle mejoras a su vivienda ya que es una de las prioridades por la ella lucha ya que desea dejarle a sus hijos un lugar que sea de su propiedad.


Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa como lo es: pantalones, camisetas, camisas para varón y ropa interior, el tiempo que tiene de poseer el negocio es de 15 años, ella inicia con un negocio de auto lavado y decide que necesita mas ingresos para su familia y entonces que decide por cuenta propia realizar la venta de ropa mixta para mujer y varón y mas tarde decide realizar un financiamiento que  este destinado para capital de trabajo ya que se avecina los días festivos y tiene que ofrecer variedad de producto  en lo que efectuara las compras en Managua por lo que necesita movilizarse para efectuar estas gestiones
texts.en:
Martha Beatriz Pérez Méndez is 38 years old, and she has a partner. This young women has 3 children. Her oldest son is 19, and recently began the 3rd year of secondary school. Her other son is 18 years old, and he works in a car wash. Her youngest son is 11 years old and is in grade 4 at primary school. Her partner works as a taxi driver. Her dream is to establish her business in her house, and she proposes to improve her house, which is one of the priorities of why she struggles now, as she wants to leave her children a place that will be their property. Her economy activity involves selling clothes, such as: trousers, blouses, men's shirts, and underwear. She has had this business for 15 years. She began with a car wash business and decided that she needed more for her family, so she decided with her own money to begin selling mixed clothes for men and women. Now she would like to obtain finance that is destined to be working capital, as the festive days are now approaching and she needs to offer a variety of products. She will make the purchases in Managua, for which she needs to be mobile to achieve these negotiations.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nal

texts.en:
Nal V., 58 years old, resides in Kompong Tom Province where she makes a living braiding traditional Khmer clothes for sale. With her looms, Nal can make one to two sets of clothes per day, thereby earning a daily income of about $6 which helps to defray family living expenses. She is a good mother of five children and a dedicated wife to her blind husband. To help meet family expenses, two of Nal’s children are employed, one as a factory worker and another as a garment worker.

Because braiding is the family’s main source of income, Nal is now requesting a loan to buy additional braiding equipment. (She and her client appear in the picture of her workshop)

loans.use: To buy more braiding equipment.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ali has been working in agriculture for seven years. He sells flowers and flower jars. Ali requests a loan of $1200 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase materials for agriculture and jars. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.
Ali is special in his work because he has different types of flowers, has good prices and has a good relationship with his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started he had the land to start his business, but he didn’t have a lot of knowledge of pricing and trading. Ali decided to work in this business because it has been a family business and he has always liked the good smell of flowers. In the future, he plans to attract more clients and expand his business.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to purchase materials for agriculture and jars.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D. est une femme mariée, mère de 2 enfants. Elle participe grandement aux dépenses familiales et s’active au commerce d’huile de palme, de miel et de jus de citron pour y faire face. elle tient un étal au marché. Elle aimerait avec ses revenus assurer ses charges familiales.
texts.en:
Awa D. is a married woman and mother of 2 children. She is involved in a major way in her family's expenses, and engages in selling palm oil, honey, and lemon juice in order to meet these needs. She has a stall in the market. With her income, she would like to secure her family's financial needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell honey, lemon juice, and palm oil

loans.name: Komil

texts.ru: Омонов Комилчон 53 лет, женат имеет четверых детей. Работает бригадиром в колхозе Самгара. Жена не работает помогает мужу по уходу за скотом. У Комилчона три коровы которые в день дают по 8 литров молока каждая. Жена  Комилчона доит и продаёт молоко в кондитерские цеха Самгара. Для увеличения численности скота Комилчон решил обратится в Микроинвест за кредитом
texts.en:
Komil O. is 53 years old and is married with four children. He is a brigade leader at Samgar's collective farm. His wife does not work - she helps her husband tend to cattle. Komil owns three cows, and each gives 8 litres of milk. Komil's wife milks the cows and sells the milk to the confectionaries of Samgar. For increasing the number of cattle, Komil decided to turn to Microinvest for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
ANA MARÍA P. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Atenas Portillanas” con domicilio en el AA.HH. Nuevo paraíso Mz. F Lt. 15 del distrito de Callería, tiene 60 años, 09 hijos, y su esposo tiene trabajo como contratista.

La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 2 años, con él, empezó a vender abarrotes en su casa, que acondicionó para que le sirviera a modo de tienda, pero en esta actividad no le fue tan bien, por eso después de un tiempo cerro la tienda y comenzó a dedicarse a otras actividades entre ellas la alquiler de un moto taxi.
Hoy en día ella administra 2 moto taxis, y justamente el préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en el mantenimiento de sus 2 moto taxis, tales como: cambio de tapizado de los 2 moto taxis, cambio de aceite y afinamiento, reparación de sistema eléctrico, etc.

Manuela Ramos me ha ayudado mucho comenta, ya que pude comprar 2 moto taxis para poderlos hacer trabajar y generar un ingreso mas para mi familia.
texts.en:
Ana Maria P. M. is a member of the Atenas Portillanas Communal Bank. She lives at 15 AA. HH. Nuevo Paraiso Mz. F. Lt., in the Calleria district. She is 60 years old and has 9 children. Her husband is a contractor. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she received 2 years ago, she began selling groceries out of a store she built into her house. This business however, did not do so well. Eventually, she shut down her store and dedicated herself to a variety of other endeavours, including the leasing out of a motorcycle taxi. Today, she owns 2 motorcycle taxis, and with this new loan of 1,500 soles, she will invest in their maintenance. Among other things, they need reupholstering, oil changes, realigning, and an upgrade of their electronic systems. Ana Maria says the Manuela Ramos has helped her a lot. Being able to buy and lease her 2 motorcycle taxis has generated a good income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair 2 motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Mohammad Hamad Group

texts.en:
M. hamad is the group leader of the M. hamad group. There are four members in this group. They all live in District 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. The total amount that the group members want to loan is 20,000 AFN. Each member wants to take the loan to improve his or her business.

M. hamad and Bibi Satara want to take a loan for their fruit-cart business.They want to buy necessary materials for their business.

Bibi Afghan and Syweta want to take a loan for their tailoring business. They want to buy three new machines for their business.

They all want to say that, with the loan, they will be able to get on well and also improve their businesses.

loans.use: To expand and improve their businesses

loans.name: Latipa

texts.en:
A 57-year-old member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Latipa S. industriously cares for her food-selling business. She is married to a farmer and they have six children, each of whom works for them as support. The business is doing well.

Latipa humbly taught her children how to enjoy the business and at the same time earn income from it. The ups and downs of the enterprise are nothing but a normal situation for her, with losses sometimes occurring and good returns accruing at other times. Lapita now sees a good opportunity to expand their business and is therefore requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to add to her working capital. She deeply hopes her children will achieve good educations so they will eventually have businesses of their own.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of meats, spices, etc.

loans.name: Constantina Maria

texts.es:
La señora Constantina es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada con 02 hijos, vive en la Comunidad Punta Sahuancasi, en el Sector Acochupa, ella posee estudios  de primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 año, la sra. Constantina se dedica a la Venta de carne, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 600.00 nuevos soles,  con este préstamo ella  desea comprar mas carne, quesos, para poder venderlos en la feria de la zona, le gustaría poder tener mas capital para comprar mas degollados (ganado) y distribuir a los mayoristas.  Desea poder ser mayorista y ganar mas dinero para así poder darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

A la señora Constantina le gustan mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y las capacitaciones.  Está agradecida al apoyo que da Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Constantina is a member of the Punta Sahuacasi community bank in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 45, married, and has two children. She lives in the Puna Sahuancasi community, Acochupa sector. She has an elementary school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Constantina sells meat. Her first loan was for 300 PEN. She currently wishes to have a loan for an additional 600 PEN. She wants to buy meat and cheese to be able to sell them in the fair in the zone. She would like to be able to have more capital to buy livestock and distribute it to the wholesalers. She would like to be able to be a wholesaler and earn more money. This way she would be able to give her children a better education. Constantine really likes her community bank’s meetings and the trainings. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the support they give.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and alpaca

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Mariam has been selling clothes at a small shop she owns in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. She belongs to the Umoja group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of  approximately $125. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.  

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more clothes ant other items for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Mariam is 31 years old and married with five children. She also cares for two additional dependents. 

Mariam will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mwanaenzi, who has her own small business selling clothes in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and other items for resale

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta A. is 20 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives with her mother in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Alberta is a fishmonger. She sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies retailers and food vendors in her community. Alberta buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes the fish herself. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. She desires to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene un puesto donde vende Salchipapas y hamburguesas , es la única que genera ingresos para la subsistencia de su familia.
Vive en la Zona de Irpavi II de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa alquilada.
Requiere el crédito para la compra de insumos (papa, salchicha, pan, mayonesa Ketchup y aceite).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago se de sus cuotas.
Las ganas de trabajar le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Teresa has a stand where she sells Salchipapas (a dish that usually consists of hot dogs or sausages served with French fries) and hamburgers; she is the only member of her family that earns income for their subsistence. She lives in the Irpavi II Zone in the City of La Paz in a rented home. She needs a loan to purchase supplies (potatoes, sausages, bread, mayonnaise, ketchup, and oil). This is the third time that she has requested a loan through Impro; her financial history proves that she is a good client that always makes her quota payments. Her drive to work has given her the opportunity to obtain this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, sausages, bread, mayonnaise, ketchup, and oil for her business in the sale of Salchipapas (a dish that usually consists of hot dogs or sausages served with French fries) and hamburgers.

loans.name: Esteher

texts.es: Esteher S. de 48 años de edad reside en el municipio de San Martin ubicado en la capital del país. Esteher  tiene tres hijos quienes se encuentran ya casados y fuera de casa, es por eso que Esteher vive sola; ella posee su negocio en el cual vende variedad de productos de consumo, la tienda de Esteher tiene trece años de estar funcionando, ella posee una clientela muy estable ya que es una persona muy amable y feliz cuando sus clientes la buscan, también en la zona no hay competencia de otro negocio como el de Esteher; el crédito que solicita es para surtir su negocio  ya que desea comprar productos al por mayor lo que le ayudara a  obtener  un margen mayor de ganancia cuando ella lo venda al detalle en su tienda.
texts.en:
Esteher S. is 48. She lives in the San Martín municipality, which is located in the country’s capital. Esteher has three married children who do not live with her. Esteher lives alone. She sells a variety of consumer products. Esteher has had her store for 13 years. She has a stable customer base. She is a very kind person, and she is happy when her customers come to her. Also, there is no competition from another business like Esteher’s. The loan she is asking for is to stock her store. She wants to buy wholesale products that will help her get a greater margin of earnings when she sells for retail in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Sinun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinun C., 28, and her husband, Mr. Sean Sem, 33, were marred in 2003 and have three young sons. The family lives in Kosh Dach located on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sinun has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old. In the past, she used to weave for her villagers to get fees. Now, she runs weaving business by herself. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been driving horse cart since 2007.
Sinun is requesting a loan of US$100 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en:
Nkechi is the mother of nine and she is 41 years old. She has a poultry farm where she rears birds and also sells eggs.

Nkechi hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more poultry and poultry feed. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry and poultry feed

loans.name: La Camelia Group

texts.es:
La señora Elvia L. Domínguez tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos los cuales aun viven con ella y con su esposo. Ella nacio en una comunidad llamada La Tranca, al casarse se fue a vivir con su esposo a la comunidad llamada La Camelia desde hace ya 20 años. 

Esta comunidad pertenece al municipio de Tlalixcoyan, esta alrededor de 30min de Tlalixcoyan. En esta localidad se dedican a  la Agricultura entre los cuales se siembran Piña, Pepino, Maiz, Noni, Caña y Papaya principalmente; este ultimo cultivo es el que siembra doña Elvia desde hace  8 años.

Ella inicio esta actividad como alternativa junto con sus esposo ya que en su comunidad el trabajo es poco  y mal pagado, de la siembra de papaya ella junto con su esposo han podido darle estudios a sus hijos.

Doña Elvia solicita un crédito de $ 4000.00 para comprar fertilizante  para su siembra y tiene la esperanza de que le ira bien este año.  

La meta de  doña Elvia es poder comprarse una motocicleta  ya que le es de suma necesidad pues el pueblo donde vive esta retirado de la ciudad y no hay transporte publico para trasladarse.


La señora Elvia se unió con 4 personas (Antonio P., Alfredo C., Benita C. y Martin M.)y formo un grupo llamdo "La Camelia"  para solicitar un crédito de   $21,000.00   el cual invertirán en la compra de fertilizante para las siembras de papaya y maíz que tienen.

loans.use: Siembra de Papaya Maradol

loans.name: Jackielou

texts.en:
Jackielou is a hog raiser for two years. She is 24 years old and already married and blessed with a daughter.  They are living a simple life in Natappian West Solana, Cagayan. Her business has been a great help in providing the needs of their family.  

Lack of feeds supply encouraged Jackielou to ask for financial support from the KIVA lenders.  She is now asking to avail a loan of PHP5,000 that she needed to buy enough supply of feeds for her hogs. Jackielou works hard and patiently enduring all the hardship to give their children a better future. She believes that her sacrifices will someday be rewarded for them to have a progressive living.

loans.use: To purchase feeds supply

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia O. is from the village of Puntian, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 48 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Letecia raises pigs for sale. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn B. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Analyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. Analyn owns & operates a business selling clothing in the local community. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Analyn is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Analyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for her family’s daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Elizabeth owns a women's clothing shop. She also sells women's accessories and shoes. Elizabeth is exceptional in her work because she offers a wide range of products. Her clients are her friends and neighbors.

She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase clothes and shoes for her shop. Elizabeth has been a micro-credit client for six years now and has always paid on time. When she first started her business, she had no problems. Elizabeth decided on opening her business because of her experience. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and shoes for her shop.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
This is Reynaldo B., 60, a store owner and transport operator from Lumil, Silang, Cavite.  He is married to Liberty, 45, a housewife.  

Reynaldo has been in business for twenty years.  He manages his own general store which has grown through the years.  He also manages the operation of their passenger jeepney (minibus), plying varied routes around town.  Combined, he earns more than $875 a month in net profits.

Reynaldo was a bit hesitant when he joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007.  He thought this was just for women entrepreneurs, but he found that to be incorrect, and now he loves to invite other entrepreneurs to join the cooperative.  Reynaldo wants to share with his friends the many blessings he has received since joining the CCT.  He currently needs a loan of 40,000 PHP to improve his general store.  He will use it to stock up on more merchandise for his store.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Genaro O.  solicitante es de la Ciudad d Guayaybi  Calle Toro Piru Mborumbi 2.,es propietario de un taller de moto y motosierra, anexo lavadero  y gomería.
Su negocio tiene  en su propia casa, con una clientela  bien formada, que le genera buenos ingresos.
El mismo lleva 5 años de casado con 2 hijos, y se encuentran trabajando hace 1 año en esa actividad y le hacen falta muchas herramientas para relizar su trabajo en forma optima.
Además de la reparación mediante el crédito otorgado pudo comprar cubierta nuevas para comercializar con sus clientes  y aumentar sus ganancias. 
  Solicita el préstamo para compra de mercaderías varios, para surtir mas su negocio ya que estos meses hay mucha venta .
texts.en:
Genaro O. is from the city of Guayaybi and lives on Calle Toro Piru Mborumbi 2. He owns a motorcycle and chainsaw workshop, attached to a laundry room and tire repair shop. His business is located in his home and has an established customer base, which generates good income. Genaro has been married for 5 years and has 2 children. He has owned his business for 1 year and lacks many tools necessary to do his work well. In addition to business repairs, the loan would allow him to buy new tires to sell to his customers, thus increasing income. He requests this loan to buy various merchandise to stock his business with. There have been many sales in the last few months.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of work tools for tire repair shop.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 32 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her family in Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey (a dish made with milled maize, which is cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish). She has many customers because people who live in her area eat kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. Janet has applied for a loan to buy more supplies, such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her income and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Aun's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Aun C. is a pig breeder. She is 51 years old and the mother of three children who are employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Chhuok Van, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Now he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to grow rice in the field during the dry season. Thus, Mrs. Aun C. decided to ask for a loan to buy farming supplies to support the rice farming. She is the  leader of a four member group who all live in Srae Vong village in Takeo province.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Reyna Amparo

texts.es:
Villanueva se caracteriza por ser un municipio que cuenta con mujeres muy trabajadoras tal es el caso de la señora Reyna C., madre de dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está en edad escolar por lo que debe de mantenerlo y proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para que estudie.
Ella se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa pero actualmente no cuenta con dicha mercadería por lo que está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa como camisas, pantalones, blusas, mochilas, entre otros y así comercializarlos sabiendo que obtendrá los ingresos para continuar brindándole a sus hijos las condiciones para que estudie y que llegue a ser un gran profesional en el futuro.
texts.en:
Villanueva is a town that is known for its hardworking women, such as Sra. Reyna C.. Reyna is the mother of two children, of whom one is of school age. She must support them and provide the conditions necessary for them to study.

Reyna sells clothing, but she does not have any merchandise at the moment. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase shirts, trousers, blouses, backpacks, and other items that she knows how to sell. The income she will generate will provide the conditions necessary for her children to study and help them become great professionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Chek S. is 31 years old, married, and resides with her four children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife staying at home to look after children and the household chores. Her husband operates his three-wheel vehicle to transport workers at the garment factory. By doing so, he is able to cover his family expenses, including their children’s education. Their standard of living has been improved since S.’s husband started this business so S. wants to have a loan to expand his business.

S. is requesting $1000 to buy a new motorbike and a trailer. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Chochope antiguo del distrito de Motupe, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en la agricultura, comenzó trabajando como peón en diversos campos de cultivo de la zona y luego pudo adquirir con mucho esfuerzo un terreno de dos hectáreas que viene utilizando para sembrar diversos productos con los cuales se pueda generar un ingreso adicional y solventar los gastos familiares.

Actualmente tiene sembrado maíz en este terreno, Eusebio se esfuerza diariamente para obtener una mejor producción de su cultivo, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Altyernativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindarle mantenimiento.

Eusebio es un padre de familia bastante responsable y muy entregado a su familia y a su trabajo, su mayor anhelo es ver convertidos a sus hijos en profesionales y hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Eusebio is thirty-two years old and lives with his wife and sons in the old Chochope area of the Motupe district, in the province of Lambayeque, located one and one-half hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He began as an agricultural laborer at various farms in the area and later was able to acquire with much effort a two hectares plot. He sows various crops on this plot, which can generate additional income and pay household expenses. He has currently sowed corn in his plot. He works hard every day to increase his yield; thus he requests for the first time a loan of $725 from Edpyme Alternativa, with which he will buy fertilizers and pesticides for his crop. Eusebio is a responsible father who is very devoted to his family and his work. His greatest desire is to see his boys become professionals and prosperous men.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feritlizers and pesticides for the cultivation of corn

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes L. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Agnes owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Agnes joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en: Ma. Theresa V. is a 36-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in fishing and pig-fattening businesses. She lives in Hacienda Antipolo, Barangay Talaban, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental with her 5-year-old child. Ma. Theresa has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and pig-fattening businesses she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000. Ma. Theresa is now borrowing Php 16,000 so that she can continue her fishing and pig-fattening businesses. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Ma. Theresa aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. In the photo you can see Ma. Theresa with her child and the fish traps, and a big basin for her caught fish. All the fish were already delivered to market before this photo was taken. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two daughters and two sons. Three of her children attend school but the youngest is not old enough yet. Her husband is a driver. Fatuma has a food kiosk and a green grocer. With the loan of 40,000 KES, Fatuma wants to purchase beans, rice, sugar, maize flour and vegetables. 

She has been in this business for 8 years and earns additional income from a merry-go-round. The greatest challenge to her business is the stiff competition and the lack of funds to rent a good shop. She aspires to own a permanent building for her shop someday so that she doesn't have to pay rent.
