Fatuma decided to work with Yehu because the organization does not harass its clients and enlightens them as to how to best use their loans and invest wisely. She rents her home and does not have piped water or electricity. She takes care of her parents, and her greatest monthly expenses are for school fees, food and the rent for her kiosk and home.

loans.use: Beans, rice, sugar, maize flour and vegetables

loans.name: Voch Ngim

texts.en: Mrs. Voch Ngim N. is 37 years old, and she is a villager who lives in Andoung village in Kandal province. She is staying at home and take care of her child while her husband, Mr. Kimong Chav, is a cow middleman who can earn a small income to support their family's living. For her husband's business, Mrs. Voch Ngim N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Maritza Elena

texts.es: Maritza Elena tiene 55 años, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos.  Su actividad económica es la venta de comida, por lo que llegan muchos clientes a disfrutar sus deliciosos platillos, que son muy deliciosos. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella lucha todos los días por salir adelante con su negocio, por lo que es muy admirable a su edad pues tiene muchas energías. Solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para granos básicos, jugos, verduras y frutas. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 55 years old. This is not the first time she has received a loan. She makes a living by selling food and has many customers who enjoy her delicious dishes. Maritza has been doing this for more than 20 years and struggles every day to get ahead in her business. It is admirable that she possesses tremendous amounts of energy at her age. Maritza is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy basic grains, juices, vegetables, and fruits. She dreams of expanding her business and improving the quality of her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, juices, vegetables, and fruits

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita C. is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy. Andres, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Pacita’s husband, Efren, is a quarry leadman and they have three adult children who already work to help defray their family's living expenses.

Pacita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 11,000 from her business activities.

Pacita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 was used to fund the operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 14,000 for her current loan which she intends to use to invest in her general store. Pacita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction supplies for her home

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. is currently in the business of selling crates of beer at the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Alice is 27 years old and married to a clinical officer. She has no children yet. 

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Honest Labour Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “Honest Labour” group. They are women with small-scale businesses based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city, and the town where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch.

This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Nannah K. who is age thirty-seven and was born in Waterloo. Nannah is married and has four children – two are in secondary school and two are in primary school.

For eight years now, Nannah has sold sugar, oil, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), Margi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), rice, gari (a fast-food made from cassava), etc. With her share of this loan, Nannah will buy more of the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more palm-oil, vegetable oil, Margi, rice, gari, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim A. dedicated himself to the raising of poultry 15 years ago. He is married and is a father who needs to support his children, who help him with the business. Nazim is faced with the need to purchase more chickens, which are in very high demand. His monthly income is about 250-300 AZN. He has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to increase his income. He will use this loan to purchase more chickens and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens

loans.name: Omungyenyi Tukwatanise Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
It is now 30 years since Mary O. started up her agriculture enterprise in Omungyenyi, Ntungamo in western Uganda. She belongs to Omungyenyi Tukwatanise group, Ntungamo. With this as her only source of livelihood, she has painstakingly managed to make ends meet, albeit with some long drawn out seasonal income fluctuations and poor road systems to access bigger markets.

With a hard work ethic, the 50 year old widowed mother of 6 children has kept her business on a consolidated growth path. In a month, she makes close to 1800,000 Ugandan shillings. Her business gaining ground over these years has in effect also meant that her family has benefited. Her business plan of action for the future is to be able to purchase beans, groundnuts seeds, and sorghum grains for the coming season. With this loan, she envisages being able to hire manpower for more planting in order to improve on the output for sale.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for planting and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Esperanza En Cristo Group

texts.es:
el grupo Esperanza en Cristo tiene como caracteristica que sus integrantes son personas muy honestas y unidas, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

La señora Belkis Marina A. tiene 25 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, su esposo les ayuda a traves de la remesas que envia de los estados unidos, Belkis trabaja por las noches en un restaurante de la zona y en el dia se dedica a la venta de golosinas como tacos, enchiladas, jugos y almuerzos. 
esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años en su casa de habitacion. 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar refrescos, verduras, carnes, tortillas.
 
el señor Oscar Romeo R. tiene 43 años de edad, tiene tres hijos que dependen de el.
su esposa le envia remesas mensualmente de españa. Oscar se dedica a la venta de agua en su carreta desde hace 1 año.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de un caballo que lo utilizara para jalar la carreta en el cual transporta el agua.
 su mayor sueño es comprarse un carro para vender mas agua.
 
la sra. Brenda Esperanza A. R. tiene 22 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, Brenda se dedica a la compra venta de lacteos desde hace 5 años sus ventas las realiza en barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo, vende su prodcuto desplazandose en su bicicleta.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de queso, mantequilla, ademas vende pan que ella lo hace y lo
cocina en su horno de barro que tiene en casa de su abuela. su mayor sueño es tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza en Cristo” (Hope in Christ) group is notable because its members are very honest and united. Following are details on the various activities they carry out: Mrs. Belkis Marina A., 25, has two children. Her husband helps them via remittances he sends from the United States. Belkis works nights in an area restaurant and during the day she sells snacks like tacos, enchiladas, juices and lunches. She has been doing this work at home for the last two years. She will use the loan to buy beverages, vegetables, meats and tortillas. Mr. Oscar Romeo Rodríguez, 43, has three children that depend on him. His wife sends him monthly remittances from Spain. Oscar has a cart that he has used to sell water for the last year. He will use the loan to buy a horse to pull the cart in which he transports the water. His greatest dream is to buy a car so that he can sell more water. Mrs. Brenda Esperanza A. Rodríguez, 22, has two children. Brenda is a dairy products merchant. She has been in this line of work for five years selling in neighborhoods of San Lorenzo. She sells her products getting around on a bicycle. She will use the loan to buy cheese and butter. She also sells bread that she herself bakes in a clay oven in her grandmother’s house. Her greatest wish is to own her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy products, vegetables, water and beverages, beef and pork, chicken, tortillas and a horse.

loans.name: Elida Del Rocío

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Elida, ella tiene 45 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tuvo dos hijos de 15 y 16 años los mismos que están en el colegio estudiando.

Es comerciante, Se dedica junto con su marido a la venta de  mariscos, lo que más venden son el pescado albacora por libras o enteros, también los camarones tienen bastante demanda, pero ellos venden de todo, trabajan todos los días desde las 4am que salen de su casa para recibir los productos en el mercado de mariscos en Portoviejo y en algunos casos van a comprar a Puerto López y Manta ya que allá les salen más baratos, luego sale a recorrer en un carro por todo Portoviejo, tienen muchos clientes que le compran, también entregan en tiendas.

Este crédito lo van a ocupar para comprar más pescado y camarones para la venta. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades de pago. 

Su sueño es tener un frigorífico.
texts.en:
The United Women Communal Bank is located in the San Alejo citadel, which is found in Portoviejo, the beautiful capital city of the Manabí province. Portoviejo is known for its scenic beaches that stretch across its coasts. These beaches are frequently visisted by national and international tourists.  It is here where Elida resides. 
 
She is 45 years old, and lives in a common law marriage. She has two children, ages 15 and 16, who are students.
 
Along side her husband, Elida works selling seafood. The main item they sell is albacore, a fish which they sell individually or by the pound. Shrimp, which are sold individually, are also in high demand. They begin working at 4am when they go to the fish market in Portoviejo to gather their merchandise. To take advantage of cheaper prices, they sometimes go to the fish markets in Puerto López and Manta. From there they drive to several locations throughout the city to serve their clients. They also sell to stores.
 
Elida is requesting this loan in order to purchase more fish and shrimp for her business. This is her second loan cycle with the communal bank, whose payment services she's been pleased with.

Her dream is to have a vehicle equipped with refrigeration for the seafood.

loans.use: To purchase fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena E. is from the village of Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Elena is married and has 12 adult children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, biscuits, and snacks in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Ulziibayar

texts.en:
Ulziibayar S. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. The family lives in an apartment. Her daughter is an elementary school student while her son is only 6 months old. Her husband has helped with her business. 

Ulziibayar started her business in 2007, operating a grocery store till 2006, after working in Korea between 2003 and 2006. Currently she manages a successful cafe and bar in a rented space. She rents the cafe and runs it daily by hiring two employees. She pays monthly rental fees of 1,500,000 MNT and monthly salaries of 200,000 MNT per employee. Over the years of running the business, she has built a stable operation. Her average monthly income is around 6,000,000 MNT. In addition, she owns two apartments that are used as rental apartments. She earns 700,000 MNT per month by renting her these two apartments to others. She has used her earnings to support her family. She is planning to buy a new jeep car for her family from her business earnings in the future. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to pay customs duty tax for importing a new truck from Korea.

loans.use: To buy a new truck.

loans.name: Bauzhar

texts.en:
Bauzhar K. lives in the Kyrgyz southern city of Osh. She is 51 and married. Bauzhar is the mother of three children: two daughters who live on  their own, and one son of school age. 

After graduating from an industrial institute, she worked at the local cotton plant.  In 1998, in order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Bauzhar decided to begin her sales business. 

Being a very persistent person, she concentrated all her efforts and achieved success. Bauzhar managed to obtain a selling place at the local market, which had a wide assortment of home rubber sheets.  Unfortunately, in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the city of Osh, Bauzhar lost her business, which was robbed and looted. 

However, Bauzhar isn't giving up and is ready to resume her lost business and continue to work. For this reason, Bauzhar is applying for a loan of 100,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her activity. She plans to purchase more goods to resell at the local market. With the revenues, Bauzhar wants to give a good education to her son.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase goods for resale

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa R. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Pag-asa, Barangay Port Barton, San Vicente, Palawan. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and a farming business. Her husband, Leartes R., is 62 years old. He works as a street worker to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 5 children who are between 13 and 30 years old. 

Leonisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Leonisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use towards the purchase of more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business. 

Leonisa R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Agatona

texts.en:
Agatona N. is from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Agatona is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Agatona owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling confectionery products like "pastel", "pop rice" & "otap" in the local community. Agatona has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Agatona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agatona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Agatona is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like "pastel" & "pop rice". This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Agatona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like "pastel" and "pop rice"

loans.name: Cesar Alfredo

texts.es:
Cesar Alfredo R. G. tiene 64 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre vive con la compañera y con sus hijos en el Cantón Chillanes  Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Cesar Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  mejorar la calidad de vida.

Le gusta pasar en el campo.
texts.en:
Cesar Alfredo R. G. is 64 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 7 children.

The TRES DE NOVIEMBRE community bank has 28 members and is located 90 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Cesar Alfredo is a farmer who grows rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  He buys his products in Mata de Cacao and makes his sales in the Matilde Esther shopping center and in Bucay.

Cesar Alfredo is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his rice, banana, cacao, orange and cassava crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to improve his quality of life.

Cesar Alfredo likes to spend time in the country.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 37 years old. Erlinda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a service-based business, providing motorela or habal-habal services to the local community with her husband as the driver. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. 

Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for maintaining the motorcycle

loans.name: María Laura

texts.es:
María tiene 29 años. Ella es soltera y tiene un hijo pequeño aún. Trabaja vendiendo joyas de plata desde el año 2008 de forma ambulante (visitando casas y oficinas). Como su madre y su hermano trabajan en jardinería y tienen un vivero, ella desea asociarse a ellos y de esta forma dedicarse también a la venta de plantas y flores.
Necesita de este crédito para comprar semillas de modo que su hermano realice la siembra de las plantas de estación. Con esta actividad ella desea aumentar sus ingresos para brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar a su hijo.
Su anhelo es contar con una casa propia, pues se encuentra viviendo en la casa de su madre.
texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old, single, and the mother of a young son. She has been selling silver jewelry since 2008 itinerantly (visiting houses and businesses). But as her mother and brother work as gardeners and since they have a greenhouse, she decided to join them by selling plants and flowers. 

She needs this loan to purchase seeds so that her brother can start the plantation for the season. She wants to increase her income through this business in order to provide greater security and wellbeing for her son. 

Her goal is to have a house of her own. She currently lives with her mother.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, plants and flowers.

loans.name: Siv's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of four people living in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province. Mrs. Siv H., born in 1974, is the group leader. She was selected for this position by the other members.

Mrs. Siv H. is a stay-at-home mother who cares for her three children and maintains the household. Her oldest child attends the local school, and the others are still very small. Her husband, Mr. Men Narin, born in 1973, earns a small income as a police officer. Though he makes every effort to provide for his wife and children, he does not earn enough money to adequately support the family. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy food for her family.

loans.use: To buy food for her family

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
PEDRO M. ES DE LA CIUDAD DE MANAGUA  EL TRABAJA DIARIO COMO AGENTE DE SEGURIDAD, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS, Y ESTOS ACTUALMENTE DEPENDEN DE EL Y SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON PEDRO ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: CEMENTO, ARENA Y HIERRO, PARA REFORZAR ALGUNAS PAREDES DE SU VIVIENDA YA QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN MAL ESTADO.
TODO ESTO PARA DARLES MEJORES CONDICONES A SU VIVIENDA Y SU FAMILIA MEJOR COMIDAD.
texts.en:
PEDRO M. is from the city of Managua.  He works every day as a Security Guard.  He’s the father of three children who are currently school age and dependent on him.

Pedro stops by the Ceprodel offices to request a home improvement loan to buy building materials and supplies like: cement, sand and iron rods to reinforce some of the wall in the house that are in poor condition in order to provide his family better living conditions and the best comfort.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 33 años, vive en su casa que es propia, al lado de sus cuatro hijos menores, con muchas ganas de salir adelante se esfuerzan a diario. Desde hace dos años, luego de dedicarse a la comercialización de diferentes productos, decidió empezar a vender zapatos y zapatillas, tanto para damas y caballeros. Dice que al principio no fue fácil, porque  sus clientes estaban acostumbrados a comprarle productos para el hogar y menaje, pero luego de usar el calzado que ofrecía, percibieron que éstos eran de calidad. En la actualidad compra variedad de calzado en la ciudad, y los ofrece a mayores precios a sus conocidos con la modalidad de pago a crédito, y el negocio es muy rentable, ya que le permite solventar los gastos de su  hogar sin problemas.  Afirma que le desagrada cuando sus clientes se demoran en cancelar, y esto atrasa la compra de  mayor cantidad de calzado, pero como es una mujer emprendedora, éstos inconvenientes no la detienen y para mas adelante tiene planeado ampliar la mercadería de calzado que ofrece, pues desea instalar una pequeña tienda en algún mercado cerca del lugar donde vive. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Rosa tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de variedad de calzado y zapatillas, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes, sobretodo por campaña escolar  y espera cumplir con todos, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Rocío is 33 years old and lives in her own house with her four young children.  They make a daily effort to get ahead in life.  Two years ago, after having worked selling different products, she decided to start selling shoes and sneakers for both men and women.  She says that it was not easy at the beginning because her customers were used to buying household items from her.  However, after using the shoes that she sold, they noticed that they were of good quality.  She currently buys a variety of shoes in the city and sells them to her acquaintances at higher prices on credit.  The business is very profitable, as it allows her to cover the household costs without any problem.  She says that she doesn’t like when her customers are late in paying because this delays her buying more shoes.  However, because she is an enterprising woman, these inconveniences do not stop her.  In the future, she plans to expand her shoe merchandise since she wants to set up a small store in a market close to her house.  This is her third loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time, as she does not want to leave a bad impression with the people that made this loan possible and will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  She plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a variety of shoes and sneakers since she has several outstanding requests, particularly for the school year.  She hopes to fill all of these orders and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes and sneakers to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Ta-Kilie-Su Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Ta-Kilie-Su” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatu M..  Fatu is age 37; she was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a teacher and one of her children is attending primary school while two are in secondary school. For eight years now, Fatu has been selling sweets, sugar, cigarettes, soap, water, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy sweets, sugar, cigarettes, soap, water, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Kaneez Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez fatima is married to M. I. and resides in Pakpattan, Pakistan, which is famous for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in the area of Maday Shah, which is a residential area of the city. She moved here 15 years ago. Her husband operates a business selling animals. He buys young animals, raises them and sells them to his customers. His business grows busier during the Muslim festival of Eid-ul-Azha because people purchase animals to slaughter. At other times, he sells animals to butchers. 

Kaneez is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very active and tries to do her duties with responsibility. She has given birth to two sons. Her eldest son left his education after matriculation and started working as a salesman. Her youngest son is 17 years old and illiterate. He stays at home. 

Kaneez has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He wants to buy some goats and sheep to sell for profit. He has been doing this business for the past 15 years and Kaneez is confident that after the investment, her husband’s business will grow further and make him even more money every month. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has established a good credit record with her previous loan and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Kaneez fatima.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for animal-selling business

loans.name: Mardina

texts.en:
Mardina is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a 'ger', a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His three children, ages 1, 3 and 5, all stay home with their mother. He manages an auto repair business with the help of his friend.

He started his business in 2010 after working as a repairman for three years. He provides a variety of services at his auto repair shop including diagnosing, troubleshooting, and repairing  car problems. Now his daily earnings exceed 50,000-100,000 MNT. He is very good at time management and attributes his business success to his good accounting skills. He says, “I love my work. I'm where I want to be." He is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts and paint for his business.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts and paint.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي رجل متزوج وله ولد يعمل في دهان المنازل له في عمله 6 سنوات يتميز عمله بالدقة والمهارة والنشاط يريد من خلال المجموعة الى تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له ولعائلته يسعى من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة لاستلام الورش ودفع ما تبقى من ثمن سيارة يقوم باستعمالها في نقل العدة للعمل يسعى الى التطور التجدد في العمل له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه حيث انه يتميز بالدقة في العمل والمهارة وملاحقة التطور كان يتعرض لبعض الصعوبات المادية التي تقف حاجر في وجه تقدمه وتطوره لديه اللتزام كبير في عمله ولكنه يحب ان يطور عمله وان يزيد من مدخوله وان بعتمد على نفسه في تأمين العيش الجيد له ولأولاده
texts.en: Ali is a married father of one who constantly seeks to be self-reliant and to secure a decent life for his family. With customers hailing from his neighborhood and general community, Ali has been working as a house painter for the past six years, work to which he bears great rigor, skill, and commitment. Nevertheless, he has faced some financial difficulties which have hindered his progress. To this end, Ali would like to seek a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase wares for his shop and to pay off the installments on the car he uses to truck around his equipment.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house painting business and complete payment for the business car.

loans.name: Chamreoun

texts.en:
Chamreoun, 43, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Chamreoun is a construction worker, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. His wife is a tailor, earning an income of $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $80 on food and $37 on the other necessary expenses. 

Chamreoun is requesting a loan of $700 to finish the construction of his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to finish the construction of his house.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 53 years old and married with 8 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.  Marilyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farming tools.

Marilyn has been farming rice for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: the repair and renovation her family home.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farming tools

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and is a married woman with eight children. The youngest child is six. 

Evelyn is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 15 years. Evelyn works hard to help provide for her family and sustain her children's education.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Evelyn hopes for her children to finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, all of them currently in school. Robert has a spare parts shop, which he has had for three years.         

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 1000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase spares. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Robert hopes to generate greater profits and pays school fees for his family. In the future, Robert hopes to own a factory that makes motorcycles.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Rza

texts.en: Rza is a 56-year-old man who has been in the business of animal sales for the last 10 years. Rza breeds cattle and sheep for meat; he also sells milk and dairy products. Rza`s monthly income is about 150 USD. He would like to expand his business and purchase more cattle and sheep. Meat is in very high demand among Azerbaijani people, especially in the summer when there are a lot of wedding parties. Rza would like to take this chance to purchase as many animals as he can. This will be Rza's fourth loan from AqroInvest.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep and two cattle

loans.name: Henry  Nestor

texts.es: en la ciudad de managua el sr. Henry tiene 38 años de edad es casado con un hijo y este se encuentra en el colegio, trabaja  diariamente como maestro electromecanico desde hace varios años en la ciudad de managua. henry visita la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un prestamo para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que este quiere comprar materiales de construccion para construir un muro en el patio de su casa ya que este actualmente esta cerrado con alambre de pua y postes de madera pero estos se encunetran en mal estado por lo que el solicita con urgencia el credito, todo esto para brindarles una mejor seguridad a su familia. es primera vez que solicita prestamo con la institucion.
texts.en: In the city of Managua, Henry, 38, is married and has a son who is going to school.  He has been working in Managua for several years as a master electrical mechanic.  Henry comes by the Ceprodel office to request a loan to do some home improvements because he wants to buy some building materials and supplies to erect a wall in the patio of his house because it’s currently enclosed by barbed wire fencing and wooden stakes but it’s in bad condition so he’s urgently requesting the loan to provide his family with improved security.  This is the first time he’s asked the institution for a loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Socheata

texts.en:
Socheata, 38 years old, is making brooms to sell. Her husband is a carpenter; their income is $6 per day. She has four children, who are 20, 13, 11, and 8 years old. Three of them are studying and one is working in the factory with $3 per day in income. 

Every month, she has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rental-house fees, $10 on school fees, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a pair of cows to feed for doing farming in the rainy season. She expects to send her children to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a pair of cows to feed for doing farming.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, de 49 años, es madre de tres hijos, vive con ellos en su casa propia además de su madre y padre, su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de cuzco ya hace varios años y es por eso que ella tiene que velar por la educación de sus hijos que están a su lado.
El trabajo de Gladys consiste en la compra de productos gaseosos para su posterior venta, ella realiza esta actividad sola en su casa y ya son casi 2 años desde que decidió iniciar con este trabajo que hasta el momento le ayudo bastante en la economía y generando ingresos en su hogar.Lo que mas le gusta a Gladys de su trabajo es tiene tiempo para hacer otras actividades, además de poder generar ingresos extras a su hogar ella puede disponer de su tiempo, lo que no le gusta es que a veces hay gente que quiere crédito y se demoran en pagar, lo bueno dice ella es que siempre hay clientes con ganas de refrescarse ante el calor intenso que en estas épocas hace en nuestra ciudad.Este es el cuarto préstamo entre Gladys y la institución MF]P, se siente cómoda trabajando con nosotros MFP ya que siente que los intereses son muy bajos además de poder acceder a un seguro a muy bajo costo. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mas bebidas gaseosas para poder tener en stcok en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys is 49 years old and the mother of three children. She and her family live in their own home along with her mother and father. Her husband has worked in the city of Cusco for several years. For this reason, she has been left with the responsibility of securing education for her children who have been by her side.

Her work involves buying sodas for eventual resale. Gladys manages her business alone from home and has been performing this type of work for almost two years. She decided to start this business to generate household income because she needed help with the finances. What she enjoys most about her work is having time to engage in other activities. As a result, she is able to generate extra income from home because she can devote the time. What she does not like is that sometimes there are customers who ask for credit but then are slow in repaying. She says the best thing is that she always has customers who are eager to cool off because of the intense heat around this time of year in the city.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She feels comfortable working with MFP because of the low interest rates and affordable insurance. The amount of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy sodas in order to restock her business.

loans.use: to buy sodas.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel de 63 años de edad,  vive al sur occidente de la ciudad con su esposa y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 25 a 37 años. Allí tiene un taller de electricidad que inició después de estudiar en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje SENA y  de trabajar en diversas empresas, en las cuales adquirió toda su experiencia y la tradujo desde hace 16 años en su propio negocio, con el que ha logrado salir adelante con su familia. Su meta es lograr mas adelante hacer mejoramientos de vivienda y lograr en un futuro darle un apartamento a cada uno de sus hijos. Mientras esto ocurre Manuel maneja en su negocio una rentabilidad sobre las ventas del 35,92% una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 10 días, indicadores  desde los cuales  proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos la exitosa inversión de su credikiva, con la cual comprará repuestos para electrodomésticos, materias primas para embobinar y también hará adecuaciones a su local.
texts.en: Sixty-three year old Manuel lives in the south west of the city with his three children between the ages of twenty five and thirty seven. There he has an electrical workshop that he started after studying in the Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje SENA (National Education Service) and working in various companies where he acquired all his experience. For the last 16 years, he channeled this experience into his own business with which he has managed to get his family ahead. His goal is to later on improve his home and in the future to give an apartment to each of his children. While this is happening, Manuel manages in his business to have a sales profit of 35.92% and an accounts receivable turnover of 10 days, indicators from which we project his potential growth and predict the successful investment of his Kivacredit with which he will buy spare parts, raw materials for winding and also make renovations to his local.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for electrical appliances, raw materials for winding and also make renovations to his local.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Segundina; ella tiene 58 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de fruta, ella envía manzanas,platanos,naranjas,uvas y mandarinas a lugares como Abancay, la socia también vende jora que es un ingrediente que se usa para prepara la chicha, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de fruta y ampliar el negocio de venta de jora. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas como manzanas, plátanos y naranjas y también para comprar jora al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Segundina, 58, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” (Anta Dawn) communal bank located in Anta District belonging to Anta Province and Cusco Department.

She’s a widow and has a son.  She alternates her daily chores with a business selling fruit.  She sends apples, bananas, oranges, grapes and mandarins to places like Abancay.  She also sells “jora” which is an ingredient used to prepare “chicha” [corn-based beverage].  She supports her children through these businesses.  She wants to enlarge the fruit selling business and the jora sales business.  She requests a loan to buy fruit like apples, bananas and oranges and also to buy jora at wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and pledges to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy fruit and jora at wholesale.

loans.name: Haraka Haraka Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Haraka Haraka Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Edith is the facilitator of the Haraka Haraka Group. She is a mother of two children. She joined One Acre Fund because it offers the best prices for farming and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for her family. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Edith and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Edith will educate her children and ensure food security.
In 2012, the members of Haraka Haraka Group will each plant  between half and one acre of maize.

Edith is pictured with her group members in the photograph; their Field Officer is on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is 30 years old. She is a married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for seven years.

Celina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to order for more charcoal for sale. She will use her profits from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Byambajav

texts.en: Byambajav is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Bulgan province, Mongolia. Her elder child is a medical college student, while her younger child is a school student. She started her garment retail business in 1997. She is well known for her fashion taste. Now that winter is approaching, she needs warmer clothes to sell. She is a sharp and hard-working woman who says, "Now that my daughter is in college, I have to do everything I can in order to support her." She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy more clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Oscar Alcides

texts.es:
El señor Oscar de 42 años de edad, está casado con la señora Silvia de 38 años,  la pareja tiene 3 hijas, una de 19 años, otra de 17 años y la más pequeña de 12 años, la dos mayores trabajan y estudian, con lo que ayudan con los gastos familiares.
 Oscar tiene un taller de motos, comenta que empezó hace mas de 15 años, alquila un pequeño local en el centro de la ciudad donde acuden muchos clientes, tiene todo lo necesario para poder dar los servicios de reparación y mantenimiento de motos. Quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio y es por esto que solicita el crédito, para la compra de repuestos y aceite, necesita  un pequeño stock  de repuestos como cabo de embrague, freno, zapata, rotor, caracolito de embrague, llanta, maza, de manera a solventar  los costos  y que sea mayor su ingreso. 
Agradece a fundación paraguaya por el apoyo ofrecido, como así también a Kiva.
texts.en: Oscar is 42 years old and married to Silvia who is 38.  Together they have 3 children, ages 19, 17 and the youngest 12.  The two older children are working and going to school, and help with some of the household costs.   Oscar has a motorcycle repair shop, which he started more than 15 years ago.  He rents a small place in the center of the city where he has gained many customers, and has everything needed to repair and maintain the bikes.  He would like to continue to grow this business and is requesting a loan to purchase oil and various spare parts.  This will help him manage his costs and continue to increase his income.  Oscar appreciates the support that the Paraguayan Foundation has offered him, as well as Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase tools and parts for his motorcycle repair business

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: La señora Monica a sus 20 años de edad es una madre soltera, cabeza de familia y tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos esta recién nacido y el otro tiene 2 años de edad.  Con la experiencia de haber vivido muchos años en el campo con su familia, hoy día ella desea comprar una vaca lechera con el fin de tener mayores ingresos para brindarles a sus dos hijos todo lo necesario y una mejor calidad de vida puesto que ellos dos dependen totalmente de ella. La señora Monica alternará su trabaja de campo con su trabajo como auxiliar de enfermería en el municipio del Carmen de Viboral al oriente de Antioquia.
texts.en: Monica is 20 years old and a single mother who is in charge of her household.  She has two children.  One of her children is a newborn and the other is 2 years old.  She has the experience of having lived in the countryside with her family for many years and would like to buy a dairy cow so that she can make more income in order to provide her two children with everything they need and a better quality of life as they are both totally dependent on her.  Monica alternates her farm work with her job as a nurse's aide in the town of El Carmen de Viboral, in the east of Antioquia department.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sharkiya

texts.ru: Шаркия замужем, любящая мать двоих детей. Более 10 лет она занимается купле- продажей овощей на местном рынке. Она всегда привозит свежие овощи на продажу. Она хочет обеспечить своих детей и устроить их в хорошие школы и высшие учебные заведения, с этой целью она допоздна работает, чтобы заработать больше средств. Шаркия хотела бы получить займ для оптовой  покупки свежих овощей. Она надеется на ваше понимание и ждет вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Sharkiya is married and a loving mother of two children. For over 10 years, she has sold vegetables at the local market, always bringing fresh produce for sale. Sharkiya wants to provide for her children so that they can study in good schools and get a higher education, and often works late in order to maximize her earnings. She has requested a loan to purchase fresh vegetables wholesale. She hopes for Kiva lenders' understanding and support.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: Agnès vit maritalement avec trois enfants. Entre temps, elle vendait seulement les pagnes mais compte tenu du non remboursement des créances elle a complèté avec la restauration plus précisement la vente de viande de porc. Vue la situation géographique de son fonds, L'activité lui marche bien et elle sollicite le concours de Finadev afin de diversifier son activité et de fidéliser sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Agnes lives with a companion and three children. For some time she sold only pagnes (a colorful West-African fabric), but due to defaulting customers she had to supplement her income by selling food preparations, in particular pork meat.

Business is doing well given the location of her activity, so she is requesting the assistance of Finadev to diversify her business activities and develop customer loyalty.

loans.use: Buy pagnes, shoes and other items

loans.name: Alejandrina  Perez

texts.es:
Alejandrina es dueña de una Fabrica de Yesos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 8 años.
Alejandrina aprendió en Finca que siempre se tiene que ahorrar y seguir adelante a pesar de las adversidades, le encanta las capacitaciones porque aprende mucho para poder guiar bien su negocio y su familia, ahora el préstamo que esta sacando lo invertirá en la compra de piedra de yeso y leña.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is the owner of a plaster factory. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for eight years.

Alejandrina learned from FINCA that she must always save and continue to move forward despite facing adversity. She enjoys the training classes because she has learned a great deal on how to manage her business and her family well. The loan she is receiving now will be invested in the purchase of stone and firewood for making plaster.

loans.use: to buy stone and firewood for making plaster.

loans.name: Ekow

texts.en:
Ekow is a farmer who cultivates cassava to sell at at Asebu Brebia. He is single and he completed middle school form four. Ekow has been a farmer for 15 years and uses his income to pay his utilities and living expenses. 

Ekow is requesting a loan to hire laborers to work on his farm. He plans to use his profit to expand his farm.

loans.use: to hire laborers to work on his farm

loans.name: Thariya

texts.en: Thariya is a 40 year old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to help pay for home improvements. She is planning on expanding the area of her home and the number of rooms. She would like to make these improvments so that her family can have a more comfortable space to live in.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Theavy's Group

texts.en:
Theavy, 50, is a married mother blessed with five children; two preschool-aged kids and three schoolchildren. To secure the needs of her family, she runs a small food stall as the main business to earn income. This business earns her almost 40,000 KHR per day. Theavy is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has successfully repaid her previous loan, and it has upgraded her lifestyle gradually. 

Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy more ingredients for making more food for resale. She hopes that she can earn a better income than before.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for making more food for resale

loans.name: Dalimba's Group

texts.en:
Dalimba,standing to the left hand side in the photograph hails from a small and remote village of Koraput district,Odisha,India.She is a blessed mother of a daughter and two sons.The village where Dalimba resides does not have electricity people complete their household chores before it gets dark.Being a sensible and practical lady,Dalimba thought of starting her candle making business three years before.She makes candles at her home and supplies those candles to nearly all house in her village.She has a good number of customer base and has a good reputation in her community.

Therefore, Dalimba along with her group member is requesting for a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum.She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase raw wax,thread ,glue,needle and other raw materials in bulk.Having large amount will raw materials will boost up her production as well as her sales.

Dalimba is eagerly awaiting for your generous heart to help her continue her business efficiently and serve the people of her locality.

loans.use: to purchase raw wax,thread ,glue,needle and other raw materials in bulk

loans.name: Libia

texts.en:
Libia has been running her beauty salon for 2 years. Before becoming involved in this type of work, she was a seamstress who knitted bags and purses. After finding a job as an assistant in a beauty salon, she stopped her work as a seamstress. Today she runs her own beauty salon she took over from a sister in law who moved to the states. The business is a complimentary source of income in her household of 2 children. Her husband is a taxi driver.

She will use the loan to buy a manicurists table and a foot massager for pedicures. Her business is run out of her home but is in need of these tools in order to provide improved services to the clients.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy a manicurists table and a foot massager for pedicures.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Madame Phuong and her husband have 4 children, but they also support her brother-in-law who is constantly sick and cannot work. Phuong has cardiac problems and a goiter. She spends $20 every month on medicines alone.

They have 4000 m2 of land where they plant cassava. They also have 3000 m2 of rice paddy. Selling vegetables is thus important for them as additional income: about $1/day profit.

Phuong is a member of a credit group and has already borrowed twice, repaying every week $1-$2 for 45 weeks. This time she asks to borrow $75 to expand her small business.

loans.use: Selling vegetables

loans.name: Benta

texts.en: Benta A. is a 44-year old married mother of 10 living children. She has spent 23 years running her small vegetable kiosks business near Kisumu, Kenya. She has added charcoal to her stock to increase profits. Her hard work, perseverance, good reputation, and many years in business coupled with a well-established clientele base ensure that her business will continue to grow despite competition. Benta has received and paid two previous loans from KMET, which she has used to scale up her business in response to increased demand for her goods. She is requesting a loan of $750, which she plans to use to purchase additional charcoal stock.

loans.use: To add charcoal to her inventory to supplement her current vegetable business.

loans.name: Parwona

texts.en: Parwona lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan with her husband. She is tailor with 4 years experience. She wants to expand her business so she wants to take a group loan to buy new sewing machines to work faster and make a bright future for her husband and herself. She is happy about this opportunity and she would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Ajugba

texts.en: Mrs. P. Ajugba, who specializes in the sale of ice cream, started her business in 1996. She is 44 years old, a married mother of five children, and lives in semi-rural area in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She has been with Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) as a secretary of her union. She seeks a loan for $800 to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy an additional freezer for ice cream

loans.name: Wofunira Development Association Group

texts.en:
Robinah is the strong, dynamic chairperson for the Wofunira Development Association, a women’s lending group in the Zana Village. Zana is a village divided by a very busy road between Kampala and Entebbe. Most of the businesses are located on the main road and are better stocked and have more variety than businesses in villages off of paved roads. There is also more competition, and people pay higher rents for the exposure. Businesses can cater to people outside their communities.

Such is the case with Robinah. She and her husband have the Fairy Star Electrical Center. They are an electrical retailer and wholesaler. They provide electrical wire, switches, panel boxes for electricians, and light bulbs such as energy-saving fluorescents for homeowners.

Robinah is 38 and married with 4 children. She also takes care of 2 orphans. With her loan, she plans to buy more electrical supplies for her store.

loans.use: Robinah plans to use her loan to buy electrical products, i.e. wire, switches, lighting fixtures, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 34 year old father of 3 who lives in the Bekaa region of Lebanon with his family. He owns a grocery store and wants his store to do well so that he can provide his family with the best life possible. This $700 loan is Ali's fifth loan from A. Majmoua. He will use the loan to buy new merchandise for his store.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Omonor

texts.en: Mrs. Omonor O. makes and sells beads. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She needs the loan of $375 to buy materials for the making of her beads for sale. She studied the business for four months and started her operation in 1999.

loans.use: To buy more materials for beads

loans.name: Dayanat

texts.en: Dayanat was born in 1980. He is single and lives in Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. Mr. N. has three years of experience as a taxi driver. He is requesting a loan of  $600 to buy spare automobile parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for automobiles

loans.name: Norkuzi

texts.en:
S. Norkuzi is 46 years old. He is married with five children. Norkuzi is a cattleman. He purchases the cattle in the local market, and then he breeds them and sells. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort by Norkuzi to care for them. Every day he gets up early in the morning in order to feed the animals, all day till late at night Norkuzi is busy looking after the cattle. Fifteen years ago Norkuzi started selling one bull, and today his business has turned successful and stable.

Currently he has got a turnover of cattle for the total amount of about $400. The business is the main source of income for the family. Norkuzi is requesting $600 for the term of 12 months. The loan will be spent to purchase fodder for he cattle. Being loaned for the first time, Norkuzi thanks everyone supporting him and promises to be very accurate when managing the loan.

loans.use: Purchase fodder for the cattle.

loans.name: Zilka

texts.en: Zilka was born in 1968 and she is married. Her husband is a locksmith and his monthly salary is KM 400, 00. They have 3 children, ages 11, 12 and 18. Zilka wants to use this loan for 600,00KM to buy a calf to expand her business as well as her income.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Sandra Elva

texts.es:
Sandra is single and she sells shoes from catalogs. She began doing this so as to have an income, since she had to sell a gift shop that she owned (which had been her only source of income). She began selling shoes in November 2005 and little by little she has managed to increase her clientele and currently has good sales.

She is requesting a loan of $500.00, which she will pay back in 6 months, to remodel and expand the sales area in her shop. With your help, Sandra can achieve her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra es soltera y se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, actividad que emprendió para tener ingresos, ya que tuvo la necesidad de traspasar su tienda de regalos que era su única fuente de ingresos. Inicio en noviembre del 2005, poco a poco ha logrado incrementar su cartera de clientes y actualmente tiene muy buenas ventas.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que esta dispuesta pagar 6 en meses para remodelar y ampliar el área de ventas de su local. Con tu apoyo Sandra podrá cumplir sus objetivos.

loans.use: To remodel her shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juanita, as her friends and clients lovingly call her, is a hardworking, charismatic and popular woman, thanks to her small but important soft drink business. Through the success of her business, she is able to help her husband support the family expenses. This young mother has just given birth to her youngest daughter, which has motivated her to continue working hard and persevering. With her two daughters and small cart, Juanita leaves her house for the main streets of the town, where she sells her soft drinks. Thanks to the income she earns through this business, she is able to offer her family economic security. At this time, Juanita asks you generous people for a loan with which she will buy larger quantities of raw materials to increase her soft drink sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer.

Juanita, como cariñosamente la llaman sus amigos y clientes es una mujer trabajadora con gran carisma y popularidad, gracias a su pequeño pero significativo negocio de venta de refrescos viene apoyando a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar, actualmente esta joven madre acaba de concederle la vida a la menor de sus dos hijas convirtiéndose en un motivo más de su esfuerzo y constancia.En compañía de sus hijas y de su pequeña carretita abandona su hogar para dirigirse por las principales arterias de la ciudad de Juliaca, ofreciendo sus refrescantes y deliciosos refrescos en forma ambulatoria, gracias a este negocio que le otorga un ingreso indispensable a su familia tiene la dicha de ofrecerles tranquilidad económica.En esta oportunidad Juanita recurre a vuestros generosos corazones para solicitarles un préstamo ya que tiene pensado adquirir insumos en grandes cantidades para incrementar la producción de sus refrescos.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to increase soft drink sales

loans.name: Edith Xiomara

texts.es:
Edith lives in the Managua neighborhood of Unidad de Proposito ("Unity of Purpose"). She's 41-years old, married, and has a 12-year old son. Her husband is is a sales executive at a poultry business and contributes to the family's expenses.

Edith operates a general store. She started with loans and now has three-years experience running the business. The money that she's asked for is to be invested in merchandise for the general store. For the future, she wants to grow her business, improve her house and educate her son.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Edith habita en el barrio Unidad de Propósito, tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, y tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, su esposo trabaja de ejecutivo de ventas en una empresa de venta de pollos y aporta a los gastos del hogar.

La Sra. Edith tiene una pulpería con tres años de experiencia, e inicio con préstamos, con el dinero que esta solicitando es para invertirlo en capital de trabajo para la pulpería en variedades y productos para ofrecer siempre a sus clientes sus variedades. A futuro es hacer más grande el negocio, mejorar su vivienda y educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Señora Agripina is 29 years of age, is married, and is the mother of two daughters. She completed her second year of secondary school. She lives in the city of Caritamaya, sector Marquiri, Acora district, Puno province and region.

She is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Horizonte" from which she received her first loan of 500 New Soles. She invested this money in the purchase of 300 kilos of metal like car springs to make tools like picks, rakes, posts, etc.

With this loan of 700 New Soles ($250) that she will repay in four months, she will buy 500 kilos of metal, old springs, electrodes, along with other necessary things for the making of tools for agriculture and livestock raising.

She started her business 8 years ago, when she got together with her husband. She learned this business from her grandparents and relatives. She is very happy now that with the loans she has acquired more capital, merchandise, and income.

Her greatest dream is to have a shop where she makes tools in the city of Ilave and that her daughters become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Agripina tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, madres de dos hijas y logró estudiar hasta segundo de secundaria, vive en el Centro Poblado de Caritamaya sector Marquiri, del distrito de Acora, Provincia y Región de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Horizonte, en el cual obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.500.00 nuevos soles. Este dinero lo invirtió en compra de 300 kilos de fieros como muelles de carro para elaborar herramientas como picos, rastrillos, estacas, etc.

Con este préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 500 kilos de fierros, muelles viejos, electrodo entres otras cosas necesarios para elaboración de herramientas de trabajo agrícola y pecuaria.

El negocio inicio hace 8 años, cuando se junto con su esposo, este negocio aprendió de sus abuelos y padres herederos. Ella esta muy feliz ya que con los préstamos que adquirió incremento más su capital, mercadería e ingresos económicos.

Su mayor sueño es tener un taller de elaboración de herramientas en la ciudad de Ilave y sus hijas sean profesionales.

loans.use: Wholesale Purchase of Metal and Other Materials

loans.name: Joicith

texts.es:
La señora Joicith, socia D. Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajando  II“, vive en la región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la marca Unique. El negocio, el cual lo realiza recorriendo y visitando las casas de sus clientes. Se levanta muy temprano a realizar las labores domésticas para salir por las tardes a ofrecer los productos y cobrar,  porque ofrece los productos al crédito y con facilidades de pago.

Con el préstamo de S/. 600, el cual pagará en 4 meses  invertirá en la compra de productos de oferta como jabones, colonias, desodorantes, esmaltes, shampoo, etc., que son los productos que más le solicitan sus clientes. Desea surtir su mercadería para tener en stock y de esa manera poder atender a sus clientes con lo que ellos requieran.

Tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su  hijo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la motiva en el trabajo que realiza. Es una mujer muy activa e independiente, su meta es llegar a ser una empresaria de Unique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Joicith, member of the "Working Women II" Community Bank, lives in the San Martin province, in the district of Morales. She sells "Unique" brand beauty products. She runs the business in a door-to-door fashion. Mrs. Joicith wakes up early to complete her domestic responsibilities so that she can sell her beauty products in the afternoon, and get paid for the ones she previously sold on credit. With the loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase soaps, cologne, deodorant, nail polish, shampoo, etc., which are the most heavily requested products. She would like to stock up on her merchandise so that she can provide what her clients need. She is 27 years old, and lives with her husband and son. She relies on the support of her husband, who motivates her in her work. Mrs. Joicith is an active and independent woman, whose goal is to become a business partner in "Unique."


Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products for sale

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en: Komiljon is a very responsible and hard working man. He is married and has four children. Komiljon was motivated by them to start his own business selling men’s underwear 13 years ago. The wages he received in his former job were too low to provide for all of the family's expenses. Komiljon wishes to give his children a good education and a better quality of life. This drives him to make a good job and grow his business. In order to purchase more merchandise for the new season Komiljon is requesting a loan for 2800 Somoni (825 USD) for a term of 6 months. Please be an important part of Komiljon and his family's life by contributing to the growth of his business. They sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing the new goods for selling.

loans.name: Sunday's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sunday L.. She is currently in the business of selling cooking oil and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Sunday is 50 years old and is married with a husband who is an accountant. Each week, Sunday makes approximately 150 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Sunday is joined in her small group by Grace IL., Bibiana I., Santina I., and Martha T.. Grace IL. has a business selling sweets and wants to expand her business. Bibiana I. is currently operating a business selling local brew and wants a loan to expand her business. Santina I. operates a business selling clothes and wants to expand the business. Martha T. is currently in the business of selling beans and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: expand their small businesses

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a member of the "Sol Radiante" (Brilliant Sun) Village Bank. She is 36 and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. Julia is an artisan and makes loom weavings such as tapestries from her home in the Santa Ana artisans’ neighborhood. She has three employees, and sells her products in the city of Cuzco.

Julia needs a loan of 1750 soles to buy wool and dye. Julia dreams that her children will graduate with professional degrees, of expanding her business, and of buying a car so her son can start to work as a taxi driver.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante. Julia es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Julia es artesana y realiza tejidos en telar como tapices, individuales, actividad que realiza en su casa ubicada en el barrio artesanal de Santa Ana, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de 3 personas, sus productos los vende en la ciudad del Cuzco.

Julia necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas, tintes. Julia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su negocio y comprar un carro para que su hijo trabaje.

loans.use: Buy wool and dye

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheng Khieng S. is the village bank president for eighteen members, located in Kdey Thnot village in Kampong Chhnang province. They plan to use the loan which they have obtained for different purposes. She owns a small store where she sells food to the villagers and passers-by. Her husband, Mr. Huon Sen, stays at home because he is an elderly man.

Mrs. Cheng Khieng S. faces a problem because her house is old and she does not have enough money to rebuild the house. Thus, she has decided to request a loan to add to her savings to hire construction workers to build a new house where her family can live in better conditions. She is 58 years old and the mother of a child who drives a motorbike taxi.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Twelve members have end-of-term loan and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to add to her savings to hire construction workers to build a new house

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es: Liduvina tiene 54 años, vive con sus dos hijas en su propia casa. Hace 5 años abrió en su misma casa una librería, donde vende junto con sus hijas útiles escolares por lo que cada una ha organizado sus turnos de atención de acuerdo a sus actividades. Esta librería le permite a Liduvina tener un ingreso más que complementa con el sueldo que percibe al ser trabajadora dependiente de un establecimiento de salud por lo que seguirá invirtiendo en su negocio para su crecimiento. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está convencida que es positivo trabajar en un banco comunal porque aprenden sobre el ahorro y manejo de su negocio. Liduvina solicita esta cantidad para abastecerse de mercadería para su librería.
texts.en:
Liduvina is 54 years old and lives with her two daughters in her own home. She opened a bookstore 5 years ago in her house, where she sells school supplies. Her daughters work in the store with her, and each has organized their shifts around their activities. This bookstore provides Liduvina with an additional income stream which complements the salary she earns working in a health facility. For this reason she will continue investing in the business so it can grow. This is the second time that she has sought a loan from MFP, and she is convinced that it is a positive thing to work with a community bank because the members learn about saving money and managing their businesses. Liduvina will use this loan to stock up on merchandise for her bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her merchandise

loans.name: Miriam Marleny

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Miriam se dedica a la agricultura de papa, maíz, haba en sus tierras de Tancayo, sus productos lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad. Además Miriam vende comida en su casa, su especialidad es el cebiche y el mondongo.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de los peones.
Miriam sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the "Estrella" community bank. Miriam is married common-law; she is 43 years old and has three children. Miriam grows potatoes, corn, beans on her land in Tancayo.
