She sells her crops in the wholesale food market of the town. In addition, Miriam sells food from her home; she specialties are cebiche (citrus-marinaded seafood) and tripe. Miriam needs a loan of 3,000 soles to pay her farm workers. Miriam dreams of giving her children a good education so that they can have a career and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her farm workers

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod M. is a dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial man from the Spitamen district of Tajikistan. He is married with four children. He has been breeding livestock for 5 years. With this goal in mind, Dilshod is requesting a loan that will serve him as business capital. Dilshod is requesting a loan to expand his herd and repair an enclosure to help meet the needs of his village and the surrounding community, some of whom travel over 20 km to buy his animals. The profit he earns will enable him to improve living conditions for his household and make some investments.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle for developing business

loans.name: Eldith

texts.es:
ELDITH A. USHIÑAHUA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Victor Montalvo N° 354 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 46 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, y su pareja trabaja en una panadería.

Desde 3 años de socia en Manuela Ramos, y el primer préstamo que obtuvo de S/.300 nuevo soles, los uso para dar algunas condiciones a su local, y poder trabajar con mayor tranquilidad y seguridad. 
Hoy con la ayuda que ha tenido, ha mejorado mucho el local, con un préstamo hecho pudo cambiar el techo y arreglar algunas maquinas, el préstamo de S/.3,000. Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en compra de harina, azúcar, y todos los insumos para tener un buen stock de materia prima. Es muy optimista y quiere seguir progresando.

Esta agradecida por la ayuda que da Manuela Ramos, le ha  ayudado mucho a progresar con su empresa y cree que las oportunidades están a la mano sin mucho papeleo.
texts.en:
ELDITH A. USHIÑAHUA is an associate of the Communal Bank "Las Rosas" and lives at 354 Jr. Victor Montalvo in the Callao District. She is a 46-year-old mother of 3 and her partner works in a bakery.

She has been a Manuel Ramos associate for 3 years and the first loan she received was for 300 soles, which she invested in upgrading her business in order to work comfortably and safely. Today, with the help she has received, she has been able to better her locale, including replacing the ceiling and fixing some equipment.

With this loan of 3,000 soles (3 Soles = $1USD, approx.), she will invest in flour, sugar, and other items in order to stock up on basic ingredients. She's very optimistic and wants to continue moving ahead.

She is thankful for the help she's been given by Manuela Ramos; it has helped her move forward with her business and she believes opportunities are at hand without much paperwork.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, and other items in order to stock up on basic ingredients

loans.name: Mislima

texts.en:
A. Mislima is 45 years old. She is married with two children of school age. Mislima sells the fabrics for sewing the national dresses. She has been in this business for almost 10 years.

Mislima has a very good taste and she is ready to advise her clients which textiles to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has her repeat customers. Moreover Mislima’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various levels of the population as she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet. The income that she derives allows her to educate her children. She hopes that she can continue to provide for them so they will be able to receive an adequate education.

Now Mislima needs $1300 for purchasing new fabrics in order to increase the range of her goods. She promises to pay the loan without any violation and expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Aurora Elena

texts.es:
La señora Aurora C. se dedica a laborar arduamente en su comunidad atendiendo su propia pulpería en Telica de la ciudad de León.

Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que en todo momento ha buscado la manera de cómo mantener suplida su pulpería. Hoy en día espera confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará un crédito para la compra de los productos y así saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aurora C. works arduously tending her own store in Telica in the the city of León. She is a very hard worker who has constantly looked for the way to keep her store supplied. Now she is confidently hoping that Ceprodel will give her a loan to buy products and get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn S. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 26 years old. Rubilyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rubilyn owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. 

Rubilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubilyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP (US$250), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be taken out by Rubilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 54 years old and married with 5 children. She sells drinks and provisions in her community in Ibadan, Oyo State. She is requesting a loan of 120,000 Nigerian naira (or about $825 US) to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis is 36 years old, married and the mother of four kids.  Currently, all her children are in school in the community where they live.  Her husband is very supportive, but not enough to achieve her desired business target.  She is a food vendor and sells kenkey with fried fish through hawking.  Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish.  She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. 

She wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. She belongs to the community group called ‘Ebenezer Nti’.  In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Ayush

texts.en: Ayush B. is 57 years old and lives with his wife and 18-year-old daughter in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His daughter is a senior student in a local high school. Ayush started a small shoe-making business with his wife in the early 1990s. He decided to pursue a small private business after the Mongolian economy translated into a free market economy in the 1990s. Ayush makes warm traditional boots. Their customers are mostly herders who need warm and well-built shoes for harsh winters. Since they have been in the business almost twenty years, they receive shoe-orders from many herders from different parts of the country. Ayush says that he would like expand his business by purchasing a specialized sewing machine that has the capacity to sew hard materials. The sewing machine will let him produce shoes more efficiently and less costly. Ayush's and his wife's ultimate hope is to make sure that his daughter receives a good education and pursues her dream. He requests a loan to purchase a sewing machine for his shoe-making business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for his shoe-making business

loans.name: Vilma Concepción

texts.es: Vilma Concepción C. reside en el municipio de Cojutepeque del  departamento de Cuscatlán. Vilma tiene 48 años de edad es  madre soltera , vive con sus tres hijos donde dos  de ellos son  mayores de edad  que se encuentran trabajando y su hijo más pequeño de 14 años de edad se encuentra estudiando, Esta madre ha luchado para sacar a sus hijos adelante;  hace unos años era empleada, pero ahora con ahorros y esfuerzo ha logrado colocar un negocio en su casa, es una librería surtida de variedad de productos en papelería hasta pequeños obsequios para regalar, pero ahora el deseo de Vilma y por el cual solicita este crédito es porque quiere comprar mercadería al por mayor, para logara obtener mayores ganancias de sus productos.
texts.en:
Vilma Concepción C. lives in the Cojutepeque municipality in the Cuscatlán department. Vilma is a 48 year old single mother. She lives with her three children. Two of the children are grown and work. Her youngest child is 14 and goes to school. This mother has fought to get her children ahead. For years she was an employee. Now, with savings and effort, she has been able to place a business in her house. It is a bookstore, which is stocked with a variety of products from stationery to small gifts. Vilma’s wish, the reason she is asking for this loan, is to buy wholesale merchandise. This way she can get greater earnings from her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Budragchaa

texts.en:
Budragchaa B. is 56 years old and the father of three grown-up children. He currently lives with his wife and three children (ages ranging between 21 and 26) in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Budragchaa is a talented maker of picture-frames for drawings and portraits. He has been making various frames by hand since 1997. Most of his customers are artists who would like to put their work in exhibitions. They usually purchase frames from Budragchaa for their drawings and portraits.

Since he is quite well-known among local artists for his artistic and beautifully-done frames, Budragchaa is mostly busy with orders. His business capital now exceeds 500,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). He requests a loan to purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his business

loans.name: Sipha

texts.en:
Miss. Sipha O., 43, is single, lives with her mother and sister on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sipha has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old, having skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then take s it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Sipha is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase silk materials fO. her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
La señora Magda L. se dedica a atender su negocio en el departamento de León el cual consiste en la venta de bebidas como agua, jugos, gaseosas, leche, entre otras bebidas y a la vez ella vende comida la cual es preparada por ella misma para luego ofrecerla en su establecimiento. 

Acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de las bebidas y de esta manera surtir su mantenedora ya que constantemente sus clientes le están visitando para comprar dichos productos y es necesario que ella los oferte para suplir las necesidades de dichos clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Magda L. manages her business in the department of León selling beverages such as water, juices, sodas, milk, and other types of drinks. She also sells food which she prepares herself from her store.

Sra. Magda has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase beverages so that her business remains well stocked. Her store is constantly visited by customers who buy these products, so it is necessary for her to meet the demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is now 44 years old and she is married to Virgilio. Erlinda is making cradle then sells them in their village in the village of Angoluan, Echague, Isabela. The couple were blessed with six children:Gerald-24 years old, college under graduate;Marvin-21 years old, college student; Everlyn-20 years old, college graduate;Roosebelt-18 years old, high school student;Michelle-13 years old, high school student and Mary Jane-15 years old high school student also

Her business needs to improve in order to become successful. With this, she is now borrowing a loan of PHP5,000.  The loan will be of great help in purchasing threads she needed in weaving.  She hopes that through her business she can continue to send their children to school.

loans.use: additional capital for business development

loans.name: Llaque Reyna

texts.es:
La Sra. LLaque, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Paz II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 28 años y es madre, de 02 hijos, que aun depende de ella. 

Su espíritu luchador y las ganas de salir adelante y aportar con los ingresos económicos en su hogar, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de Anticuchos, que se encuentra ubicada, a las afueras de  su casa, un ambiente muy acondicionado , para atender a sus clientes, que día a día acuden a su puesto a comprar. LLaque comienza a vender sus asaditos a partir de las 5:30 pm y dice estar muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza. En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, y poco a poco ha ido ganado clientes y haciéndose mas conocida.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará insumos como: arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad

Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio. Agradece infinitamente al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por haber cumplidos sus sueños y metas trazadas.
texts.en:
Sra. Llanque is a member of the Communal Bank “La Paz II” which is in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 28 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children.

Due to her fighting spirit and desire to succeed, Llanque has been able to generate a household income. She started a business selling anticuchos outside of her home, which is suited for receiving customers who come by every day wanting to buy something to eat. Llanque begins selling her grilled meats at 5:30pm and says she is happy with the work she has accomplished. Her business still continues to this day and she gradually gains more customers and becomes better known.

With this loan of 2500 soles, she will purchase supplies such as sacks of rice, eggs, Creole chickens for making “juanes” (traditional Peruvian dish of cassava, rice, and meat steamed in a banana leaf), butchered chickens for making “anticuchos”, and cooking utensils so that she can provide high quality service.

Today Llanque is an independent woman who manages and makes the decisions for her business. She is infinitely grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es:
Etelvina tiene 31 años, vive con sus 2 hijos: Fredy de 5 y Leyla de 2 añitos de edad, en su casa propia. 

Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que le gusta mucho realizar, ya que tiene muy buenas cualidades para la cocina. Ella ofrece sus ricos platillos de forma ambulatoria en uno de los paraderos de transporte público más concurridos de su zona. Etelvina ofrece pollo a la parrilla, caldo de mote, caldo de gallina, anticuchos, entre otros platillos regionales, los cuales son el deleite de todos sus clientes.
Lo único que le resulta complicado a Etelvina es realizar las compras para poder cocinar los paltillos, ya que la zona en la que vive es alejada de la ciudad y tiene que ir cargando sus bolsas por largos trechos, pero ha sabido sobrellevar esto con la idea de mejorar y brindarle un futuro mejor a su familia.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y ella menciona ser una persona muy responsable y se ha comprometido a no fallar en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará un toldo (cobertizo) para su puesto de venta y así brindar una mayor comodidad a su clientela.
texts.en:
Etelvina, 31, lives in her own home with her two children: Fredy, 5, and Leyla, 2. For the past 3 years she has sold prepared meals, an activity which she enjoys very much since she has good cooking skills. She offers her delicious meals from a food stand at one of the busiest public transportation hubs in her area. She offers grilled chicken, caldo de mote (a kind of lamb stew), chicken soup, anticuchos (meat kebabs), among other dishes typical of the area, which are a delight for all her customers. The only thing that is a bit complicated for Etelvina is the shopping for her ingredients for her dishes because the area where she lives is far from the city and she has to carry her shopping bags long distances. However, she has managed to overcome this keeping in mind her desire to improve and offer a better future for her family. This is her first loan with MFP and she states that she is a very responsible person and has committed not to fail in her repayments. With the funds she will buy a tarp-like awning or cover for her food stand in order to offer improved comfort for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a tarp-like cover for her food stand.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: A. K.  Yvette est née le 17 Janvier 1969 à Comé au Bénin. Yvette est mariée à AGBANTE Sévérin. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés ; La famille vit depuis 8 ans à Cocotomey à Abomey Calavi, non loin de Cotonou capitale économique du Bénin. Yvette et Sévérin supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Yvette n’a jamais été à l’école. C’est depuis douze ans que Yvette vend des oreillers et également de la tisane (médicament traditionnel fait à base de feuilles) à Cocotomey. Yvette fait ses achats à Pahou au Bénin et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Yvette a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à ALIDé et l’a bien remboursé. C’est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et agrandir son activité, que Yvette sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Yvette A. K. was born on 17 January, 1969 in Comé, Benin. Yvette is married to Sévérin Agbante. The couple have four children who are all in school; for 8 years, the family has lived in Cocotomey in Abomey Calavi, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Yvette and Sévérin provide for the family together. Yvette never went to school. For twelve years, Yvette has been selling pillows and traditional herbal medicine made from leaves in Cocotomey. Yvette makes her purchases in Pahou, Benin and at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Yvette has already benefited from one loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) and repaid it properly. It is to augment her working capital and to enlarge her business that Yvette is seeking a second loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pillows and bags of leaves

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita P., 43, hails from the province of Pangasinan but has migrated to Camarin, Caloocan City with her family.  She is married to Nathaniel, who is also 43, and a taxi driver.  The eldest of their two children is now in college and their other child is still in grade school.

Mercelita manages the operation of their taxi.  She also finds time making and selling home-made spring rolls and other preserved meat products.  She found it to be an interesting hobby and source of income as well.  Although she complains that subsequent oil price affects their taxi operation.  From her profits, she was able to purchase replacement tires for their taxi.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative only this year.  She will use the funds for the preventive maintenance of the taxi.  She has been saving a lot so as to be able to buy more taxi units so she can help employ other people.




About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: preventive maintenance of the taxi

loans.name: Bella Maria Group

texts.es: El grupo “Bella María” esta representado por la señora Liliana y conformada por 10 miembros D. las cuales una gran mayoría se dedican a la venta D. comida D. todos tipo, tradicional, internacional y comida rápida, el resto D. las socias se dedican a actividades como la elaboración D. pan y la venta D. cosméticos. En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias tienen un alto nivel D. competencia en el mercado ya que son las únicas que ofrecen sus alimentos y productos, pero gracias  a su experiencia saben que cantidades se venD. cada día para que puedan presupuestar sus insumos.  El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo con el cual realizaran la compra D. insumos para los días D. ventas altas, cocinas con mayor potencia para realiza un trabajo mas eficiente, también apara la mejora D. sus puestos D. venta  para darles a sus clientes mayor comodidad; el resto D. las socias realizará la compra D. mercadería al por mayor.  Este banco va cursando ya un tercer ciclo demostrando muchas ganas D. trabajar y salir adelante con responsabilidad y esfuerzo, es por esta razón que la Fundación Agrocapital les brinda un nuevo apoyo económico para que sigan creciendo y fortaleciendo sus negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el bien estar D. sus familias y la oportunidad  D. brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Bella María" group is led by Liliana and is maD. up of 10 members, most of whom sell prepared traditional, international and fast, food. The other members bake bread and sell cosmetics. They aren't the only ones in the marketplace offering these goods and services so competition is high. However, they know how to gauge the amounts of sales they'll have daily so they can budget their raw material purchases accordingly. This financing will be used to increase their working capital so they can buy raw materials in quantity for high sales days, higher capacity stoves so that they can produce more efficiently, to improve the appearance of their sales stalls so that customers will be more comfortable. The remainder will be used to buy raw materials at wholesale. This communal bank is in its third loan cycle. They have shown a strong will to work and to get ahead with responsibility and effort. For this reason, the Fundación Agrocapital grants a new economic support so that they will continue to grow and strengthen their business endeavors since their families' wellbeing and hope for a better future for their children depends on them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Dominica

texts.es: Dominica de  43 años vive al lado  de su madre Gregoria de 62 años y su joven hijo Alvarilio de 20 años, juntos viven en su  casa que es propia.Cada día debe levantarse muy temprano  a vigilar sus tierras ya que cultiva diversos tipos de vegetales entre los que destacan zanahorias, arvejas y habas; con la ayuda de su madre y de su hijo realiza esta ardua labor diaria, ya que debe vender toda la producción a los mayoristas del mercado de la ciudad, es por eso que es importante que la cosecha sea buena , además le gusta su trabajo porque le ayuda bastante económicamente, también cría cerdos y los comercializa de vez en cuando ; como  es una mujer emprendedora y con muchas ganas de trabajar tiene pensado en el futuro sembrar en mayor cantidad para vender y obtener más ganancias.Aunque es el sétimo préstamo con MFP promete ser cumplida en cada uno de sus pagos, ya que no quiere quedar mal con ningún miembro de su grupo que trabaja muy parejo para alcanzar cada uno sus proyectos.El dinero del préstamo tiene pensado invertirlo en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de arveja y zanahoria para empezar con el aumento de la producción, y también comprará abono para darle buen mantenimiento a sus tierras.
texts.en:
Dominica is 43 years old and lives with her mother Gregoria, who is 62, and her son Alvarilio, aged 20. They reside together in Dominica's house. Each day they have to get up very early to care for the fields where they cultivate diverse types of vegetables, including especially, carrots, green peas, and beans. With the help of her mother and son, she carries out this work daily. Dominica sells her entire production to wholesalers in the city market. For this reason, it is important that the harvest be a good one. Besides, she likes the work because it helps her out economically. She also raises pigs and sells them from time to time. Since she is an enterprising woman with a strong desire to work, she is considering sowing more crops in the future to sell and obtain added earnings. This is her 7th loan with MFP and she promises to be prompt with each payment. She doesn't wish to lose her standing with any member of her group. They work together to achieve each of their projects. The loan will be invested in purchasing various sacks of green pea and carrot seeds, so that she can begin expanding production. Also, she will buy manure in order to maintain the quality of her land.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SEEDS AND MANURE FOR HER FIELDS

loans.name: Harry

texts.en: Harry A., 44 years old, seeks a good life for his family. He has five children. His eldest is no longer studying because they don’t have enough money to pay for education. Farming is what sustains the family. That is why he has been working very hard to improve their harvest. He would like to apply for a loan of PHP 6,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Martina Tomasa

texts.es: La señora Martina P. se dedica a laborar en el mercado El Bisne donde se desempeña con gran ahínco para llevar a cabo su sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda porque ésta así lo amerita. Está solicitando un crédito que será invertido para la compra de materiales de construcción entre los que se encuentran zinc, clavos, alfajillas y clavadores. Ella espera ser beneficiada con dicho crédito porque al obtenerlo, a lo inmediato comprará los materiales e iniciará la construcción para beneficio propio y de su familia.
texts.en:
Martina P. works in the El Bisne market. She works with great enthusiasm to realize her dream of improving her home, because the house is worth improving. She is seeking a loan to buy construction materials such as metal roofing, nails, boards, and rafters. She expects this loan will be beneficial, because she will immediately buy the materials and begin construction. This will benefit both her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Abdel - Aziz

texts.en: Abdel Aziz is a 47-year-old married man and father of three children who still go to school. For the past 12 years he has owned a legal office in a court to finalize all the legal papers and documents. Over the years, thanks to his business income, Abdel has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, he is asking to borrow $700 to buy a new photocopier machine needed to continue his work properly.

loans.use: To buy a new photocopier machine

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo tiene 63 años vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Nilda (51) y de sus dos jóvenes hijos, ya mayores de edad.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte en motocarro por las calles de su localidad. Su vehículo es propio y le permite solventar los gastos de su familia, además le gusta mucho interactuar con sus ocasionales pasajeros y se distrae  movilizándolos de un lugar a otro. Para él, esta es una actividad tranquila, fácil y no es estresante, tiene horarios fijos y trabaja  sobretodo durante el día, para mayor seguridad. Como es un hombre emprendedor, para el futuro planea comprar otro motocarro para brindarlo en alquiler y obtener mayores ganancias y así salir adelante.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir el crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando. Bernardo tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en el mantenimiento de su motocarro, pues necesita algunas reparaciones y es necesario que lo haga, ya que quiere brindar un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Bernardo is 63 years old and lives in his own home alongside his wife, Nilda, who is 51 and his two young children who are now grown up. For five years he has provided transportation service to his local area. He owns his car and this allows him to take care of his family's expenses. He also likes interacting with his passengers and taking them from place to place. For Bernardo, this job is calm, easy, and not stressful. It has a fixed schedule and he mostly works during the day for security reasons. As he is an enterprising man, he plans to buy another car to rent out so he can earn more income and get ahead. This is his third loan with MFP and his is grateful for all of the people who make it possible for him to receive the loans that allow him to keep working. Bernarado plans to invest the money he is asking for in car maintenance since it needs some repairs and he has to get them done so he can provide good service

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: María Ana

texts.es: María Ana A. M. de 43 años de edad, reside en Antiguo Cuscatlán, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa arrendada. María posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual la comercializa de forma ambulante por todas las calles de Antiguo Cuscatlán, ella posee un pick up, en el cual coloca su mercadería, y de esta manera comercializa su producto, llevándolo hasta las puertas de los hogares. Desde hace cuatro años que ella se dedica a este trabajo, logrando obtener muchos clientes los cuales le compran frutas o verduras en cada ocasión que ella llega a sus colonias. María solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar frutas y verduras por mayor, con el fin de poder obtenerla a menores precios y así ofrecerla de una forma más competitiva en el mercado. También solicita dicho préstamo para llevar su automóvil a revisión, ya que es este uno de los elementos más básicos para su negocio. María desea prosperar y seguir adelante con sus ventas, y de esta manera ganarse la vida de una manera adecuada.
texts.en:
María Ana A. M. is 43 years old and resides in Antiguo Cuscatlán, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives in a rented house with her partner in life. María has a fruit and vegetable stand that she takes with her as she travels through the streets of Antiguo Cuscatlán. Her pickup truck holds the merchandise and enables her to sell her products and deliver them to the doors of her customers’ homes. María has been in this business for four years and has been able to attract many customers who buy fruits or vegetables every time she arrives in their neighborhood.

She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy fruits and vegetables in bulk to get the lowest prices. This will help her become more competitive in the market. She will also use part of her loan to get her vehicle inspected because it is one of the most important elements for her business. María wants to prosper and move forward with her sales so that she can earn a living in an appropriate manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables; pay for a vehicle inspection

location.town: Antiguo Cuscatlán, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto Z. O. es obrero y trabaja en una fábrica en la elaboración de puros en el casco urbano del municipio de Condega.

El solita un crédito en Ceprodel el cual va a utilizar para surtir una pulpería que tiene en su casa de habitación, el quiere ampliar este negocio para así obtener un ingreso mas en su hogar.  

El empezó este negocio hace dos años vendiendo productos de consumo diario y ha ido creciendo por que no hay mas negocio de este tipo cerca, su esposa atiende la pulpería mientras que el Sr. Carlos Z. trabaja en la fábrica de 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde de lunes a viernes. Este señor antes de ser obrero en esta fabricase dedicaba al comercio ambulante en las comunidades aledaña.

El espera que con este que con la ampliación de su negocio a través del financiamiento el pueda vender mas y lograr satisfacer la demanda y por ende obtener mejore ingresos. Carlos Z. es casado con un hijo que aun no tiene edad escolar.

Este es el crédito numero dos que el ha tenido en Ceprodel en un periodo de seis años, el dice que estos financiamiento le hay ayudado positivamente ya que ha logrado realizar proyectos como el de tener su propio negocio y se muestra agradecido
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto Z. O. is a laborer in a cigar factory located in greater Condega. He is asking Ceprodel for funds to stock a grocery store that he has in his home; he wants to expand his business in order to earn more income for his home. He started this business two years ago selling daily consumption items and gradually has grown because there are no other similar businesses nearby; his wife tends to the store while he works at the factory from 7am until 5pm, Monday-Friday. Prior to being a laborer he used to be a peddler in adjacent communities. He hopes that this loan will make it possible for him to enlarge his stock so that he can better meet customer demand thereby earning higher income. Carlos has a son who is still too young to go to school. This is his 2nd loan with Ceprodel in a 6-year period. He states that the financing has been very useful in that he has met goals, like having his own business. He is very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory items for his store.

loans.name: Juana Nazaria

texts.es: Doña Juana V., cuenta con un Taller de 2 telares para Elaborar Cortes típicos para mujeres,  lleva 20 años de trabajar en la Tejeduría ella y su esposo laboran para el mismo oficio como también sus 2 hijos en donde gracias a ello los ha podido sacar adelante dándoles una mejor calidad de vida y así poder obtener mejores ingresos y poder aumentar su capital 	ya que su numero de su clientela a aumentado por lo que nos solita su préstamo para dicha Artesanía, su residencia es en el Caserío Chocanac de la Aldea V., Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana V. has a shop with 2 looms where she makes typical clothing for women. She and her husband have been in the weaving business for 20 years. Her two sons also work in this trade. Due to this business she has been able to get her sons ahead giving them a better quality of life. She has been able to make a better income and increase her capital as the number of customers has been increasing. She is requesting a loan for the business. She lives in the Chocanac housing area of the Aldea V. in Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Mrs. Ann S., 32 years old, lives in Preak Samrong village in Kandal province. She sells fish to support her family while her husband, Mr. Ron Pheng, is a fish breeder who earns a small income to support the family. Mrs. Ann S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fish food to support her husband's business. This couple has four children; two are students and two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fish food

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy feed and repair poultry yard

loans.name: John

texts.en: John O. O. is 27 years old. He is married and has four children aged between two and nine years old. His business is located at Kamukunji in a very busy market in Nairobi. He has a business in which he has been selling pans and other items to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the main challenges he has are the price or raw materials, and that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his, hence customers are spoilt for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more scrap metal to make the pans to sell. In the future, he hopes to open other outlets. He describes himself as hardworking, focused and determined.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal to make pots and pans to sell.

loans.name: Magali

texts.es: Magali tiene 20 años, comparte su vida a lado de su madre, juntas viven en casa de sus padres. Hace mas de 5 años se dedica en la venta de verduras como  lechuga, espinaca, cebolla entre otros productos, en un mercado que se encuentra dentro de su localidad. Con el apoyo de su mama, adquieren la mercadería desde muy temprano, logrando quedarse hasta las 3 de la tarde aproximadamente, que es cuando logra vender todos sus productos. Este trabajo le ha permitido tener sus propios ingresos y aportar en la economía de su casa, Magali tiene muchos sueños para cumplir es por eso que  trabaja con mucha cautela y seguridad para que mas adelante pueda tener un puesto más amplio, en donde pueda abastecerse de mayor mercadería. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy  satisfecha de formar parte de su grupo comunal ya que conoce el compromiso de pago de todos los integrantes, es muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en verduras, de esta manera tendrá mayor variedad de productos que serán de preferencia  de sus clientes.
texts.en:
20-year old Magali lives with her parents and is very close to her mother. For more than five years she has sold vegetables such as lettuce, spinach, onions and other products in a market located in her neighbourhood. With her mother’s help, Magali gathers the vegetables very early in the morning and then stays in the market until approximately 3pm when they have all been sold. This job has provided Magali with her own income and allowed her to contribute to household expenses. She has many dreams to fulfill and for that reason works cautiously and sensibly so that in the future she can have a bigger stall and stock it with more products. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP. She is very pleased to be part of this group since she knows what commitment the members have made. Magali is very responsible with her repayments and is grateful to those people who contribute to her loan which will help greatly with the progress of her business. With the money she plans to buy more vegetables so that she will have a greater variety of products and be her customers’ favourite place to shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her stall

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en:
Dativa is 39 years old and married with nine children who are between 3 and 19 years old.  Dativa is commonly known for selling meat in her butcher shop.  The business hours are from 7 am to 7 pm every day.  

Dativa's business is too small to satisfy her customers.  To end this, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, she will increase the quantity of meats to sell. Therefore the number of her customers as well the profits will increase.  If successful, Dativa wishes to reach the stage where she can be financially stable and be able to fix any financial problems of her family members.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of meat to sell

loans.name: Gladys Alejandrina

texts.es:
Gladys Alejandrina M. B. tiene 42 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. 

Gladys es una socia de la ventanilla rural Lucha Para Triunfar. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Gladys es manicurista y trabaja por la impresa cosmetica ¨Yambal.¨ Realiza sus compras y ventas en el canton de Ventanas. 

Solicita el préstamo para seguir con su negocio. Su sueño es tener algo propio y seguir adelante con la ayuda de Dios.
texts.en:
Gladys Alejandrina M. B. is 42 years old, married, and lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Lucha Para Triunfar” (Fight To Win). There are 13 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Gladys is a manicurist and also works for the cosmetics company Yanbal. She buys and sells in the canton of Ventanas. The loan she is requesting will be used to continue her business. Her dream is to have something of her own and move forward with the help of God.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for her manicure business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma O. is 53 years old and married with six children, namely: Janet, age 31; Aileen, 26; Albert, 23; Leonor, 17; Dennis, 19; and Jay Arr, 13. Three of her children are still dependent on the couple and are living with them. Her eldest son is working abroad while the youngest is in secondary school.

She applied for a loan of 17,000 PHP to augment the capital needed to expand her business buying and selling meat products. With the help of her husband and children, they will buy live chickens and hogs from farms and communities raising chicken and pigs and then sell the meat products to the city market or deliver to their costumers in the neighboring locality.  They also want to buy a tricycle to use as a means of transportation for buying and delivering their products to market.

Norma believes that if her loan is granted, it will bring additional income to the family and she will be able to earn and save more for the schooling of her children. It is the popular dream of the couple to provide their children a decent life through them fulfilling an education degree, so that is why she is so dedicated and industrious.  At her age she also wanted to experience dealing with other people and doing business with them. She is happy that ASHI and KIVA are giving her this privilege.

loans.use: Buying and selling chicken and hog meat and purchasing a tricycle

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es: El señor vive en alquiler en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y chef de profesión, actualmente trabaja en una churrasquería donde percibe el salario mínimo con el cual se mantiene, los fines de semana atiende todo tipo de acontecimientos y también elabora tortas y otras clases masitas. El crédito que solicita es para comprar una computadora y utilizarla para poder hacer sus propuestas con fotos de sus tortas y también poder diseñar algunos modelos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también es parte de Kiva.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in the Villa Nuevo Potosí zone of the city of La Paz. He is single and a chef by trade. He currently works at a barbeque shack where he receives a minimal salary from which he supports himself. On the weekends he works all kinds of gatherings and also makes "tortas" (similar to sandwiches) and other foods. He will use the money from this loan to buy a computer that he can use to do his proposals and include pictures of his tortas. He also wants to be able to design some models. This will be his first loan through IMPRO and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mithu

texts.en:
This is 60-year-old Mithu T.. She is married and has four children aged 37, 27, 26 and 20. In 1985 she established her livestock business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family. She wants this loan from Patan BPW to buy feed for her cattle. In the future Mithu plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support.

About Patan BPW:

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women (BPW). Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy feed for her cattle

loans.name: Wenelyn

texts.en:
Wenelyn L. is 31 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Poblacion, a part of Quezon municipality, Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Wenelyn makes and sells food, in particular snacks and other delicacies like halo-halo, a dessert made with shaved ice and milk into which is mixed fresh fruit and sweet beans, to the local community. Wenelyn has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Wenelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to buy the ingredients needed to make her snacks. Wenelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients needed to make her snacks

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty B. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 52 years-old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Betty owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks and other delicacies such as rice cakes and cassava cakes in the local community. She is also buying and selling dried fish.. Betty has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Betty joined Kiva partnerHSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Betty is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Betty from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Fotemogoban est un regroupement de cinq  femmes toutes mariées de la ville  Tènè, préfecture de SAN, quatrième région administrative de la république du MALI.  Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et au moins 4 enfants. 
Les femmes du groupe font l’achat vente de tissus, de bijoux, de condiments  alimentaires et de la restauration qui est la spécialité de Toula D.. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis cinq ans et est à son huitième  prêt solidaire. 
Toula D. compte acheter, 5 sacs de riz, 1 sac d’oignon frais, 1 sac de sel, 10kg de l’ail et 30000FCFA pour les petits condiments. Madame Toula D. vend tous plats alimentaires au carrefour de TENE. 
Elle compte sur un  bénéfice de 48000FCFA par mois qu’elle compte utiliser l’entretien de ses enfants, les trousseaux des filles et autres dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Fotemogoban is a group of five married women who come from the town of Tènè, in the prefecture of San, the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They average 41 years of age and have at least four children each. 

The women in this group buy and sell fabric, jewelry and condiments, and are active in the restauration business (the latter is the speciality of Toula D.). In order to increase the volume of their businesses, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program five years ago and they are now on their eighth group loan.

Toula D. is planning to buy five sacks of rice, one sack of fresh onions, one sack of salt, 10kg of garlic and condiments to the value of 30,000FCFA. Mrs. D. sells all her dishes at the crossroads in Tènè. She is expecting to make a profit of 48,000FCFA per month, which she is planning to use to look after her children, for her daughters' trousseaux and for other family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of restauration ingredients

loans.name: Abas

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Abas.  He is married and has 3 children aged 16, 14 and 8 years. In 2005, Abass established his cosmetics and toiletries business. He began his business because he was unable to go further in school so he decided to go into business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,037,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He needs a loan of 4,500,000 SLL. Abas requires this loan in order to buy more cosmetics and toiletries. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 259,250 SLL. In the future, Abas hopes to open another cosmetics shop for his wife.  He owned the biggest cosmetics shop in his locality. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and toiletries

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza A. is a married woman who lives in Purok 6, Barangay Liptong, Bacong, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  livestock and a vegetable plantation. Her husband Alejandro, who is 42 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are between 5 and 19 years old. 

Liza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Liza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, with which she intends to obtain additional capital for the livestock and vegetables plantation so that she can continue to save up for future improvements of her business and for the education of her children. Liza A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of a livestock and vegetables plantation.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng K., 41, and her husband, 38, currently live in Kompong Tom Province. Eng earns a living by raising pigs both for their offspring and for slaughter in a pigpen behind her house. She has a life partner in her husband, a local farmer, and they have five children, three single, one studying in university, and the other two married; they also work with her in pig raising. Because Eng's account is not sufficient to pay her child's school fees, she  is requesting a loan from Kiva for that purpose.

loans.use: To pay her child's school fees

loans.name: Rosario Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosario Elizabeth H. C. tiene 25 años de edad, Es casada vive con su esposo y con sus hijos en el cantón de Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.


Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Rosario Elizabeth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  seguir trabajando.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en: Rosario Elizabeth H. C. is 25. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Chillanes Canton, Bolivar province. She has 4 children. The V.R.C. Tres de Noviembre group has 28 members and is 90 minutes from the office, within the limits of the Chillanes Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Rosario Elizabeth works in agriculture, sowing rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. She purchases her products in Mata de Cacao and sells in the Matilde Esther Market and in Bucay. She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to continue working. She enjoys sports.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Soah

texts.en:
Soah S. is 30 and married with three children. She lives with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is employed at the local factory and earns 3 USD daily. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and also raises ducks and chickens at home, earning an income of 5 USD per day to help cover the family’s expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 45 USD on food, 15 USD on the children’s education, and 100 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Soah is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase chickens and ducks to sell during the Chinese New Year. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.  In the future, Soah would like to use any additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and ducks

loans.name: Hardworking Mothers Group

texts.es:
El comité Mamás Trabajadoras nació mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas y las de sus respectivas familias.
La Sra. Gloria Belén C., presidenta del grupo, tiene 31 años, ella es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y por sobretodo muy optimista.
texts.en:
The group name Mamas Trabajadoras, meaning Hardworking Mothers, was started with the guidance and support of another group who works in the same location. 

Their principal goal is to stimulate the development of each one of the members and their respective families.

Mrs. Gloria Belen Caceres is the leader of the group. She is 31 years old and she is an enterprising and hardworking woman who is, above all, very optimistic.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, pastas, meat, milk, breads, rice, cooking oil, flour, corn, onions, and fruits.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice C. lives in the village of Looc Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, separated and has one grown child. She makes a living by selling beauty products to men and women who live in her community. She has been in this line of work for more than five years and earns about 12,000 PHP a month.

Last year, Alice joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She successfully repaid her first loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, and has applied for a new one for 7,000 PHP which she will use to continue expanding her business. Her goal is to earn a larger income and provide a better life to her family.  

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translations for Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand a small store that sells beauty supplies

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: La Señora Florinda es originaria de la Localidad de los Viveros localizado en el Estado de Michoacán, tiene 40 años de edad, estudio hasta el 5° año de primaria, y no pudo seguir estudiando porque sus papas no la quisieron apoyar con sus estudios porque no tenían dinero para comprarle su uniforme y sus libretas. Ella está casada con el señor Eliseo quien es jornalero, ellos están casados desde hace 16 años, ellos tiene dos hijos de nombres José Armando de 16 años y Alex de 11 años, comenta que su hijo el mayor ya no siguió estudiando porque no tubo dinero este año para comprarle los útiles escolares y por eso este año ya no pudo entrar a la escuela, su otro hijo el menor estudia sexto de primaria. Doña Florinda está pidiendo su préstamo a Fundación Realidad para invertir en su tienda de abarrotes como huevo, harina, azúcar etc., también va a invertir en la compra de abono, fertilizantes y fumigantes para su huerta de aguacate. Ella también vende comida para las personas que trabajan frente a su casa que se dedican a explotar bancos de arena.  Una de sus preocupaciones es que su hijo el mayor ya no esté estudiando por falta de recursos pero ella espera que para el otro año pueda meterlo a la escuela ya que ella no quiere que siga perdiendo años, comenta doña Florinda “quiero que mis hijos tengan una carrera por que la vida de un jornalero es muy dura y desgastante”.  Dice que le va a beneficiar de mucho, ella podrá ahorrar para que su hijo el mayor valla a la escuela y tenga una carrera que es lo más importante para ella. Una de sus metas es poderle meter más productos a su tienda de abarrotes como cremería y carnes frías y así sus clientes no se trasladaran hasta Zitacuaro a comprar los productos de primera necesidad.  Ella comenta que impactara las ganancias en la forma de que en que sus clientes no se trasladaran tan lejos para comprar sus víveres, a su familia tendrán una mejor calidad de vida y les comprara a sus hijos lo que más les haga falta.
texts.en:
Florinda is from the town of Los Víveros, which is located in the State of Michoacán.  She is 40 years old and studied up to the 5th year of elementary school.  She couldn't continue her studies because her parents didn't want to support her (they didn't have the money to buy her uniform and notebooks).

Florinda is married to Eliseo who is a laborer.  They have been married for 16 years and have two children: 16 year-old José Armando and 11 year-old Alex.  She tells us that her eldest son isn't continuing his studies right now because she didn't have enough money to buy his school supplies this year.  For that reason, he can't attend school.  Her youngest son is in his 6th year of elementary school.

Florinda is requesting a loan from Fundación Realidad to invest in her grocery store, buying eggs, flour, sugar, etc.  She will also invest in buying manure, fertilizers and sprays for her avocado orchard.  Florinda also sells meals to the people who work opposite her home extracting materials from the sandbanks.

One of Florinda's worries is the fact that her eldest son is not studying due to a lack of resources.  She hopes that she will be able to put him back into school next year since she doesn't want him to continue losing years.  Florinda tells us: "I want my children to have a career because the life of a laborer is very hard and wearing".  She says that this loan will help her a lot because she will be able to save so that her oldest son can go to school and have a career which is the most important thing for her.

One of Florinda's goals is to be able to stock her grocery store with more products such as dairy goods and cold cuts.  This will mean that her customers won't have to travel to Zitacuaro to buy their essentials.  She tells us that preventing her customers from having to travel so far to buy their provisions will have a positive impact on her profits.  It will mean her family will enjoy a better quality of life and she will be able to buy her children what they most need.

loans.use: To invest in groceries for her store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa S. es de la ciudad de Carapegua – compañía Potrero, tiene 38 años y cuenta con casa propia, tiene pareja y 5 hijos.
La Sra. Blanca se dedica al comercio ambulante (macatera) desde hace más de 5 años; se dedica a este trabajo desde muy joven tejiendo frazadas en su domicilio para otras personas quienes llevaban a vender por las ciudades vecinas, pero viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso mayor decidió vender ella misma sus productos.
Fue así que empezó a trabajar como macatera y hoy día cuenta con más de 50 clientes activos contando con un ingreso semanal considerable.
Comercializa sus productos por Carapegua y Gran Asunción.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de hilos y telas.
texts.en:
Teresa S. lives in Potrero neighborhood, in the city of Carapegua.  She is 38 years old and lives with her partner and 5 children.  She owns her own home.

Teresa has been working as a traveling saleswoman for more than 5 years.  She started out in her line of work when she was very young, weaving blankets at home for other people who would take them and sell them in neighboring towns.  However, as she needed to make more income, she decided to start selling her products herself.  Teresa started working as a traveling saleswoman and she currently has more than 50 active customers which makes her a considerable weekly income.  She sells her products in Carapegua and Gran Asunción.

Teresa is requesting this loan to buy threads and fabrics.

loans.use: to buy threads and fabrics

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Содиков Мухаё проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Жена, домохозяйка. У него среднее образование. Он плотник. Изготавливает деревянные двери и окна. Этим видом деятельности занимается 5 лет. Кредит берет для покупки досок.
texts.en: Muhayo S. lives in  J. Ruмy. He is 48 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a housewife. He has a secondary education. He is a carpenter. He makes wooden doors and windows. He has been doing this work for five years.  He is taking out a loan to buy wooden boards.

loans.use: to buy wooden boards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients to prepare the food that she sells

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a widow with four children, all of whom are adults. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past six years, she has operated a car wash and electronics sales business. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Anastasia faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  During the rainy season, the availability of customers is lower compared to the dry summer season. She dreams of opening another electronics shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sockets and phone chargers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sockets and phone chargers.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is 36 years old, a housewife who lives with her family in a 2-room brick house in Faisalabad which is an industrial city and well known in Pakistan for its textile industry.  Her house is located in the area of Mae-di-Jughi where she came with her family some years ago. 

Her husband's name is M. H. and he operates a Punjabi food restaurant business. In his restaurant, he sells different types of tasty food items such as "Daal chawal" (made with lentils and served with rice) and "Nan Chanay" (made with chick peas and served with bread) to his clients. He believes in quality and good customer services; that’s why he has a good number of clients. 
 
Shazia has given birth to seven children. She is a very caring mother and takes care of her family very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband with the expansion of his restaurant business. Utilizing the loan money, her husband will buy required ingredients such as spices, cooking oil, lentils and chick peas, etc. to make good quality food to sell in his restaurant. 

Shazia is hopeful that after the loan investment, her husband’s business will grow further and his income will increase. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In  the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shazia.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for Punjabi food for their eatery.

loans.name: Saheoun

texts.en:
Saheoun is 51 years old.  She resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Saheoun is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.5 per day to help cover her family's expenses. Each month, her family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 20 on other necessary expenses. 

Saheoun is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to help one of her children get married. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: pay for her child to get married

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mean and his wife, Sotom,  live in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children. The couple has been farming for almost 10 years. They grow mushrooms, lotus, and rice. Mean is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy two buffaloes for plowing his farmland.

loans.use: to purchase two buffaloes for plowing his farmland.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a married man from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is 40 years old and has two children, aged 15 and 9. He is a farmer and has been tilling their rice farm for 11 years now.

His average income from doing his business is PhP 10,000 per month. He utilizes his income to provide his family with their basic needs. Receiving a loan would help him buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Joel hopes to manage a bigger farm and be able to send both his children to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Clarice

texts.en:
Clarice is 38 years old and married to Thomas. She has been operating her tailoring business for the past eighteen years. She earns a monthly income of about 20,000 KES (~$225) which she uses to take care of her business and family.

She has been loaned 20,000 KES by KADET Ltd. She intends to use her loan to purchase a stock of materials and also clothes for sale.

Clarice plans to use the profit from her business to open another tailoring shop within her residential area to serve her customers better. In the future, she hopes to have a tailoring school to pass her knowledge on to those who need it.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of materials and also clothes for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: For the past six years, Esther has been selling red oil [palm oil] by the gallon. She is 43 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They both have one child, age nine years old. She makes a lot of money, but she sometimes finds it difficult to get her goods to town due to the bad road conditions. Esther is requesting a loan to purchase 20 gallons of red oil. She plans to buy a car in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase 20 gallons of red oil.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda, de 31 años; convive desde hace 10 años con Javier, su esposo. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, a los que quieren y cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Hace un año, comenzó a afrontar sola las decisiones económicas del hogar. Ya que junto a su esposo, desde hace 9 años, comenzaron a sembrar en sus terrenos agrícolas arrendados: alverja, lechuga y papa. La ayuda que le brindaba era primordial e importante, pero “hace un año”, comenzó a trabajar en una empresa privada, que se encarga de la creación de una hidroeléctrica en la zona. Es así que Nilda, comenzó a dedicar toda su fuerza a mantener sus cultivos y a sembrar como de costumbre durante el año. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las épocas de cosecha, ya que ve concretizado todo su esfuerzo en la venta de sus alimentos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de su siembra y así obtener el capital necesario para abrir una tienda de comestibles en su localidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para lograr sus objetivos. Además de comprometerse en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Nilda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de alverja para comenzar con éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Nilda is 31 years old and she has been living with her husband Javier for the past 10 years. They have 3 children together and they enjoy a house which is their own property. It is located in the community of Cumutay. Since last year she has been making the household's financial decisions alone. Nine years ago, she and her husband started out planting peas, lettuce, and potatoes in agricultural land with they rented. The help that this business provided them was primordial and important. Last she worked at a private company which is in charge of producing a hydroelectric dam in the region. Nilda now dedicates all of her strength in maintaining her cultivations and to plant as she always did during the year. What she most enjoys about her work is the harvest season because this is when she is able to see all of her efforts materialized and she is able to sell the food products in the wholesalers market in the city of Tarma. Currently she wants to improve the quality of her plantation to be able to earn the necessary capital funds to start up a grocery store in her locality. 

She is a member of the communal bank "Linda Amanecer de Cumutay", meaning "A Beautiful Dawn in Cumutay". It is her second loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she hopes to have your support in helping her reach her objectives. She is committed to making her loan payments on time. Nilda, on receiving your support, will invest the funds she requested in the purchase of a sack of pea seeds to successful start up her next plantation.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of pea seeds.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 48 years old and lives in Poblacion Sur, Maria, Siquijor Province. She is married and has two children.

Elsie sells fresh fish for a living. She has been doing this for 21 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Elsie has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for five months.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Saida

texts.es:
Saida nació en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 20 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a traer fruta del valle de Yanatile con su suegra, ellas distribuyen sus productos en el mercado de Racsa de la ciudad del Cusco, ella también está estudiando la carrera profesional de Contabilidad en la institución privada Khipu. 

Saida requiere el préstamo para pagar sus matriculas de sus estudios. El sueño de la socia es ser profesional.

El Banco Comunal “Siempre Adelante” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Saida was born in the city of Calca in the province of Cusco (Peru). She is 20 years old. She is in a common-law marriage from which she has one child. Currently, she lives and works in the city of Cusco. She works with her mother-in-law transporting fruit from the Yanatile valley to Cusco where they distribute the produce in the Racsa market.
