She is also studying professional accounting at the private institution Khipu.

Saida is asking for the loan in order to pay her tuition fees. Her dream is to become a professional.

The communal bank "Siempre Adelante" (Always Moving Forwards) meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is well known as a popular tourist area, centre of commerce and for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi. It is also close to one of the seven wonders of the world Machupicchu".

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Francisca Magaly

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí conocimos a Francisca, tiene años 29 de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para poder salir adelante en su negocio y en su vida diaria.

Nuestra amiga es una mujer muy luchadora que el gusta valerse por sí misma y con esto ayudar a sus padres que ya están ancianos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, así como también a la venta de productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los  días, ella  deja a crédito  y cobra cada semana o a fin de mes pero en un solo pago. Lleva 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, perfumes, cremas y bisutería.

Su sueño es tener una boutique en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The July 22nd Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial area, the traditional festivals for St. Peter and St. Paul, and the joy of its people.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Francisca. She is 29 years old, single, and lives at the home of her parents. Francisca has participated in three loan cycles with her Communal Bank and likes the assistance she has received to help her move forward in her business and in her daily life.

Francisca is a determined woman who likes being on her own and helping her elderly parents. She sells clothing of all types as well as Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Francisca sells by going door-to-door and taking orders from her customers. She works every day, extends credit to her customers, and collects a single payment either at the end of the week or the end of the month. Francisca has been in business for nine years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts, perfumes, crèmes, and trinkets. Her dream is to have a boutique in the central part of the city.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts, perfumes, crèmes, and trinkets.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Jeronimo en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Francisca, la socia tiene 41 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la atención de su panificadora, la socia tiene una panificadora y ella está encargada de abrir el horno, poner leñas, y verificar la maza y salida de los panes en general ella se encarga de ver todo el proceso de la elaboración de los panes, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de levadura, harina, moldes para la realización de los panes, la socia a diario saca 200 panes de cada tipo, ella tiene el apoyo de sus esposo en cuanto a la atención de la panadería, la socia en esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura para la elaboración de los panes.
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women) Community Bank located in the San Jeronimo district in the province and department of Cuzco.

Her name is Francisca and she is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She has a bakery and is in charge of opening the oven, putting in firewood, checking the dough, and removing the bread. She is basically in charge of the whole bread-making process. She wants a loan to invest in yeast, flour, and bread pans. Every day she makes 200 breads of all different kinds. She has the support of her husband when it comes to working in the bakery.

She is thankful for the support you will provide her and promises to be disciplined with making the payments.

loans.use: buy  flour and yeast to make bread

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe deggo est créé le 25 Mars 2001. Le nom "Deggo" signifie entente.
Mme Khady est la responsable du groupe. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite avec la main levée. Elle est mariée et elle a 08 enfants en charge, dont certains sont des enfants de sa coépouse.
Mme Khady fait un commerce de détails au marché de sa localité. Elle possède un étal au marché et vend des légumes, du citron et de l'huile de palme.
Avec ce crédit, cette dame va acheter des marchandises pour les revendre en détails.
Les bénéfices générés vont permettre à cette brave dame d'aider son mari pour la scolarité des enfants, et aussi d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
Deggo Group (harmony) was created on March 25, 2001.

Mrs Khady, standing on the right side of the photo and raising her hand, chairs the group. She is married and has eight children in her care. Some of the children are those of her cowife. Mrs Khady sells grocery products at the market of her village. She has a market stall, where she sells vegetables, lemons and palm oil. She will use her loan to buy groceries for resale. The profit from the activity will enable this brave lady to help her husband to provide education to the children, and also to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy various groceries for resale at the local market.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 33 years old. She is married with 4 children.
Victoria has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Victoria  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Victoria  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Mekhrab

texts.en:
Mekhrab is a farmer from the village of Paris, East Georgia. He is 56 years old, married, and lives with his wife, Dilara, and his 25 year-old son. Mekhrab’s son works as singer in a local restaurant. He is a musician. 

Mekhrab and Dilara are leading the agricultural business of the family. They own 1.3 hectares of land, where potato, maize and pumpkins are grown. Mekhrab sells his products in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). Total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris (approximately 540 USD). 

Mekhrab requested credit to purchase seeds for potatoes. He will purchase quality seeds and sow them in the plot. During the winter, Mekhrab and Dilara will work hard in order to get a quality harvest. They hope that the weather conditions will be favorable as well, and will sell harvested products for a good price. The family will use the received income for improving family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds of potatoes

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en: Arthur is a father of three children. He is engaged in a corn farm business. He has been in this field for four years and earns 38,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) every harvest season. His wife also sells pancit (noodles) in the village where they are living for additional income. They work hard to give his children a good quality of life and lift them from poor living conditions. At this time, Arthur wants a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy corn seedlings and fertilizers, and to pay for the labor cost for planting. He hopes to grow his business and harvest more corn to sell.

loans.use: to buy corn seedlings and fertilizers, and to pay for the labor cost for planting.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: La socia Hilaria continua con su taller de mecanica, la socia se dedica  a la atencion y cobranza de su taller, la socia requiere el prestamo en esta ocasion para invertir en la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de trompos de construcción; para la fabricacion de estos trompos la socia comprara planchas gruesas de 3.16, selladora, mezcladora, eje de 3 octavos, angular. La socia con la fabricacion de estos trompos tiene mayores ingresos y desea seguir creciendo y apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos y darles mejor calidad de vida, la socia desea seguir prosperando y volverse en empresaria mayorista. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de los materiales mencionados para la fabricacion de trompos de construcción.
texts.en: Hilaria is continuing her auto repair shop. She handles customer service and collections in the repair shop. Hilaria needs the loan on this occasion to invest in the purchase of materials for the manufacture of cement mixers. To manufacture these mixers, she will purchase thick steel plates, a sealer, a mixer, and a 3/8 angular axle. Hilaria will have greater income with the manufacture of these cement mixers and she wants to continue growing to support her children in their studies and give them a better quality of life. She would like to continue prospering and become a wholesaler. She requests the loan to invest in the purchase of the aforementioned materials to manufacture cement mixers.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of materials to manufacture cement mixers.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 47-year-old, married man with four children. He sells chicken, a business he has been in for eight years.  Mahmoud's customers approve of his good quality products. 

To improve his business, Mahmoud requests a loan from KIVA partner Al Majmoua.  He will use the loan to buy a new car for his business.  The car will help Mahmoud transport requested products from wholesale stores to his shop.  Mahmoud received a previous loan from Al Majmoua and it helped to increase his capital, which in turn led to his ability to respond to an increased number of customer needs.  Mahmoud is in good standing as a borrower.

loans.use: To buy a car to transport wholesale chicken products to his shop for sale.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Mila is married and has three school-aged children.

To make a living, Mila owns and operates a tricycle transport service. (A tricycle is a motorcycle with a passenger cab.) Mila has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Mila is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the cost of maintenance and repair of the motorcycle.

In 2006, Mila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of maintenance and repair of the motorcycle

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
El Sr. Derlis tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Caaguazú. El comenta que se dedica a la venta ambulante de artículos electrónicos, lentes de sol y demás productos.
Derlis se dedica a este trabajo hace mas de 5 años, empezó con un pequeño ahorro que tenia, con ese tiempo y gracias a los créditos concedidos por nuestra entidad y de esa manera fue ampliando su stock de productos y pudo crecer y salir adelante. Derlis desea ir ampliando su negocio ya que el sustenta de su familia y por lo tanto desea brindarles una vida digna a sus padres, ya que están viejos y desea que tengan una vejez digna.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de productos electrónicos como ser radios pequeños, walkman y demás tipos, con lo cual podrá abastecerse. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Sr. Derlis is 28 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the city of Caaguazú. He says that he sells electronic goods, sunglasses, and other products as a traveling salesman.

Derlis has been in this type of work for more than five years. He started out using a small amount of savings that he accumulated. Over the course of time and with the loans from Fundación Paraguaya, Derlis was able to expand his inventory of products so that he could grow and move forward. He wants to increase his business so that he can sustain his family and provide a decent life for his parents. They are elderly and would like to have a decent retirement.

Derlis is requesting a loan to buy electronic goods such as miniature radios, Walkmans, and other products so that he can restock his inventory. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for giving him this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy miniature radios, Walkmans, and other electronic goods.

loans.name: Kojo

texts.en: Kojo is married and has 5 dependents. His wife is a trader. Kojo produces and sells charcoal in Asebu Brebia. Kojo uses his income for the general upkeep of his family. Kojo will use the loan to purchase more firewood for the production of charcoal to sell. With the new profits, Kojo plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood for the production of charcoal.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man.  He has 4 children and 3 are enrolled in school. Said operates a coconut selling business and sells his goods wholesale. He has worked in this business for 4 years and was previously employed as a seller of fried fish. His primary customers are coconut firms. Said's other source of income includes a motorcycle repairs business. He describes his greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation.  His highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Said will use the Kes 25000 loan to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. Said aspires to increase his number of coconuts to supply more in the future.  He joined Yehu to access funds.

loans.use: buy coconuts

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 42-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He has worked as a blacksmith since 2002 and has gained a great experience. To be able to afford the high costs of living and meet his family needs, Mohammad was obliged to work continually. Although he stated that his financials are barely enough, this is why he is requesting today to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase added metal for his business. This will definitely boost his business operations, thus his profits. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase added metal for his business

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a married man. He describes himself to be genuine and business-minded. He operates a grocery store where he sell vegetables. He has been involved in this business for sixyears. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are individuals. 

Anthony describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes and the perishability of goods. He will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of vegetables. He hopes that in the future, he will be a supplier. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Fana Baka's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place en Octobre 2015. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’agriculture en période hivernale.

Madame Fana Baka (debout à droite avec une main levée), est emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle  s’active dans l‘agriculture et la vente en détails.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 03 sacs de 50 kg d’arachide le décortiqué pour le revendre en détails dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Les bénéfices sont destinés à la participation de la prise en charge de sa famille (habillements, soins médicaux habillement etc.…)
texts.en:
This group was put in place in October 2015. It is made up of women who are determined to change their living conditions. They all live in the same village and share strong relations of solidarity and mutual help. Their main activity is petty trade and agriculture in the winter period.

Mrs Fana Baka (standing on the right with her hand raised), is the group's featured borrower. She is 32 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She works in agriculture and retail sales. With this loan, she intends to buy 3 50-kg bags of groundnuts, shell them to retail them in weekly markets. The profits will go towards caring for her family (clothing, medical care, clothing, etc...)

loans.use: to buy 3 50-kg bags of groundnuts and shell them to retail them in weekly markets.
